analyzed: slob ma rdo rje sems dpar bskyed nas byin gyis brlabs la zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du bzhag ste /

analyzed: dril bu dkrol zhing mchod pa rnam pa lngas mchod la /

analyzed: bkra shis 'don cing rnam par rgyal ba'i bum pa'am / sarba bit kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i rdo rje sems dpa'i bum pa las rdo rje khu tshur gyis chu blangs pa de dang / aom badzra aa bhi shinytsa zhes bya ba'i sngags 'dis spyi bo nas dbang bskur bar bya'o //
translated: and the auspicious verses.🔽Then, with the mantra Oṃ vajrâbhiṣiñca hūṃ, he should confer the empowerment on the head with water from the victorious vase or the vajra-mind vase consecrated with all the vitarka.

original: de nas dbu rgyan gyi dbang dang / me tog gi phreng ba'i dbang bskur ba dang // phyag rgya'i phreng ba'i dbang dang / rdo rje'i dbang bskur ba dang / dril bu'i dbang bskur ba dang / bdag po'i dbang bskur ba dang / ming gi dbang bskur ba thams cad la me tog la sogs pa'i mchod pa lnga po re dang dbang rer sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas dbu rgyan gyi dbang dang / me tog gi phreng ba'i dbang bskur ba dang // phyag rgya'i phreng ba'i dbang dang / rdo rje'i dbang bskur ba dang / dril bu'i dbang bskur ba dang / bdag po'i dbang bskur ba dang / ming gi dbang bskur ba thams cad la me tog la sogs pa'i mchod pa lnga po re dang dbang rer sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Then, for all the empowerments of the crown, the flower garland, the seal garland, the vajra, the bell, the lord, and the name, he should apply the five offerings such as flowers to each empowerment.

original: ming gi dbang la sogs pa bskur bar bsrung pa 'di thams cad kyis kyang phyir mi ldog pa'i sa bon bskyed pa'i phyir yin pas sdom pa gzung ba dang / sdom pa gzung ba'i spyi'i dbang bskur ba yin no //
analyzed: ming gi dbang la sogs pa bskur bar bsrung pa 'di thams cad kyis kyang phyir mi ldog pa'i sa bon bskyed pa'i phyir yin pas sdom pa gzung ba dang / sdom pa gzung ba'i spyi'i dbang bskur ba yin no //
translated: Since all of these vows are for the sake of generating the seed of irreversibility in the empowerment of the name and so on, they are the vows to be taken and the general empowerment to be taken.

original: slob dpon du dbang bskur bar 'os pa rnams kyis ni khyad par yod par bshad de /
analyzed: slob dpon du dbang bskur bar 'os pa rnams kyis ni khyad par yod par bshad de /

original: slob dpon du dbang bskur bar 'os pa dkyil 'khor chen por bcug la dkyil 'khor gyi de kho na nyid dang / lha'i de kho nyid dang ; slob dpon gyi las thams cad bslab par bya ste /

translated: Those who are suitable for the master empowerment should be inducted into the great maṇḍala and should be trained in the reality of the maṇḍala, the reality of the deity, and all the activities of the master.

original: 'di tsam gyis ni gsang ba'i dbang bskur ba yin no zhes bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'dzin pas gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di tsam gyis ni gsang ba'i dbang bskur ba yin no zhes bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'dzin pas gsungs te /

translated: The enclosure of the great vehicle is the enclosure of the great vehicle.🔽The enclosure of the vajra vehicle is the enclosure of the vajra vehicle.🔽The enclosure of the three vehicles is the enclosure of the three vehicles.🔽The enclosure of the three vehicles is the enclosure of the three vehicles.🔽The enclosure of the great vehicle is the enclosure of the great vehicle.🔽The enclosure of the vajra vehicle is the enclosure of the vajra vehicle.

analyzed: gsum ba gser gyi mdog can ni rin chen dpal gyi dkyil 'khor te /

analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs ston par byed pa yin no //

analyzed: bzhi pa padma r'a ga'i mdog can ni sh'akya thub pa'i dkyil 'khor te /

analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i thugs rje chen po dang / ting nge 'dzin dang ; gzungs dang rnam par thar pa la sogs pa ston par byed pa yin no //
translated: It teaches great compassion that is not an object, and samādhi, dhāraṇī, liberation, and so on.

original: lnga pa margad kyi mdog can ni me tog cher rgyas kyi dkyil 'khor te /
analyzed: lnga pa margad kyi mdog can ni me tog cher rgyas kyi dkyil 'khor te /
translated: The fifth is the mandala of Mahāku muda, the color of an emerald.

original: sems can smin pa dang grol bar byed pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i lam 'bras bu dang bcas pa'i thob pa las byung pa theg pa chen po gzhan gyi lta ba dang bral ba yin no zhes bya ba ni dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: sems can smin pa dang grol bar byed pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i lam 'bras bu dang bcas pa'i thob pa las byung pa theg pa chen po gzhan gyi lta ba dang bral ba yin no zhes bya ba ni dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: It is the Mahāyāna free from the views of other vehicles, arisen from the attainment of the path of the bodhisattva with its fruit, which matures and liberates sentient beings.

original: 'khor lo rtsibs bcu drug par 'byung ba ni rten 'brel bcu gnyis dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi dang // stod pa bcu drug rnam par dag pa yin no //
analyzed: 'khor lo rtsibs bcu drug par 'byung ba ni rten 'brel bcu gnyis dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi dang // stod pa bcu drug rnam par dag pa yin no //
translated: The appearance of the wheel with sixteen spokes indicates the purification of the twelve links of dependent origination, the four foundations of mindfulness, and the sixteen aspects of the truths.

original: kha dog lnga po ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams sems can gyi @43b khams la pha rol tu phyin pa drug gis chags pa yin no zhes de ston par byed pa'o //
analyzed: kha dog lnga po ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams sems can gyi @43b khams la pha rol tu phyin pa drug gis chags pa yin no zhes de ston par byed pa'o //
translated: The five colors indicate the Tathāgatas’ attachment to the realms of sentient beings through the six perfections.

original: bum pa ni gang gi tshe bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi bdud rtsi gsol bar bstan pa yin la /
analyzed: bum pa ni gang gi tshe bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi bdud rtsi gsol bar bstan pa yin la /
translated: The vase indicates the Blessed One’s offering of the nectar of nondual gnosis to all the Tathāgatas.

original: bum pa gang ba ni byang chub thob par byed pa'i bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs pa yin no zhes pa'i don ston pa'o //
analyzed: bum pa gang ba ni byang chub thob par byed pa'i bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs pa yin no zhes pa'i don ston pa'o //
translated: The full vase indicates the completion of the accumulations of merit and gnosis that bring about the attainment of awakening.

original: gang du bzlas pa yang dag bshad //
analyzed: gang du bzlas pa yang dag bshad //
translated: Where the recitation is explained,

original: de nyid gsal bar ston pa yin //
analyzed: de nyid gsal bar ston pa yin //
translated: That itself is clearly shown.

original: gang phyir 'di ni yang dag bshad //
analyzed: gang phyir 'di ni yang dag bshad //
translated: Since this is correctly explained,

original: grags pa'i dri ni bla na med //
analyzed: grags pa'i dri ni bla na med //
translated: The fame of its scent is unsurpassed.

original: rdzu 'phrul 'jug pa gang yin pa //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul 'jug pa gang yin pa //
translated: The miracles are the entrance.

original: tshul khrims dri ni bla na med //
analyzed: tshul khrims dri ni bla na med //
translated: The smell of discipline is unsurpassed.

original: bza' ba rnam pa sna tshogs ni //
analyzed: bza' ba rnam pa sna tshogs ni //
translated: The various kinds of food

original: chos kyi zas ni bla na med //
analyzed: chos kyi zas ni bla na med //
translated: are the unsurpassed food of Dharma.

original: lha yi gar bshad sna tshogs pa //
analyzed: lha yi gar bshad sna tshogs pa //
translated: The various kinds of divine dance

original: rtog pa thams cad rnam 'phel ba'o //
analyzed: rtog pa thams cad rnam 'phel ba'o //
translated: are the increase of all conceptualizations.

original: grong khyer du ni gang bshad pa //
analyzed: grong khyer du ni gang bshad pa //
translated: What is explained in the city

original: de nyid thar pa'i grong khyer bzang //
analyzed: de nyid thar pa'i grong khyer bzang //
translated: is the excellent city of liberation.

original: dkyil 'khor du ni gang bshad pa //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor du ni gang bshad pa //
translated: What is explained in the maṇḍala

original: chos kyi rang bzhin grong khyer yin //
analyzed: chos kyi rang bzhin grong khyer yin //
translated: is the city of the nature of Dharma.”

original: zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so //
translated: Thus it was spoken by the Bhagavān.

original: yang mi'u thung lta bu zhal bzhi pa gsus khyim che ba ral pa can dkyil 'khor kyi bdag po'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i tshogs lta bu zhal bzhi po de dkyil 'khor gyi sgor yongs su gyur /
analyzed: yang mi'u thung lta bu zhal bzhi pa gsus khyim che ba ral pa can dkyil 'khor kyi bdag po'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i tshogs lta bu zhal bzhi po de dkyil 'khor gyi sgor yongs su gyur /
translated: Again, the four-faced one, who is like a dwarf, with a large belly, and with matted hair, who is endowed with the qualities of the lord of the maṇḍala, and the four faces completely transform into the gate of the maṇḍala.

original: gdul bya rnams rang gi skur zhugs par mdzad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gdul bya rnams rang gi skur zhugs par mdzad pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to cause the disciples to enter into his body,

original: de rnams kyang sdig pa sel cing sangs rgyas kyi yon tan bskyed par mdzad pas bzhugs par gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi gzugs can bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyang sdig pa sel cing sangs rgyas kyi yon tan bskyed par mdzad pas bzhugs par gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi gzugs can bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Since they also remove evil and generate the qualities of a Buddha, they are to be meditated upon as having the form of the secret mandala.

original: de rnams la lha rnams kyi de kho na nyid sum cu rtsa bdun te de brjod par bya'o /
analyzed: de rnams la lha rnams kyi de kho na nyid sum cu rtsa bdun te de brjod par bya'o /
translated: The reality of those deities is thirty-seven, which is to be expressed.

original: dkyil 'khor thams cad kyi dbus na bzhugs ba ni bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad de /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor thams cad kyi dbus na bzhugs ba ni bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad de /
translated: The one who resides in the center of all mandalas is the Lord Vairocana,

original: sangs rgyas thams cad gcig tu bsdus par gyur pa la sogs pa'i tshul mdzes par snang ba yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad gcig tu bsdus par gyur pa la sogs pa'i tshul mdzes par snang ba yin no //
translated: the one who is beautiful in the manner of being the condensation of all Buddhas, and so forth.

original: bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi byang chub kyi mtshan nyid can gyi thugs gang yin pa de ni ngan song thams cad yongs su sbyong ba'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi byang chub kyi mtshan nyid can gyi thugs gang yin pa de ni ngan song thams cad yongs su sbyong ba'o //
translated: The mind of the Lord Vairocana, which has the characteristic of enlightenment, is the Purifier of All Evil Destinies.

original: bcom ldan 'das ngan song sbyong ba de nyid rnam pa bzhir 'dod de /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ngan song sbyong ba de nyid rnam pa bzhir 'dod de /
translated: That very Lord Purifier of Evil Destinies is asserted to be of four kinds:

original: de'i rgyu'i gnas skabs kyi byang chub kyi thugs dang / 'bras bur gyur pa'i thugs gang yin pa de ni rdo rje sems dpa'o //
analyzed: de'i rgyu'i gnas skabs kyi byang chub kyi thugs dang / 'bras bur gyur pa'i thugs gang yin pa de ni rdo rje sems dpa'o //
translated: The mind of enlightenment in the causal state of that, and the mind which is the result, is Vajrasattva.

original: de nyid kyi bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi'i spyod pa dang 'bras bu'i thugs ni rdo rje rgyal po'o //🔽de nyid kyi sems can smin pa dang grol @44a * //
analyzed: de nyid kyi bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi'i spyod pa dang 'bras bu'i thugs ni rdo rje rgyal po'o // de nyid kyi sems can smin pa dang grol @44a * //
translated: The mind of the conduct and result of the four means of gathering disciples of that very [Vajrasattva] is Vajrarāja.

original: bar mdzad pa'i thugs gang yin pa dang / de bzhin du lam bsgoms pa dang / 'bras bu'i rang bzhin gyi thugs gang yin pa de ni rdo rje chags pa'o //
analyzed: bar mdzad pa'i thugs gang yin pa dang / de bzhin du lam bsgoms pa dang / 'bras bu'i rang bzhin gyi thugs gang yin pa de ni rdo rje chags pa'o //
translated: The mind which accomplishes the maturation and liberation of sentient beings of that very [Vajrarāja], and likewise the mind which is the nature of the path of meditation and the result, is Vajrarāga.

original: de nyid kyi phyir pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi spyod ba dang / 'bras bu'i thugs gang yin pa de ni rdo rje legs ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi spyod ba dang / 'bras bu'i thugs gang yin pa de ni rdo rje legs ba'o //
translated: The mind of the conduct and result of the six perfections of that very [Vajrarāga] is Vajrasādhu.

original: bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa rin chen dpal lo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa rin chen dpal lo //
translated: The perfection of generosity of the Bhagavān Vairocana is the Tathāgata Ratnaprabha.

original: rin chen dpal de yang nor dang mi 'jigs pa dang / byams pa dang / chos sbyin pa'i tshul gyis rnam pa bzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rin chen dpal de yang nor dang mi 'jigs pa dang / byams pa dang / chos sbyin pa'i tshul gyis rnam pa bzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: That jewel glory is fourfold by way of the gifts of wealth, fearlessness, love, and the Dharma.

original: de la nor sbyin pa'i spyod pa dang / nor sbyin pa'i 'bras bu gang yin pa de ni rdo rje rin chen no //
analyzed: de la nor sbyin pa'i spyod pa dang / nor sbyin pa'i 'bras bu gang yin pa de ni rdo rje rin chen no //
translated: The vajra jewel is the practice of giving wealth and the result of giving wealth.

original: mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa'i spyod pa dang / mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa'i 'bras bu gang yin pa de ni rdo rje nyi ma'o //
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa'i spyod pa dang / mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa'i 'bras bu gang yin pa de ni rdo rje nyi ma'o //
translated: The vajra sun is the practice of giving fearlessness and the result of giving fearlessness.

original: byams pa'i sbyin pa'i spyod ba dang / de'i 'bras bu gang yin pa de ni rdo rje dpal lo //🔽chos sbyin pa'i spyod pa'o //
analyzed: byams pa'i sbyin pa'i spyod ba dang / de'i 'bras bu gang yin pa de ni rdo rje dpal lo // chos sbyin pa'i spyod pa'o //
translated: The vajra glory is the practice of giving love and its result.

original: chos sbyin pa'i 'bras bu gang yin pa de ni rdo rje bzhad pa'o //
analyzed: chos sbyin pa'i 'bras bu gang yin pa de ni rdo rje bzhad pa'o //
translated: The vajra smile is the practice of giving the Dharma and its result.

original: bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa sh'akya thub pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa sh'akya thub pa'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom of the Bhagavat Vairocana is the Tathagata Sakyamuni.

original: bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa'i chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis dag pa'o zhes thugs rtse gcig pa nyid kyi rnam pa'i shes rab kyi spyod pa dang / de'i 'bras bu gang yin pa de ni rdo rje chos so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa'i chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis dag pa'o zhes thugs rtse gcig pa nyid kyi rnam pa'i shes rab kyi spyod pa dang / de'i 'bras bu gang yin pa de ni rdo rje chos so //
translated: The wisdom activity of the Bhagavat Sakyamuni, which is the single-pointed mind that all phenomena are pure by nature, and the result of that is Vajradharma.

original: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spong bar byed pa'i phyir shes rab bsgoms pa dang / de'i 'bras bu gang yin pa de ni rdo rje rnon po'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spong bar byed pa'i phyir shes rab bsgoms pa dang / de'i 'bras bu gang yin pa de ni rdo rje rnon po'o //
translated: The cultivation of wisdom in order to abandon the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience, and the result of that is Vajratīkṣṇa.

original: rdo rje dbyings la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor sprul pa'i rnam pa'i shes rab dang / de'i 'bras bu gang yin pa de ni rdo rje rgyu'o ;
analyzed: rdo rje dbyings la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor sprul pa'i rnam pa'i shes rab dang / de'i 'bras bu gang yin pa de ni rdo rje rgyu'o ;
translated: The wisdom activity of emanating the maṇḍala of the vajra realm and so forth, and the result of that is Vajrahetu.

original: / sh'akya thub pa'i de nyid kyi so so yang dag pa'i rig pa bzhi rang bzhin gyis spyod pa gang yin pa dang / de'i 'bras bu gang yin pa de ni rdo rje smra ba'o //
analyzed: / sh'akya thub pa'i de nyid kyi so so yang dag pa'i rig pa bzhi rang bzhin gyis spyod pa gang yin pa dang / de'i 'bras bu gang yin pa de ni rdo rje smra ba'o //
translated: The activity of the four correct knowledges that are the reality of Śākyamuni, and the result of that is Vajra-bhaṣa.

original: bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi brtson 'grub kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa de ni me tog cher rgyas so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi brtson 'grub kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa de ni me tog cher rgyas so //
translated: The perfection of effort of the Bhagavat Vairocana is Mahāpuspa.

original: bcom ldan 'das me tog cher rgyas de yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das me tog cher rgyas de yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The Bhagavat Mahāpuspa has four aspects:

original: me tog cher rgyas des sangs rgyas sprul pa'i phyir brtson 'grus gang bsgoms pa'i spyod pa dang / sems can smin par bya ba'i spyod pa dang / de dag gi 'bras bu gang yin pa de ni rdo rje las so //
analyzed: me tog cher rgyas des sangs rgyas sprul pa'i phyir brtson 'grus gang bsgoms pa'i spyod pa dang / sems can smin par bya ba'i spyod pa dang / de dag gi 'bras bu gang yin pa de ni rdo rje las so //
translated: The effort that he cultivates in order to emanate Buddhas by means of that Mahāpuspa, the practice of maturing beings, and the result of those, that is Vajrakarma.

original: theg pa gzhan 'dod pa'i sems kyis 'jigs pa las sems @44b bsrung ba'i brtson 'grus gang yin pa dang / de'i 'bras bu gang yin pa de ni rdo rje bsrung ba'o //
analyzed: theg pa gzhan 'dod pa'i sems kyis 'jigs pa las sems @44b bsrung ba'i brtson 'grus gang yin pa dang / de'i 'bras bu gang yin pa de ni rdo rje bsrung ba'o //
translated: The effort that he cultivates in order to protect the mind from fear by the wish for another vehicle, and the result of that, that is Vajravarman.

original: chos rnams rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba gdod nas dag pa nam mkha' dang mnyam pa zhes bya bar so sor rtog pa'i brtson 'grus bsgoms pa 'dis 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa za ba dang / gdug pa thams cad za ba dang /
analyzed: chos rnams rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba gdod nas dag pa nam mkha' dang mnyam pa zhes bya bar so sor rtog pa'i brtson 'grus bsgoms pa 'dis 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa za ba dang / gdug pa thams cad za ba dang /
translated: This is the vajra-yakṣa, who devours the afflictions such as desire, the secondary afflictions, and all the poisons.

original: de'i 'bras bu gang yin pa de ni rdo rje gnod sbyin no //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu gang yin pa de ni rdo rje gnod sbyin no //
translated: The result of that is the vajra-fist.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang / gsung dang / thugs rdo rje'i rang bzhin du bsgoms pa'i brtson 'grus dang / de'i 'bras bu gang yin pa de ni rdo rje khu tshur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang / gsung dang / thugs rdo rje'i rang bzhin du bsgoms pa'i brtson 'grus dang / de'i 'bras bu gang yin pa de ni rdo rje khu tshur ro //
translated: The striving of meditating on the nature of the vajra body, speech, and mind of all the tathāgatas, and the result of that is the vajra-fist.

original: bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi byang chub kyis thugs bsdus par gyur pa gang yin pa de ni rdo rje sems ma dang sangs rgyas spyan no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi byang chub kyis thugs bsdus par gyur pa gang yin pa de ni rdo rje sems ma dang sangs rgyas spyan no //
translated: The one who is gathered into the mind of the Bhagavān Vairocana is the vajra-mind, the vajra-woman, and the buddha-eye.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bsdus par gyur pa gang yin pa de ni rin chen sems ma dang m'a ma k'i'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bsdus par gyur pa gang yin pa de ni rin chen sems ma dang m'a ma k'i'o //
translated: The one who is the embodiment of the perfection of generosity is Ratnasattva and Māmakī.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsdus par gyur pa gang yin pa de ni chos ma dang gos dkar mo'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsdus par gyur pa gang yin pa de ni chos ma dang gos dkar mo'o //
translated: The one who is the embodiment of the perfection of wisdom is Dharmasattva and Pāṇḍaravāsinī.

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsdus par gyur pa gang yin pa de ni las ma dang dam tshig sgrol ma'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsdus par gyur pa gang yin pa de ni las ma dang dam tshig sgrol ma'o //
translated: The one who is the embodiment of the perfection of effort is Karma-sattva and Samaya-Tārā.

original: de nyid kyi sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang ; shes rab dang / smon lam dang / thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa de ni lha mo las sgeg mo dang /
analyzed: de nyid kyi sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang ; shes rab dang / smon lam dang / thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa de ni lha mo las sgeg mo dang /
translated: The one who is the perfection of generosity, morality, patience, effort, concentration, wisdom, aspiration, and means is the goddesses Lāsya,

original: phreng ba ma dang / glu ma dang / gar ma dang / bdug pa ma dang / me tog ma dang / mar me ma dang / byug pa ma yin no //
analyzed: phreng ba ma dang / glu ma dang / gar ma dang / bdug pa ma dang / me tog ma dang / mar me ma dang / byug pa ma yin no //
translated: Mālā, Gītā, Nṛtya, Dhūpā, Puṣpā, Dīpā, and Gandhā.

original: bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyis byang chub kyi thugs bskyed nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyis byang chub kyi thugs bskyed nas /
translated: The Blessed One Vairocana, having generated the mind of enlightenment,

original: thar pa'i grong khyer chen por sems can rnams 'dren par mdzad pa'i phrin las gang yin pa de ni rdo rje lcags kyu'o //
analyzed: thar pa'i grong khyer chen por sems can rnams 'dren par mdzad pa'i phrin las gang yin pa de ni rdo rje lcags kyu'o //

original: byang chub kyi spyod pa'i zhags pas sems can gzhug par mdzad pa gang yin pa de ni rdo rje zhags pa'o //🔽byang chub kyi bsam gtan gyis theg pa gzhan la 'dod pa las sems rab tu dral te /
analyzed: byang chub kyi spyod pa'i zhags pas sems can gzhug par mdzad pa gang yin pa de ni rdo rje zhags pa'o // byang chub kyi bsam gtan gyis theg pa gzhan la 'dod pa las sems rab tu dral te /
translated: The activity of binding with the concentration of enlightenment is the vajra bell.🔽The activity of binding with the concentration of enlightenment is the vajra bell.🔽The activity of binding with the concentration of enlightenment is the vajra bell.

original: 'ching bar mdzad pa gang yin pa de ni rdo rje lcags sgrog go //🔽bcing pa 'bebs pas rjes su chags par mdzad pa gang yin pa de ni rdo rje 'bebs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'ching bar mdzad pa gang yin pa de ni rdo rje lcags sgrog go // bcing pa 'bebs pas rjes su chags par mdzad pa gang yin pa de ni rdo rje 'bebs pa yin no //
translated: The activity of binding with the concentration of enlightenment is the vajra bell.🔽The activity of binding with the concentration of enlightenment is the vajra bell.🔽The activity of binding with the concentration of enlightenment is the vajra bell.🔽The activity of binding with the concentration of enlightenment is the vajra bell.

translated: are the guardians of the great city of the true Dharma.

translated: The Sravakas and Pratyekabuddhas are the guardians of the small vehicle city through the four truths and the twelve links of dependent origination.

original: 'jig rten gsum snang la sogs pa'i khro bo rnams ni rnam par thar pa brgyad rnam par dag pa las byung ba'o //🔽'jig rten pa la sogs pa rnams ni theg pa che chung snod ji lta ba bzhin du /

translated: The wrathful ones, such as Lokeshvara, arise from the purification of the eight liberations.

original: ngan song las drangs te gnas par bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ngan song las drangs te gnas par bya ba'i don to //
translated: The worldly ones, etc., are for the sake of leading beings out of the lower realms and establishing them in accordance with their vessel, whether of the great or small vehicle.

translated: Here, all of these

analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' zhes brjod nas //

translated: All of this, which has been explained, is the work of the vajra master.

original: da ni dbang bskur ba'i cho ga brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni dbang bskur ba'i cho ga brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, the consecration ritual should be stated.

original: rtsa ba'i dkyil 'khor las khru gnyis dor bar shar sgor bltas pa dang / dkyil 'khor dbus ma'i phyed kyi tshad tsam zur bzhi pa sgo nub tu bstod pa'i dkyil 'khor tshon sna lngas bris la /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i dkyil 'khor las khru gnyis dor bar shar sgor bltas pa dang / dkyil 'khor dbus ma'i phyed kyi tshad tsam zur bzhi pa sgo nub tu bstod pa'i dkyil 'khor tshon sna lngas bris la /
translated: Two cubits away from the root mandala, facing east, and the size of half the central mandala, one should draw a square mandala with five colors, facing west.

original: de'i dbus su padma 'dab ma brgyad /
analyzed: de'i dbus su padma 'dab ma brgyad /
translated: In its center, there should be an eight-petaled lotus.

original: de'i steng du dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i rdo rje rtse lnga pa kha dog dmar po 'od dmar po'i phreng ba dang ldan pa bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i steng du dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i rdo rje rtse lnga pa kha dog dmar po 'od dmar po'i phreng ba dang ldan pa bri bar bya'o //
translated: On top of that, one should draw a red five-pronged vajra of glorious Vajrasattva, endowed with a garland of red light.

original: de bzhin du lho dang / nub dang / byang sgor bltas pa kun nas zlum par dkyil 'khor gzhan dag bris la /
analyzed: de bzhin du lho dang / nub dang / byang sgor bltas pa kun nas zlum par dkyil 'khor gzhan dag bris la /
translated: In the same way, one should draw other maṇḍalas facing the southern, western and northern gates, all around.

original: de'i dbus su padma 'dab ma brgyad pa /
analyzed: de'i dbus su padma 'dab ma brgyad pa /
translated: In the middle of that, there is an eight-petaled lotus.

original: de'i steng du rdo rje rin po che dang / rdo rje padma dang / sna tshogs rdo rje go rims ji lta ba bzhin bris la /
analyzed: de'i steng du rdo rje rin po che dang / rdo rje padma dang / sna tshogs rdo rje go rims ji lta ba bzhin bris la /
translated: On top of that, one should draw a vajra jewel, a vajra lotus and a crossed vajra, in the proper order.

original: dkyil 'khor de rnams rtsa ba'i dkyil 'khor ji lta ba bzhin mchod nas /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor de rnams rtsa ba'i dkyil 'khor ji lta ba bzhin mchod nas /

analyzed: zhes so // de yan chad kyis dkyil 'khor gyi rim pa bstan nas /
translated: Up to this point, the stages of the maṇḍala have been explained.

original: da ni bsgrub pa'i rim pa bstan te /
analyzed: da ni bsgrub pa'i rim pa bstan te /
translated: Now, the stages of practice are explained.

original: ras la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /🔽ras ni gso ras sam /
analyzed: ras la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / ras ni gso ras sam /
translated: The painting and so on are mentioned.

original: shing bal gyi ras sdig pas ma gos pa la khru brgyad pa'i tshad tsam la sdom pa la rab tu gnas pa rnams kyis bsgrub pa'i dkyil 'khor bri bar bya ste /
analyzed: shing bal gyi ras sdig pas ma gos pa la khru brgyad pa'i tshad tsam la sdom pa la rab tu gnas pa rnams kyis bsgrub pa'i dkyil 'khor bri bar bya ste /
translated: The cloth is a linen cloth or cotton cloth unstained by sin. The size is about eight cubits. Those who are well-established in the vows should draw the maṇḍala for practice.

original: de yang 'dir sku gsum gyi rgyud ces gsungs pas las rnam pa gsum byed de /
analyzed: de yang 'dir sku gsum gyi rgyud ces gsungs pas las rnam pa gsum byed de /
translated: Moreover, here it is called the Tantra of the Three Bodies, and so it performs three kinds of actions.

original: de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: sku'i dngos grub bsgrub pa dang // gsung gi dngos grub bsgrub pa dang // thugs kyi dngos grub bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: sku'i dngos grub bsgrub pa dang // gsung gi dngos grub bsgrub pa dang // thugs kyi dngos grub bsgrub pa'o //
translated: The accomplishment of the body, the accomplishment of speech, and the accomplishment of mind.

original: de yang ji ltar bsgrub par bya snyam pa la /
analyzed: de yang ji ltar bsgrub par bya snyam pa la /
translated: Moreover, how should one accomplish them?

original: de yang ri mo'i sgo nas bsgrub par bya ste /
analyzed: de yang ri mo'i sgo nas bsgrub par bya ste /
translated: They are accomplished by means of a painting.

original: de yang de bzhin gshegs pa dang // de yi rigs kyi sems dpa' dang / rigs kyi khro bo dang / rigs kyi yum rnams bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: de yang de bzhin gshegs pa dang // de yi rigs kyi sems dpa' dang / rigs kyi khro bo dang / rigs kyi yum rnams bri bar bya'o //
translated: One should paint the Tathāgatas, the Bodhisattvas of their family, the wrathful ones of the family, and the consorts of the family.

original: ras kyi stod kyi dbus su bcom ldan 'das thams cad rig pa sku mdog dkar po longs spyod rdzogs pa'i cha byad du bzhugs pa phyag gnyis bsam gtan gyi phyag rgya can seng ge'i gdan la bzhugs pa bri'o //
analyzed: ras kyi stod kyi dbus su bcom ldan 'das thams cad rig pa sku mdog dkar po longs spyod rdzogs pa'i cha byad du bzhugs pa phyag gnyis bsam gtan gyi phyag rgya can seng ge'i gdan la bzhugs pa bri'o //
translated: In the center of the upper part of the cloth, one should paint the Blessed One, Sarvavid, white in color, abiding in the attire of the enjoyment body, with two hands in the mudrā of meditation, seated on a lion throne.

original: g-yas phyogs su thugs kyi bdag po ngan song thams cad yongs su sbyong ba'i rgyal po sku mdog dkar po glang po che'i gdan la bzhugs pa /
analyzed: g-yas phyogs su thugs kyi bdag po ngan song thams cad yongs su sbyong ba'i rgyal po sku mdog dkar po glang po che'i gdan la bzhugs pa /
translated: To the right of the principal figure, one should paint the lord of mind, the king of the purification of all evil destinies, white in color, seated upon an elephant throne,

original: bsam gtan gyi phyag rgya'i steng na rdo rje bsnams pa bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi phyag rgya'i steng na rdo rje bsnams pa bri bar bya'o //
translated: holding a vajra upon a meditation mudra.

original: g-yon phyogs su ni sh'akya thub pa gsung gi rigs te /
analyzed: g-yon phyogs su ni sh'akya thub pa gsung gi rigs te /
translated: To the left, one should paint Shakyamuni, the lineage of speech,

original: sku mdog dmar ser bsam gtan gyi phyag rgya'i steng na padma 'dab ma brgyad pa kha ma bye ba'i nang nag rdo rje gnas pa bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: sku mdog dmar ser bsam gtan gyi phyag rgya'i steng na padma 'dab ma brgyad pa kha ma bye ba'i nang nag rdo rje gnas pa bri bar bya'o //
translated: red in color, holding an eight-petaled lotus with a closed bud and a vajra in the center upon a meditation mudra.

original: sh'akya thub pa'i 'og tu ni kun du spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug sku mdog zla @50b ba lta bu phyag na padma bsnams pa bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: sh'akya thub pa'i 'og tu ni kun du spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug sku mdog zla @50b ba lta bu phyag na padma bsnams pa bri bar bya'o //
translated: Below Shakyamuni, one should paint Avalokiteshvara, the color of the moon, holding a lotus.

original: ngan song sbyong ba'i 'og tu ni phyag na rdo rje sku mdog ljang gu rdo rje dril bu bsnams pa bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: ngan song sbyong ba'i 'og tu ni phyag na rdo rje sku mdog ljang gu rdo rje dril bu bsnams pa bri bar bya'o //
translated: Below the purifier of evil destinies, one should paint Vajrapani, green in color, holding a vajra and a bell.

original: de gnyis kyi dbus su ni sman gyi bla sku mdog sngon po phyag gcig na 'bras bu aa ru ra bsnams pa phyag gcig mchog sbyin pa'i tshul du bzhugs pa bri bar bya'o zhes rigs bsnur ba ni rdo rje gtsug tor gyi rgyud las gsungs so //
analyzed: de gnyis kyi dbus su ni sman gyi bla sku mdog sngon po phyag gcig na 'bras bu aa ru ra bsnams pa phyag gcig mchog sbyin pa'i tshul du bzhugs pa bri bar bya'o zhes rigs bsnur ba ni rdo rje gtsug tor gyi rgyud las gsungs so //
translated: In the middle of those two, one should draw the Medicine Guru, blue in color, holding a myrobalan fruit in one hand and making the gesture of supreme generosity with the other.

original: rta mgrin dang 'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal ba gnyis ni rang gi lha la brten par bri'o //
analyzed: rta mgrin dang 'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal ba gnyis ni rang gi lha la brten par bri'o //
translated: Hayagrīva and Trailokyavijaya should be drawn in dependence on their own deities.

original: de gnyis kyi bar du ni yum bzhi bri ste lo tsa na dang / na bza' dkar mo dang / m'a ma k'i dang / sgrol ma rnams ni rang rang gi mtshan ma phyag na bsnams pa bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: de gnyis kyi bar du ni yum bzhi bri ste lo tsa na dang / na bza' dkar mo dang / m'a ma k'i dang / sgrol ma rnams ni rang rang gi mtshan ma phyag na bsnams pa bri bar bya'o //
translated: In between those two, one should draw the four mothers: Locanā, Māmakī, Pāṇḍaravāsinī, and Tārā, each holding their own hand implements.

original: gzhan rnams ni dkyus na gsal lo //
analyzed: gzhan rnams ni dkyus na gsal lo //
translated: The rest is clear in the text.

original: de nas ri mo sku gzugs mngon par mchod de spyan dbye bar bya'o zhes pa la sogs pa spyan dbye ba ni dang por sngags pa yon tan bcu dang ldan pas rab tu gnas par byas te byin gyi rlabs dang ldan par byas nas gzod gnas dben par🔽bsgrub pa brtsam par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas ri mo sku gzugs mngon par mchod de spyan dbye bar bya'o zhes pa la sogs pa spyan dbye ba ni dang por sngags pa yon tan bcu dang ldan pas rab tu gnas par byas te byin gyi rlabs dang ldan par byas nas gzod gnas dben par bsgrub pa brtsam par bya'o //
translated: Having first consecrated it with the ten qualities of a mantra practitioner, and having endowed it with blessings, one should commence the practice in a secluded place.

original: de nas rtags dang mtshan ma byung nas gdod dngos grub blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas rtags dang mtshan ma byung nas gdod dngos grub blang bar bya'o //
translated: Then, when the signs and marks arise, one should take the spiritual powers.

original: de'i don yang 'di ltar shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i don yang 'di ltar shes par bya ste /
translated: The meaning of that should be understood as follows:

original: dang por slob dpon yon tan bcu dang ldan pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: dang por slob dpon yon tan bcu dang ldan pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: First, the master endowed with the ten qualities is as follows:

original: rigs btsun pa /
analyzed: rigs btsun pa /
translated: Noble family,

original: sems brtan pa /
analyzed: sems brtan pa /
translated: stable mind,

original: spyod pa dul ba ;
analyzed: spyod pa dul ba ;
translated: disciplined conduct,

original: shes rab che ba /
analyzed: shes rab che ba /
translated: great wisdom,

original: bzod pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: bzod pa dang ldan pa /
translated: endowed with patience,🔽upright,

original: drang ba / g-yo sgyu med pa /
analyzed: drang ba / g-yo sgyu med pa /
translated: without deceit,

original: sngags dang rgyud kyi sbyor ba shes pa /
analyzed: sngags dang rgyud kyi sbyor ba shes pa /
translated: knowing the application of mantras and tantras,🔽skilled in the activity of drawing mandalas,

original: dkyil 'khor bri ba'i las la mkhas pa de kho na nyid bcu la mkhas pa /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor bri ba'i las la mkhas pa de kho na nyid bcu la mkhas pa /
translated: skilled in the ten principles.

original: de lta bu ni slob dpon du gzung ngo //
analyzed: de lta bu ni slob dpon du gzung ngo //
translated: One should take such a one as the master.

original: de lta bu dang ldan pa'i rnal 'byor pa des ni rab tu gnas par bya'o zhes lung las kyang gsungs te /🔽ji skad du /
analyzed: de lta bu dang ldan pa'i rnal 'byor pa des ni rab tu gnas par bya'o zhes lung las kyang gsungs te / ji skad du /
translated: It is also stated in the scriptures:

original: brtan zhing dul la blo gros ldan //
analyzed: brtan zhing dul la blo gros ldan //
translated: He is steadfast, disciplined, and intelligent,

original: bzod ldan drang la g-yo sgyu med //
analyzed: bzod ldan drang la g-yo sgyu med //
translated: patient, honest, and without deceit,

original: sngags dang rgyud kyi sbyor ba shes //
analyzed: sngags dang rgyud kyi sbyor ba shes //
translated: knows the application of mantras and tantras,

original: dkyil 'khor bri ba'i las la mkhas //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor bri ba'i las la mkhas //
translated: is skilled in the activity of drawing mandalas,

original: de nyid bcu ni yongs shes pa //
analyzed: de nyid bcu ni yongs shes pa //
translated: fully understands the ten principles,

original: 'di ni slob dpon yin zhes bya //
analyzed: 'di ni slob dpon yin zhes bya //
translated: and is called a master.

original: de yis bstan pa'i gsang sngags rnams //🔽'grub 'gyur 'di la the tshom med //
analyzed: de yis bstan pa'i gsang sngags rnams // 'grub 'gyur 'di la the tshom med //
translated: The mantras taught by him

original: ces gsungs so //
analyzed: ces gsungs so //
translated: will be accomplished, there is no doubt about this.

original: de kho na nyid bcu ni tshogs mtho ba'i nang nas kyang //
analyzed: de kho na nyid bcu ni tshogs mtho ba'i nang nas kyang //
translated: The ten principles are:🔽the supreme mandala and meditative concentration,

original: dkyil 'khor dang ni ting nge 'dzin mchog / phyag rgya stang stabs bdun dang ni //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor dang ni ting nge 'dzin mchog / phyag rgya stang stabs bdun dang ni //
translated: the seven mudras and postures,🔽recitation, offering, fire puja,

original: bzlas brjod mchod pa sbyin sreg dang / las kyi sbyor ba nyer bsdu ba //
analyzed: bzlas brjod mchod pa sbyin sreg dang / las kyi sbyor ba nyer bsdu ba //
translated: and the application of activities.

original: @51a * // de ltar de nyid bcu shes shing //
analyzed: @51a * // de ltar de nyid bcu shes shing //
translated: Thus, knowing these ten principles,

original: dman pa'i sems ni smod byed pa'o //
analyzed: dman pa'i sems ni smod byed pa'o //
translated: one should despise inferior minds.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de nas yid dang mthun pa'i gnas yid du 'ong bar tshes grangs dang rgyu skar bzang po dang / gza' bzang po rgyu ba'i dus tshod bzang po la spyan dbye ba'i mgo gzugs par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas yid dang mthun pa'i gnas yid du 'ong bar tshes grangs dang rgyu skar bzang po dang / gza' bzang po rgyu ba'i dus tshod bzang po la spyan dbye ba'i mgo gzugs par bya'o //
translated: Then, in a place that is agreeable and pleasing, on an auspicious lunar day, under an auspicious nakṣatra, at an auspicious time when the planets are moving well, one should begin the rite of opening the eyes.

original: gang nas rab tu gnas pa'i yo byad thams cad dang ldan par bya ste /
analyzed: gang nas rab tu gnas pa'i yo byad thams cad dang ldan par bya ste /
translated: One should be endowed with all the articles for the consecration.

original: rab tu gnas pa'i khrus kyi stegs bu dang / rab tu gnas pa dang 'tsham pa'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa yang legs par rab tu brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: rab tu gnas pa'i khrus kyi stegs bu dang / rab tu gnas pa dang 'tsham pa'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa yang legs par rab tu brtag par bya'o //
translated: One should also thoroughly examine the site for the consecration, the bathing stand, and the maṇḍala, and so forth, which are suitable for the consecration.

original: de nas ba'i rnam pa lnga dang / sngos chab la rdo rje gnod sbyin yongs su bzlas pas gnas nye bar byug par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas ba'i rnam pa lnga dang / sngos chab la rdo rje gnod sbyin yongs su bzlas pas gnas nye bar byug par bya'o //
translated: Then, with the five types of cow products and blue dye, one should anoint the site, having recited the vajrapāṇi mantra.

original: de nas dri dang sbyar ba'i chus kyang nye bar byugs la /
analyzed: de nas dri dang sbyar ba'i chus kyang nye bar byugs la /
translated: Then, having anointed it with water mixed with perfume,

original: bsod nams dang dpal 'phel bar byed pa'i gdugs dang rgyal mtshan dang / bla rje dang ba dan la sogs pas brgyan par bya'o //
analyzed: bsod nams dang dpal 'phel bar byed pa'i gdugs dang rgyal mtshan dang / bla rje dang ba dan la sogs pas brgyan par bya'o //
translated: one should adorn it with parasols, victory banners, flags, and so forth, which increase merit and glory.

original: de rnams la yang rdo rje gnod sbyin gyi sngags badzra yaksha h'um zhes pa bzlas so //
analyzed: de rnams la yang rdo rje gnod sbyin gyi sngags badzra yaksha h'um zhes pa bzlas so //
translated: For those, one should recite the mantra of Vajrayakṣa, “vajra yakṣa hūṃ.”

original: de nas nang par gyi dus su legs par khrus byas la gos gtsang ma bgos te /
analyzed: de nas nang par gyi dus su legs par khrus byas la gos gtsang ma bgos te /
translated: Then, at the time of dawn, having bathed well, one should put on clean clothes.

original: gtsug tong dang cod pan bcings nas rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan par byas pa 'am /
analyzed: gtsug tong dang cod pan bcings nas rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan par byas pa 'am /
translated: Having tied up one’s hair in a topknot and having adorned oneself with all ornaments,

original: yang na cha lugs rigs dang mthun pa ji bzhin pas bya'o //
analyzed: yang na cha lugs rigs dang mthun pa ji bzhin pas bya'o //
translated: or else, one should do it in the manner of one’s own caste.

original: rang gi rigs kyi 'khor los sgyur ba'i sbyor ba'am rnal 'byor chen po bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi rigs kyi 'khor los sgyur ba'i sbyor ba'am rnal 'byor chen po bya'o //
translated: One should perform the yoga of the cakravartin of one’s own caste or the great yoga.🔽Moreover,

original: de yang // cho ga nyams pas mi bya ste //
analyzed: de yang // cho ga nyams pas mi bya ste //
translated: one should not do it with a damaged ritual,🔽because of the degradation of the cloth,

original: ras gnas rtag tu smad pa dang // tshe 'dir sdug bsngal chen po dang // 'jig rten gzhan du 'jig rten 'byung //
analyzed: ras gnas rtag tu smad pa dang // tshe 'dir sdug bsngal chen po dang // 'jig rten gzhan du 'jig rten 'byung //
translated: one will have great suffering in this life and will be born in the world of the next.

original: de bas dngos grub 'dod pa yis //🔽bdag nyid kyis ni ci nus dang // de bzhin cho gar gsungs tshul du //
analyzed: de bas dngos grub 'dod pa yis // bdag nyid kyis ni ci nus dang // de bzhin cho gar gsungs tshul du //
translated: Therefore, one who desires power🔽should do it with all one’s might🔽and in the manner taught in the ritual

original: kun nas rab tu 'bad de bya //
analyzed: kun nas rab tu 'bad de bya //
translated: and in the manner taught in the tantra.

original: zhes so // de la dang por rdo rje gnod sbyin gyis bgegs gzhom pa la sogs pa byas la /
analyzed: zhes so // de la dang por rdo rje gnod sbyin gyis bgegs gzhom pa la sogs pa byas la /
translated: First, Vajrayakṣa conquers obstructors and so forth.

original: de la sngon du 'gro ba dang sbyor ba dang po dang / dkyil 'khor rgyal mchog dang / las rgyal mchog gi ting nge 'dzin byas la /
analyzed: de la sngon du 'gro ba dang sbyor ba dang po dang / dkyil 'khor rgyal mchog dang / las rgyal mchog gi ting nge 'dzin byas la /
translated: Therein, having performed the preliminaries, the first yoga, the supreme royal maṇḍala, and the supreme royal maṇḍala of activity,

original: de nas bum pa sta gon la gnas pa bya ste /🔽dum pa'i stegs bu gru bzhi pa 'am sgo bzhi pa dkyil 'khor padma 'dab ma brgyad pa 'am /
analyzed: de nas bum pa sta gon la gnas pa bya ste / dum pa'i stegs bu gru bzhi pa 'am sgo bzhi pa dkyil 'khor padma 'dab ma brgyad pa 'am /
translated: then one should perform the consecration of the vases.

original: bcu drug pa la bum pa ji tsam 'byor pa gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: bcu drug pa la bum pa ji tsam 'byor pa gzhag par bya'o //
translated: On a square or four-doored platform, in the center of the maṇḍala, one should place as many vases as one can afford, with eight or sixteen lotus petals.

original: der phyogs dang mtshams su bum pa brgyad la rang gi mtshan ma bris pa dang / rdo rje lcags kyu la sogs pa sgo ba'i mtshan ma dang / rdo rje me tog la sogs pa @51b bris pa'i bum pa gang ba 'byor tshad kyang phyogs dang mtshams rnams su gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: der phyogs dang mtshams su bum pa brgyad la rang gi mtshan ma bris pa dang / rdo rje lcags kyu la sogs pa sgo ba'i mtshan ma dang / rdo rje me tog la sogs pa @51b bris pa'i bum pa gang ba 'byor tshad kyang phyogs dang mtshams rnams su gzhag par bya'o //
translated: There, one should place eight vases with one’s own sign written on them in the cardinal and intermediate directions, and as many vases as one can afford filled with the signs of the gate-keepers such as the vajra hook, and so forth, and the signs of vajra flowers, and so forth, in the cardinal and intermediate directions.

original: dbus su yang rnam par rgyal ba'i bum pa rigs lnga'i mtshan mas mtshan pa gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: dbus su yang rnam par rgyal ba'i bum pa rigs lnga'i mtshan mas mtshan pa gzhag par bya'o //
translated: In the center, one should place a victorious vase marked with the signs of the five families.

original: de dag gi nang du 'bru lnga dang / sman lnga dang rin po che lnga la sogs pa bcug la dris sbyar ba'i chu blugs nas /
analyzed: de dag gi nang du 'bru lnga dang / sman lnga dang rin po che lnga la sogs pa bcug la dris sbyar ba'i chu blugs nas /
translated: Having placed the five grains, the five nectars, the five precious substances, and so on, inside them, one should fill them with water mixed with perfume.

original: ras zung gis mgul pa bcings la 'dab ma dri zhim pos kha brgyan par bya ba dang / steng du bla re bre ba dang / gdugs dang rgyal mtshan gyis nye 'khor brgyan par bya'o //
analyzed: ras zung gis mgul pa bcings la 'dab ma dri zhim pos kha brgyan par bya ba dang / steng du bla re bre ba dang / gdugs dang rgyal mtshan gyis nye 'khor brgyan par bya'o //
translated: Having tied their necks with a pair of cloths, one should ornament their mouths with fragrant leaves, and above them one should stretch a canopy, and one should ornament the surroundings with parasols and victory banners.

original: de nas bum pa byin gyis brlab par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas bum pa byin gyis brlab par bya ste /
translated: Then, one should consecrate the vases.

original: kham las bum pa nag po ra ri med pa mchu 'phyang ba mgrin pa ring pa gsus pa che ba mi gang par byin gyis brlabs te /
analyzed: kham las bum pa nag po ra ri med pa mchu 'phyang ba mgrin pa ring pa gsus pa che ba mi gang par byin gyis brlabs te /
translated: One should consecrate a black clay vase without cracks, with a long neck and a large belly, the size of a human,

original: aom sarba bti badzra yaksha h'um zhes bya ba phyag rgya dang bcas pas gzhal yas khang gdan dang bcas pa'i steng du rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i lha rnams bskyed la /
analyzed: aom sarba bti badzra yaksha h'um zhes bya ba phyag rgya dang bcas pas gzhal yas khang gdan dang bcas pa'i steng du rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i lha rnams bskyed la /
translated: With the mantra Om sarva buddha dakini vajra yaksha hum, together with the seal, generate the deities such as Vairochana above the celestial mansion together with the seats.

original: ye shes sems dpa' rdo rje lcags kyu la sogs pa'i sngags dang phyag rgyas dgug pa la sogs pa bya ste /
analyzed: ye shes sems dpa' rdo rje lcags kyu la sogs pa'i sngags dang phyag rgyas dgug pa la sogs pa bya ste /
translated: Invite the wisdom beings and so forth with the mantra and seals of the vajra hook and so forth.

original: phyag rgya bzhis rgyas btab nas rang rang gi snying po dang sngags brjod cing mchod yon la sogs pas mchod la bstod de /
analyzed: phyag rgya bzhis rgyas btab nas rang rang gi snying po dang sngags brjod cing mchod yon la sogs pas mchod la bstod de /
translated: Seal them with the four seals, recite their essence mantras, make offerings with water for welcoming and so forth, and praise them.

original: thun gsum gyi rim pas bzlas brjod bya'o //
analyzed: thun gsum gyi rim pas bzlas brjod bya'o //
translated: Recite the mantras in three sessions.

original: de nas dkyil 'khor gyi bgegs bsrung ba dang sta gon yang bya'o //
analyzed: de nas dkyil 'khor gyi bgegs bsrung ba dang sta gon yang bya'o //
translated: Then, protect the maṇḍala from obstructors and perform the setup.

original: de nas rab tu gnas par bya ba'i sku'i sta gon bya ste sku de nyid gang dang gang yin bsku'i rnam par bskyed de /
analyzed: de nas rab tu gnas par bya ba'i sku'i sta gon bya ste sku de nyid gang dang gang yin bsku'i rnam par bskyed de /
translated: Then, perform the setup of the body for the consecration, generating the body of the deity that is to be consecrated as the form of the deity.

original: mchod pa lngas mchod la /
analyzed: mchod pa lngas mchod la /
translated: Make offerings with the five offerings.

original: de nas sbyang bar bya ste til dang yungs kar gyis bskor zhing sarba p'a pam da ha na badzr'a ya sv'a h'a zhes bya ba dang / ru ru sphu ru'i sngags kyis me la sbyin sreg bya zhing sbyang ngo //

translated: Then one should purify it, by sprinkling it with sesame and white mustard seeds, and by offering into the fire the Sarva pāpaṃ dahana vajrayā svāhā, and the Ruru sphu ru mantra.

analyzed: de nas bkra shis kyi tshigs su bcad pa yang brjod par bya'o//

original: mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: mchod par bya'o //

original: de nas snying po dang sngags kyang gdon no //
analyzed: de nas snying po dang sngags kyang gdon no //

analyzed: las thams cad pa'i bum pas khrus byas pa las thams cad pa'i sngags bzlas pa'i stan yang gding bar bya'o //

original: de nas der bzhugs su gsol to //
analyzed: de nas der bzhugs su gsol to //

original: de nas bris sku la sogs pa de mi dmigs par byas te /
analyzed: de nas bris sku la sogs pa de mi dmigs par byas te /

translated: Having generated that body by means of meditative stabilization, one should invite it with the vajra-gathering gesture, and having made offerings, one should praise it with the one hundred and eight names.

original: yang phyag rgya bzhis rgyas btab la sngags rnams mngon par bzlas te /
analyzed: yang phyag rgya bzhis rgyas btab la sngags rnams mngon par bzlas te /

analyzed: de nas yang rigs @52a * //

analyzed: thams cad kyi bdag po'i sngags aom badzra satva h'um zhes pa'o //

original: aom bha ga ba ti ru ru sphu ru dzva la tishtha siddhi lo tsa ne sarba aartha s'a dha ni sv'a h'a zhes bya ba ni rigs kyi yum rnams kyi rig pa'o //

analyzed: aom dzi na dzi ka ces bya ba ni rigs kyi snying po'o //

analyzed: de nas rtsa ba'i dkyil 'khor chen po la mchod pas mchod de /

original: bdag ni brtse bar gyur nas su //
analyzed: bdag ni brtse bar gyur nas su //

analyzed: de bas gnang bar mdzad pa'i rigs //

analyzed: / bdag dang slob mar bcas pa la //

original: zhes bya ba lan gsum du brjod do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba lan gsum du brjod do //

analyzed: de nas phyi rol du gtor ma byin nas sbyin sreg bya ste //

analyzed: aom khyod kyis sems can don kun mdzad //

analyzed: sangs rgyas yul du gshegs nas kyang //

original: slar yang 'byon par mdzad du gsol //
analyzed: slar yang 'byon par mdzad du gsol //

analyzed: de nas dam tshig gi lha rnams mdun gyi na mkha' la gzhal yas khang kha sbyor byas te sgra yig dbyangs yig gis srubs dkris te /

analyzed: yi ge 'bru lngas phyogs mtshams bsrungs te bzhugs su gsol lo //

analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad sku'i dkyil 'khor ram /

analyzed: sh'akya thub pa gsung gi dkyil 'khor ram /

analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' thugs kyi dkyil 'khor gang grub pa gzhung las 'byung ba bzhin bri bar bya'o //

analyzed: de nas dgongs ka'i dus su 'jug pa'i rim pas zhugs te /

analyzed: sbyor ba gsum bsgoms te bgegs la sogs pa bskrad par bya'o //

analyzed: de nas bdag nyid kyis gzhal yas khang pa bskyed pa dang / dkyil 'khor rgyal po mchog dang / las rgyal po mchog byas te /

analyzed: bzlas pa yan chad rdzogs pa dang / gdod rab tu gnas pa la 'jug par bya ste /

analyzed: de nas 'jug pa'i rim pas bcug ste /

translated: the seven precious substances, the eight articles, and so forth, as taught in the Yoga Tantra.

original: de rnams la sngags kyis bsang ngo //
analyzed: de rnams la sngags kyis bsang ngo //
translated: Consecrate them with the mantra.

analyzed: de nas sku'i rnam pa gang dang gang yin pa bdag nyid kyis gsal bar brtags @53a * //
translated: Then, whatever the form of the body, visualize it clearly yourself.

translated: Then, by summoning the gnosis deities, causing them to enter, binding them, and magnetizing them, you should accomplish them.🔽The hook mudra formed with the index fingers

analyzed: mthe'u chung las te lcags kyu che //
translated: is the great hook from the little fingers.

original: mkhrig ma mdud pas mdzub gnyis gdub //
analyzed: mkhrig ma mdud pas mdzub gnyis gdub //

original: rgyab gnyis kyang ni bsnyams te mnan //
analyzed: rgyab gnyis kyang ni bsnyams te mnan //

analyzed: dza: h'um bam ho: zhes brjod do //

analyzed: de ltar spyan drangs nas mchod yon dang / zhabs bsil phul te /

original: sngar bshad pa'i sngags kyis sbyang ba byas te /
analyzed: sngar bshad pa'i sngags kyis sbyang ba byas te /
translated: Having purified with the mantra explained above,

analyzed: de nas las thams cad pa'i bum pas khrus gsol lo //

analyzed: aom badzra a'a h'a ra na bh'u sha ne sv'a h'a /
