translated: Oṃ vajra puṣpe hūṃ, etc. Offer the five offerings.

original: de nas dbu rgyan gyi dbang bskur bar bya ste /🔽mthe bong gnyis ni bsnol byas te //
analyzed: de nas dbu rgyan gyi dbang bskur bar bya ste / mthe bong gnyis ni bsnol byas te //
translated: Then confer the empowerment of the crown.🔽Cross the two thumbs.

original: gung mo bsnyams pa'i tshigs dang sbyar //
analyzed: gung mo bsnyams pa'i tshigs dang sbyar //
translated: The middle fingers are even, and the joints are joined.

original: rdo rje dbyings kyi dbang mor bshad //
analyzed: rdo rje dbyings kyi dbang mor bshad //
translated: This is explained as the queen of the vajra realm.🔽Oṃ bhrūṃ kṣḥ. Empowerment of you, O sattva.

original: aom bhr'um kham zhes bya ba dang / aa bhi shinytsa stvam zhes bya ba dang / aom satva badzri /
analyzed: aom bhr'um kham zhes bya ba dang / aa bhi shinytsa stvam zhes bya ba dang / aom satva badzri /
translated: Oṃ sattva vajrī.🔽Ratna vajrī.

original: ratna badzri / dharma badzri /
analyzed: ratna badzri / dharma badzri /
translated: Dharma vajrī.🔽Karma vajrī.

original: karma badzri / zhes bya ba la aa bhi shinytsa stvam zhes bya ba bsnan la /🔽rdo rje bsdams pa'i gung mo bsgreng ba ni sems ma rdo rje ma'i'o //
analyzed: karma badzri / zhes bya ba la aa bhi shinytsa stvam zhes bya ba bsnan la / rdo rje bsdams pa'i gung mo bsgreng ba ni sems ma rdo rje ma'i'o //
translated: Add empowerment of you, O sattva.🔽 The middle fingers of the vajra-binding, raised, is the mudra of Cittavajrā.

original: de nyid rin chen 'dra bar byas pa ni rin chen sems ma'i'o //
analyzed: de nyid rin chen 'dra bar byas pa ni rin chen sems ma'i'o //
translated: That same [mudra] made like a jewel is the mudra of Ratna-citta.

original: de nyid padma 'dra bar byas pa ni padma sems ma'i 'o //
analyzed: de nyid padma 'dra bar byas pa ni padma sems ma'i 'o //
translated: That itself, made like a lotus, is the lotus mind.

original: de nyid las thal mo sbyar ba phral ba ni rdo rje las ma'i 'o //
analyzed: de nyid las thal mo sbyar ba phral ba ni rdo rje las ma'i 'o //
translated: From that, separating the joined palms is the vajra action.

original: de ni rigs kyi dbang bskur ba'o //
analyzed: de ni rigs kyi dbang bskur ba'o //
translated: That is the empowerment of the family.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la ni rin po che'i myu gus dbang bskur ba ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la ni rin po che'i myu gus dbang bskur ba ste /
translated: For the transcendent family, the empowerment is conferred with a jewel sprout.

original: rin chen myu gu'i phyag rgya bcings la @53b badzra ratna aa bhishinytsa m'am zhes pas dbang bskur ro //
analyzed: rin chen myu gu'i phyag rgya bcings la @53b badzra ratna aa bhishinytsa m'am zhes pas dbang bskur ro //
translated: Form the jewel sprout seal and confer empowerment with vajra ratnābhiṣiñca māṃ.

original: de nas aom h'um zhes bya ba dang / rdo rje khu tshur gnyis so sor bcings te /
analyzed: de nas aom h'um zhes bya ba dang / rdo rje khu tshur gnyis so sor bcings te /
translated: Then, with oṃ hūṃ, form the two vajra fists🔽and bend the two index fingers.

original: mdzub mo gnyis bkug la go cha byas te snying gar mdud pa ltar byas la /
analyzed: mdzub mo gnyis bkug la go cha byas te snying gar mdud pa ltar byas la /
translated: Having made the armor, tie it at the heart.🔽Then tie it at the throat,🔽on the forehead,

original: yang mgrin pa dang / rgyan dang / dpral ba'i steng du mdud par bya zhing /
analyzed: yang mgrin pa dang / rgyan dang / dpral ba'i steng du mdud par bya zhing /
translated: and on the crown of the head.

original: de nas phreng ba bcing pa'i tshul gyis mdud pa bya ba dar dpyangs bcings pa'i tshul yang byas la ngos gnyis su mtha' ma la sogs pa nas sor mo thams cad bkrol la /
analyzed: de nas phreng ba bcing pa'i tshul gyis mdud pa bya ba dar dpyangs bcings pa'i tshul yang byas la ngos gnyis su mtha' ma la sogs pa nas sor mo thams cad bkrol la /
translated: Then, having made a knot in the manner of binding a garland, and also having made a hanging banner, one should release all the fingers from the end of the two sides.

original: de nas mnyam pa'i thal mos mnyes par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas mnyam pa'i thal mos mnyes par bya ste /
translated: Then, one should please with the palms joined in prayer.🔽Oṃ vajra tvaṣṭi hoh.

original: aom badzra tu shya ho: / de nas sgeg mo la sogs pas mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: aom badzra tu shya ho: / de nas sgeg mo la sogs pas mchod par bya'o //
translated: Then, one should make offerings with the goddesses beginning with Lāsyā.

original: yang na skabs 'dir rdo rje dang dril bu la sogs pa'i dbang rnams sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: yang na skabs 'dir rdo rje dang dril bu la sogs pa'i dbang rnams sbyin par bya'o //
translated: Or, at this occasion, one should give the empowerments of the vajra, bell, and so on.

original: de nas mig thur la sogs pa'i bya ba'i las rnams skabs 'dir bya'o //
analyzed: de nas mig thur la sogs pa'i bya ba'i las rnams skabs 'dir bya'o //
translated: Then, the activities of the eye probe and so on should be done at this occasion.

original: aom tsakshu tsakshu sa manta tsakshu bi sho dha ne sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom tsakshu tsakshu sa manta tsakshu bi sho dha ne sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ cakṣubhiḥ cakṣubhiḥ samanta cakṣu viśodhani svāhā.

original: de nas spabs bzhar ba la sogs pa bya'o //
analyzed: de nas spabs bzhar ba la sogs pa bya'o //
translated: Then, one should do the shaving of the head and so on.

original: de nas phyir mi ldog pa la sogs pa thams cad dbang stegs kyi steng du bskur bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas phyir mi ldog pa la sogs pa thams cad dbang stegs kyi steng du bskur bar bya'o //
translated: Then, all the empowerments of irreversibility and so on should be conferred upon the disciples on the empowerment platform.

original: de nas sngags 'dis bkra shis kyi bshos dbul bar bya ste /
analyzed: de nas sngags 'dis bkra shis kyi bshos dbul bar bya ste /
translated: Then, one should offer the auspicious rice grains with this mantra:

original: aom di bya aagni sa m'a dhya na pri na ye sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom di bya aagni sa m'a dhya na pri na ye sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ dīpyāgni-samādhyānayapriyai svāhā.

original: de nas me long dang bshos gzhan dag dang mchod pa'i yo byad 'byor tshad kyis mchod pa dang / bdag dbul ba la sogs pa'i mchod pa bcu drug gis mchod pa dang / bstod pa la sogs pas bstod do /
analyzed: de nas me long dang bshos gzhan dag dang mchod pa'i yo byad 'byor tshad kyis mchod pa dang / bdag dbul ba la sogs pa'i mchod pa bcu drug gis mchod pa dang / bstod pa la sogs pas bstod do /
translated: Then, with a mirror, other ritual cakes, and whatever articles for worship are available, one should worship with the sixteen offerings such as one’s own body, and with praise and so forth.

original: de ltar byas nas yang de'i 'og tu yang slob ma gzhug par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar byas nas yang de'i 'og tu yang slob ma gzhug par bya ste /
translated: Having done it in that way, then afterwards one should also admit the disciples.

original: khyod kyis nga la gsol btab pa'i //
analyzed: khyod kyis nga la gsol btab pa'i //
translated: “You have requested me

original: sku gzugs dag ni khyad par du //
analyzed: sku gzugs dag ni khyad par du //
translated: to consecrate the images

original: ji skad gsungs bzhin rab gnas pa'i //🔽de ni bya ba byed du bcug / ci bde bar ni mchod par gyis //
analyzed: ji skad gsungs bzhin rab gnas pa'i // de ni bya ba byed du bcug / ci bde bar ni mchod par gyis //
translated: in accordance with the scriptures.🔽I have caused them to perform their function;

original: zhes bsgo ste /
analyzed: zhes bsgo ste /
translated: you should worship them as you please.”🔽Thus one should instruct them.

original: de nas gong nas byung ba'i dbang gis slob ma la dbang bskur ro //
analyzed: de nas gong nas byung ba'i dbang gis slob ma la dbang bskur ro //
translated: Then, by the empowerment that occurred above, one should confer empowerment on the disciples.

original: de nas sbyin sreg gi las bya'o //
analyzed: de nas sbyin sreg gi las bya'o //
translated: Then one should perform the rite of fire sacrifice.

original: de ltar spyan dbye ba'i las byas nas 'jug pa'i dkyil 'khor gshegs su gsol ba la sogs pa bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar spyan dbye ba'i las byas nas 'jug pa'i dkyil 'khor gshegs su gsol ba la sogs pa bya'o //
translated: Having performed the rite of opening the eyes in that way, one should request the entry mandala and so forth to depart.

original: de nas sgrub pa pos gnas dben par bsgrub pa bya ste /
analyzed: de nas sgrub pa pos gnas dben par bsgrub pa bya ste /
translated: Then the adept should perform the practice in a solitary place.

original: khams gsum rnam par rgyal bar bdag nyid bsams la bsrung ba la sogs pa byas la /
analyzed: khams gsum rnam par rgyal bar bdag nyid bsams la bsrung ba la sogs pa byas la /
translated: Having visualized oneself as the Conqueror of the Three Worlds, one should perform the protection and so forth.

original: bdag lha'i ting nge 'dzin du zhugs la dngos grub kyi mtshan ma byung byung du bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag lha'i ting nge 'dzin du zhugs la dngos grub kyi mtshan ma byung byung du bzlas par bya'o //
translated: Having entered into the deity's samadhi, one should recite until the signs of siddhi appear.

original: de nas gal te mtshan ma zhig mthong na ni dngos grub myur du thob par 'gyur ro zhes pa ni 'og nas 'byung ba 'di'o //🔽'on te ma mthong na ni ring po zhig na dngos @54a * //
analyzed: de nas gal te mtshan ma zhig mthong na ni dngos grub myur du thob par 'gyur ro zhes pa ni 'og nas 'byung ba 'di'o // 'on te ma mthong na ni ring po zhig na dngos @54a * //
translated: Then, if one sees a sign, one will quickly attain siddhi. This is as stated below.

original: grub tu 'gyur te zhes pa ni skye ba brgyud nas so //
analyzed: grub tu 'gyur te zhes pa ni skye ba brgyud nas so //
translated: But if one does not see, then after a long time one will attain siddhi. This is through a succession of rebirths.

original: dngos grub kyi mtshan ma ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: dngos grub kyi mtshan ma ni 'di yin te /
translated: The signs of siddhi are as follows:

original: bzhad pa dang ni rnga sgra dang // zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bzhad pa dang ni rnga sgra dang // zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Laughing, the sound of drums, and so forth.

original: bzhad pa ni ris su bris pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: bzhad pa ni ris su bris pa'i sku'o //
translated: Laughing is a painted image.

original: rnga sgra la sogs pa ni nam mkha'i 'o //
analyzed: rnga sgra la sogs pa ni nam mkha'i 'o //
translated: The sound of drums and so forth is in the sky.

original: dge slong dang bram ze la sogs pa ni rmi lam gyi rnam par ro //
analyzed: dge slong dang bram ze la sogs pa ni rmi lam gyi rnam par ro //
translated: Monks, Brahmins, and so forth are in dreams.

original: 'bras bu mthong na myur du ni //
analyzed: 'bras bu mthong na myur du ni //
translated: If the result is seen, then quickly

original: zhes bya ba ni rtags te gang yin pa de mthong na mchog ste sku dang bar ma ste gsung dang tha ma ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rtags te gang yin pa de mthong na mchog ste sku dang bar ma ste gsung dang tha ma ste /
translated: This is the sign. If that is seen, then the supreme, which is the body, the middling, which is the speech, and the inferior, which is the mind,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i dngos grub thob bo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i dngos grub thob bo //
translated: the power of the bodhisattva is attained.

original: yang na 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / 'jig rten pa dang / phrin las bzhi po dag gi dngos grub 'grub pa'i rtags so //
analyzed: yang na 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / 'jig rten pa dang / phrin las bzhi po dag gi dngos grub 'grub pa'i rtags so //
translated: Alternately, the signs of the accomplishment of the powers of the four activities, mundane and supramundane, are accomplished.

original: de nas mtshan ma byung ba dang // dkyil 'khor snga ma bzhin bris la //
analyzed: de nas mtshan ma byung ba dang // dkyil 'khor snga ma bzhin bris la //
translated: Then, when the signs arise, draw the maṇḍala as before.

original: zhes pa ni dngos grub blang bar bya ba'i thabs te /
analyzed: zhes pa ni dngos grub blang bar bya ba'i thabs te /
translated: This is the method of taking the power.

original: 'jug pa'i dkyil 'khor bzhin du bris la bya'o //🔽phyi nang gi mchod pa mang pos mchod par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i dkyil 'khor bzhin du bris la bya'o // phyi nang gi mchod pa mang pos mchod par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Draw it as in the entrance maṇḍala.🔽In order to make offerings with many outer and inner offerings,

original: mchod pa rgya cher byas nas kyang //
analyzed: mchod pa rgya cher byas nas kyang //
translated: having made vast offerings,

original: zhes so // gang du gsungs pa'i sngags kyi grangs tsam zhig bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes so // gang du gsungs pa'i sngags kyi grangs tsam zhig bzlas par bya'o //
translated: recite the number of mantras as stated.

original: yang na rtags phra mo byung byung du bzlas pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: yang na rtags phra mo byung byung du bzlas pa'i phyir na /
translated: Alternately, in order to recite until the subtle signs arise,

original: mtshan gcig thog thag mi nyal bar bzlas zhes so //
analyzed: mtshan gcig thog thag mi nyal bar bzlas zhes so //
translated: Recite without sleeping the entire night.

original: ci ste gtso bo'am de'i sras ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'o//
analyzed: ci ste gtso bo'am de'i sras ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'o//
translated: If the principal or his son is a buddha or bodhisattva,

original: yang na lha rnams mthong 'gyur na //
analyzed: yang na lha rnams mthong 'gyur na //
translated: or if one sees the gods,

original: zhes bya ba ni tshangs pa dang brgya byin la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni tshangs pa dang brgya byin la sogs pa'o //
translated: means Brahma, Indra, and so forth.

original: de lta bu'i dngos grub rab 'bring ji lta bu yin pa ster ba'i phyir na /
analyzed: de lta bu'i dngos grub rab 'bring ji lta bu yin pa ster ba'i phyir na /
translated: Since he bestows accomplishments of such a kind, whether supreme or middling,

original: bsod nams snod las ci dga' bar //
analyzed: bsod nams snod las ci dga' bar //
translated: from the vessel of merit, whatever is desired,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: and so forth.

original: de la dngos grub blang pa ni //
analyzed: de la dngos grub blang pa ni //
translated: Among them, the acceptance of accomplishment is

original: phyag 'tshal dngos grub la sogs blang //
analyzed: phyag 'tshal dngos grub la sogs blang //
translated: having bowed, accept the accomplishment, and so forth.

original: zhes pa'o // phyi ma ni dkyus na gsal lo //
analyzed: zhes pa'o // phyi ma ni dkyus na gsal lo //
translated: The latter is clear in the text.

original: sems can kun la phan brtson pas //🔽zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: sems can kun la phan brtson pas // zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Strive to benefit all sentient beings,

original: dran bzhin las kun byed par 'gyur //
analyzed: dran bzhin las kun byed par 'gyur //
translated: mindful, one will perform all activities.

original: zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni grub par sgrub pa po'i yon tan bstan pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni grub par sgrub pa po'i yon tan bstan pa'o //
translated: This teaches the qualities of the practitioner of mantra.

original: des ni ras la sku gsung thugs bsgrubs pa'i ting nge 'dzin bstan to //
analyzed: des ni ras la sku gsung thugs bsgrubs pa'i ting nge 'dzin bstan to //
translated: By that, he taught the samadhi of accomplishing the body, speech, and mind on cloth.

original: da 'di nas ma 'ongs pa'i sems can tshe'i dus byas pa rnams la phan gdags pa'i rim pa bstan te /
analyzed: da 'di nas ma 'ongs pa'i sems can tshe'i dus byas pa rnams la phan gdags pa'i rim pa bstan te /
translated: Now, from here on, the stages of benefiting sentient beings who have died in the future are explained.

original: de nas lha rnams kyi dbang po zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de nas lha rnams kyi dbang po zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Then, the one called Lord of the Gods...

original: nyon cig ces bya ba'i bar gyis ni zhus pa dang gnang ba bstan to //
analyzed: nyon cig ces bya ba'i bar gyis ni zhus pa dang gnang ba bstan to //
translated: up to listen! explains the request and permission.

original: de la yang dang por dbang gis phan gdags pa @54b bstan te /
analyzed: de la yang dang por dbang gis phan gdags pa @54b bstan te /
translated: There, first, the benefit of empowerment is explained.

original: de bzhin dkyil 'khor bris nas ni //
analyzed: de bzhin dkyil 'khor bris nas ni //
translated: Having drawn the maṇḍala in that way...

original: zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: and so on.

original: de bzhin dkyil 'khor bris nas ni /
analyzed: de bzhin dkyil 'khor bris nas ni /
translated: Having drawn the maṇḍala in that way...

original: zhes bya ba de ni de bzhin ni gong ma la snyegs pa ste rtsa ba'i dkyil 'khor chen po bris la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba de ni de bzhin ni gong ma la snyegs pa ste rtsa ba'i dkyil 'khor chen po bris la /
translated: That in that way refers to the above. Having drawn the great, fundamental maṇḍala,

original: der slob ma 'jug pa'i rim pa bzhin du gzhug cing dbang bskur ba ni gong ma bzhin du bum pa dang / phyir mi ldog pa'i dbang rnams bskur na sdig pa chen po byas pa de dmyal ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal las thar te /
analyzed: der slob ma 'jug pa'i rim pa bzhin du gzhug cing dbang bskur ba ni gong ma bzhin du bum pa dang / phyir mi ldog pa'i dbang rnams bskur na sdig pa chen po byas pa de dmyal ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal las thar te /
translated: having caused the disciples to enter in stages, as above, if the irreversible empowerments are conferred, having conferred the vase empowerment and so on, those who have committed great sins will be liberated from the sufferings of hell, and so on.

original: dga' ldan la sogs pa'i lha'i rigs su skyes nas rim gyis byang chub tu sems bskyed de phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la 'god par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dga' ldan la sogs pa'i lha'i rigs su skyes nas rim gyis byang chub tu sems bskyed de phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la 'god par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having been born in the family of gods such as Tuṣita, they will gradually generate the mind of enlightenment and will be established in the stage of non-returning.

original: shi ba'i ro med na ming la dbang bskur na yang ngan song las thar bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: shi ba'i ro med na ming la dbang bskur na yang ngan song las thar bar 'gyur te /
translated: If there is no corpse, even if one confers empowerment on the name, one will be liberated from the lower realms.

original: de'i thabs kyang de'i gzugs brnyan bri ba'am zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de'i thabs kyang de'i gzugs brnyan bri ba'am zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The method for that is also taught from “one should draw the image of that” up to

original: snying rje can gyis dbang bskur ro //🔽zhes bya ba'i bar gyis bstan to //
analyzed: snying rje can gyis dbang bskur ro // zhes bya ba'i bar gyis bstan to //
translated: “the compassionate one confers empowerment.”

original: gnyis pa lhar brtags pa'i rang bzhin bstan pa ni shi bde nyid rang dad pa'i lha'i rang bzhin du brtags nas /
analyzed: gnyis pa lhar brtags pa'i rang bzhin bstan pa ni shi bde nyid rang dad pa'i lha'i rang bzhin du brtags nas /
translated: The second, the teaching on the nature of the deity, is as follows: Having imagined the corpse itself to be the nature of one’s deity,

original: mchod rten gyi dbus su gzhag pa'am /
analyzed: mchod rten gyi dbus su gzhag pa'am /
translated: one should place it in the center of the stūpa,

original: rang gi khyim du bzhag na yang grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang gi khyim du bzhag na yang grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: or if one places it in one’s own house, one will be liberated.

original: mchod rten gyis phan gdags par bya ba ni rang gi ming nas brjod la gur gum la sogs pa sngags dang spel te mchod rten gyi nang du bcug nas /
analyzed: mchod rten gyis phan gdags par bya ba ni rang gi ming nas brjod la gur gum la sogs pa sngags dang spel te mchod rten gyi nang du bcug nas /
translated: The benefit of the stūpa is that if one recites one’s own name, mixed with the mantra of saffron, and so on, and places it inside the stūpa,

original: khri 'am 'bum tsam du btab na yang sdig pa'i las zad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khri 'am 'bum tsam du btab na yang sdig pa'i las zad par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one makes a hundred thousand or a million such stūpas, one’s evil karma will be exhausted.

original: sdig pa chen po byas pa yang bye bar mchod rten gyi las byas na yang dmyal ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal las thar bar 'gyur te lha'i gnas su skye'o //
analyzed: sdig pa chen po byas pa yang bye bar mchod rten gyi las byas na yang dmyal ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal las thar bar 'gyur te lha'i gnas su skye'o //
translated: Even if one has committed great evil, if one makes ten million stūpas, one will be liberated from the sufferings of the hells and so forth, and will be reborn in the divine realms.

original: yang thabs gzhan yang bzlas pas phan gdags pa yang yod de /
analyzed: yang thabs gzhan yang bzlas pas phan gdags pa yang yod de /
translated: There is also another method of benefitting through recitation.

original: de'i ming nas brjod nas ngan song sbyong ba'i sngags 'bum phrag stong ngam bye ba yan chad bzlas na ngan song las thar nas lha'i gnas su skye'o //
analyzed: de'i ming nas brjod nas ngan song sbyong ba'i sngags 'bum phrag stong ngam bye ba yan chad bzlas na ngan song las thar nas lha'i gnas su skye'o //
translated: If one recites the mantra of purification from the lower realms a thousand times, ten thousand times, or more than a million times, while uttering the name of the deceased, they will be liberated from the lower realms and will be reborn in the divine realms.

original: yang thabs gzhan dag yod de /
analyzed: yang thabs gzhan dag yod de /
translated: There are also other methods.

original: de'i ming nas brjod cing rnal 'byor pa mkhas pas 'bum phrag brgya'am /
analyzed: de'i ming nas brjod cing rnal 'byor pa mkhas pas 'bum phrag brgya'am /
translated: If a skilled practitioner recites the mantra a hundred thousand times, while uttering the name of the deceased,

original: brgya phrag stong du sdig pa bsreg pa'i sbyin sreg til lam yungs kar dang / ra dkar mo'i 'o ma dang / 'bras dang gur gum la sogs pas bsgos pa'i yam shing dang / ba'i mar la sogs pas sbyin sreg byas na yang ngan song las thar nas lha'i gnas su skye'o //🔽de ngan song las thar nas lha'i gnas su skyes pa'i mtshan @55a * //
analyzed: brgya phrag stong du sdig pa bsreg pa'i sbyin sreg til lam yungs kar dang / ra dkar mo'i 'o ma dang / 'bras dang gur gum la sogs pas bsgos pa'i yam shing dang / ba'i mar la sogs pas sbyin sreg byas na yang ngan song las thar nas lha'i gnas su skye'o // de ngan song las thar nas lha'i gnas su skyes pa'i mtshan @55a * //
translated: If one performs a burnt offering of sesame or mustard seeds, or of sticks smeared with the milk of a white goat, rice, saffron, and so on, and of ghee and so on, one hundred thousand times, one will be freed from the lower realms and be reborn in the god realms.

original: ltas ni / de yi mtshan ma ston par byed //
analyzed: ltas ni / de yi mtshan ma ston par byed //
translated: The signs of being freed from the lower realms and being reborn in the god realms are taught in the lines beginning with “The signs will be shown”

original: ces bya ba nas /
analyzed: ces bya ba nas /
translated: and ending with

original: skyes pa yin par shes par bya //🔽zhes pa yan chad kyis bstan to //
analyzed: skyes pa yin par shes par bya // zhes pa yan chad kyis bstan to //
translated: “One should know that one has been born there.”

original: yang thabs gzhan ro de bsregs pas phan gdags pa yod de /
analyzed: yang thabs gzhan ro de bsregs pas phan gdags pa yod de /
translated: There is also another method of benefiting the deceased by burning the corpse.

original: de ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de ni 'di yin te /
translated: This is taught in the lines beginning with

original: khru bzhi ba yi tshad du ni //
analyzed: khru bzhi ba yi tshad du ni //
translated: “The size of the pyre should be four cubits”

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: and so on.

original: khru bzhi pa ni nang gi tshad de de'i phyi rol khru brgyad par bya ste /
analyzed: khru bzhi pa ni nang gi tshad de de'i phyi rol khru brgyad par bya ste /
translated: The size of four cubits is the inner size, and the outer size should be eight cubits.

original: de'i nang du khru do khor yug gi kha khyer la btang la /
analyzed: de'i nang du khru do khor yug gi kha khyer la btang la /
translated: In it, one should make a border two cubits all around.

original: khru do ni me thab kyi rgyar btang zhing zabs su ni khru gang brko bar bya'o //
analyzed: khru do ni me thab kyi rgyar btang zhing zabs su ni khru gang brko bar bya'o //
translated: The hearth should be two cubits across and one cubit deep.

original: de la nang gi kha khyer la sor brgyad do //
analyzed: de la nang gi kha khyer la sor brgyad do //
translated: There, the inner border is eight finger-widths.

original: de'i phyir bskyed la de nas kha khyer la sor brgyad dpangs dang rgyar mnyam par gtang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir bskyed la de nas kha khyer la sor brgyad dpangs dang rgyar mnyam par gtang bar bya'o //
translated: One should make it so that the border is eight finger-widths high and across.

original: de'i phyir kha khyer dpangs dang zheng du yang sor brgyad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir kha khyer dpangs dang zheng du yang sor brgyad do //
translated: Therefore, the border is eight finger-widths high and across.

original: cho ga bzhin du zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'di ltar don la snyegs te /
analyzed: cho ga bzhin du zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'di ltar don la snyegs te /
translated: The phrase “in accordance with the rite” means that one should follow the meaning in this way.

original: dang por sa brtag pa dang / de nas yul gyi rgyal po la sogs pa las sa de bslad ba dang / sa bdag dang klu la sogs pa la gtor ma byin te sa bslang zhing brtag pa dang / phyi sbyang ste ro lnga dbyung ba dang /
analyzed: dang por sa brtag pa dang / de nas yul gyi rgyal po la sogs pa las sa de bslad ba dang / sa bdag dang klu la sogs pa la gtor ma byin te sa bslang zhing brtag pa dang / phyi sbyang ste ro lnga dbyung ba dang /
translated: First, one should examine the ground, then buy the ground from the king of the region, and so on, give sacrificial cakes to the lords of the ground, the nāgas, and so on, request the ground, examine the ground, and remove the five corpses.

original: nang sbyang ste ting nge 'dzin gyis spyod pa dang / sa gter du gzhug pa dang / stegs bu 'thas par brtsigs pa dang / sgo dang lha'i gnas kyi thig gdab pa la sogs pa bya'o //
analyzed: nang sbyang ste ting nge 'dzin gyis spyod pa dang / sa gter du gzhug pa dang / stegs bu 'thas par brtsigs pa dang / sgo dang lha'i gnas kyi thig gdab pa la sogs pa bya'o //
translated: The inner purification is the conduct of meditative concentration, and the earth treasure is to be inserted, and the platform is to be built firm, and the lines of the doors and the deities' places are to be drawn, and so forth.

original: khung brkos la zhes bya ba ni zabs su khru gang par bya'o //🔽rdo rjes mtha' ma bskor ba yi //
analyzed: khung brkos la zhes bya ba ni zabs su khru gang par bya'o // rdo rjes mtha' ma bskor ba yi //
translated: The digging of the pit is to be one cubit deep.

original: zhes pa ni kha khyer la grva bzhir rdo rje gsum pa bzhi btang ba dang / gzhan yang rdo rje dang me tog gi phreng bas bskor ba'o //🔽'khor lo dbus su bri bar bya //
analyzed: zhes pa ni kha khyer la grva bzhir rdo rje gsum pa bzhi btang ba dang / gzhan yang rdo rje dang me tog gi phreng bas bskor ba'o // 'khor lo dbus su bri bar bya //
translated: The encircling with vajras is to place the three vajras in the four corners of the lip, and also to encircle it with vajras and flower garlands.🔽In the center of the wheel, one should draw the eight-spoked wheel.

original: zhes bya ba ni thab kyi dbus su 'khor lo rtsibs brgyad pa cig bris la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni thab kyi dbus su 'khor lo rtsibs brgyad pa cig bris la /
translated: In the center of the hearth, one should draw an eight-spoked wheel.

original: de la rigs lnga'i phyag rgya rdo rje dang / padma dang / rin po che dang / rgya gram dang / dbus su 'khor lo de rnams 'jim pa la 'bur du dpangs sor gcig pa'i tshad du byas la /
analyzed: de la rigs lnga'i phyag rgya rdo rje dang / padma dang / rin po che dang / rgya gram dang / dbus su 'khor lo de rnams 'jim pa la 'bur du dpangs sor gcig pa'i tshad du byas la /
translated: On that, the seals of the five families - the vajra, lotus, jewel, crossed vajra, and in the center, the wheel - should be made in relief on the clay, one finger high.

original: shar dang nub dang lho dang byang dang / dbus su rim pa bzhin gzhag par bya'o ;
analyzed: shar dang nub dang lho dang byang dang / dbus su rim pa bzhin gzhag par bya'o ;
translated: They should be placed in the east, west, south, north, and center, respectively.

original: / phyi'i kha khyer la 'khor lo'am padma 'dab ma bcu drug par bris la /
analyzed: / phyi'i kha khyer la 'khor lo'am padma 'dab ma bcu drug par bris la /
translated: On the outer ledge, one should draw a wheel or a lotus with sixteen petals.

original: sems dpa' ni rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa bcu drug gi mtshan ma rdo rje dang lcags kyu la sogs pa bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: sems dpa' ni rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa bcu drug gi mtshan ma rdo rje dang lcags kyu la sogs pa bri bar bya'o //
translated: On the petals, one should draw the emblems of the sixteen bodhisattvas, such as the vajra and iron hook of Vajrasattva.

original: de'i phyir snam bu la phyag rgya nyi shu bri bar bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir snam bu la phyag rgya nyi shu bri bar bya ba ni /
translated: On the outer ledge, one should draw twenty mudras.

original: shar phyogs nas brtsams @55b nas ;
analyzed: shar phyogs nas brtsams @55b nas ;
translated: Beginning from the east,

original: nags kyi lcug ma dang / bgrang phreng dang / ril ba spyi blugs dang / gling bu dang / tri sh'u la dang / zla ba phyed pa dang / ral pa mig dang / rgyal mtshan dang / dung dang / 'khor lo dang / be con dang /
analyzed: nags kyi lcug ma dang / bgrang phreng dang / ril ba spyi blugs dang / gling bu dang / tri sh'u la dang / zla ba phyed pa dang / ral pa mig dang / rgyal mtshan dang / dung dang / 'khor lo dang / be con dang /
translated: one should draw a bow, arrow, elephant goad, forest creeper, rosary, water jar, flute, trident, crescent moon, eye in a turban, banner, conch, wheel, club, lotus, sword, axe, mirror, and a full moon.

original: ral gri dang / phub dang / phag dang / seng ge dang / mdung dang ; dril bu dang / ba dan dang / rma bya dang / ra skyes dang / khyim bya rnams ni shar phyogs nas brtsams te bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: ral gri dang / phub dang / phag dang / seng ge dang / mdung dang ; dril bu dang / ba dan dang / rma bya dang / ra skyes dang / khyim bya rnams ni shar phyogs nas brtsams te bri bar bya'o //
translated: The sword, the shield, the boar, the lion, the spear, the bell, the banner, the peacock, the goat, and the cock should be drawn beginning from the east.

original: de la 'jig rten gtso bo rnams kyi phyag rgya ji lta ba bzhin du bri bar bya zhes so //
analyzed: de la 'jig rten gtso bo rnams kyi phyag rgya ji lta ba bzhin du bri bar bya zhes so //
translated: There, the seals of the chief worldly ones should be drawn just as they are.

original: de nas sgo dang / rta babs dang bcas pa bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas sgo dang / rta babs dang bcas pa bri bar bya'o //
translated: Then, the doors and the archways should be drawn.

original: mchod pa'i yo byad me tog la sogs pa dang / l'a sye ma la sogs pa dang // sgo ba bzhi yan chad kyi phyag rgya dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: mchod pa'i yo byad me tog la sogs pa dang / l'a sye ma la sogs pa dang // sgo ba bzhi yan chad kyi phyag rgya dgod par bya'o //
translated: The offering articles such as flowers and so forth, Lāsyā and so forth, and the four gatekeepers should be arranged with their seals.🔽The birds, the filled vases,

original: bya dang bum pa gang ba dang // zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: bya dang bum pa gang ba dang // zhes bya ba nas /
translated: and so forth up to

original: gdugs mchog rnams ni legs par gzhag //
analyzed: gdugs mchog rnams ni legs par gzhag //
translated: the excellent parasols should be well placed.

original: ces bya ba yan chad kyis ni dkyil 'khor gyi rgyan du bya ba dang // ro la dbang bskur ba'i rdzas su bya ba'i ched du'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba yan chad kyis ni dkyil 'khor gyi rgyan du bya ba dang // ro la dbang bskur ba'i rdzas su bya ba'i ched du'o //
translated: This is for the purpose of the ornaments of the maṇḍala and the substances for the empowerment of the corpse.

original: de ni dkyil 'khor bri ba'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: de ni dkyil 'khor bri ba'i rim pa'o //
translated: This is the procedure for drawing the maṇḍala.

original: de ltar dam pa'i bsreg khung du //
analyzed: de ltar dam pa'i bsreg khung du //
translated: Thus, in the sacred fire pit,

original: sbyin sreg thams cad yang dag bya //
analyzed: sbyin sreg thams cad yang dag bya //
translated: all the homa offerings are performed properly.

original: zhes pa ni sbyin sreg 'og nas 'byung ba bzhin bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa ni sbyin sreg 'og nas 'byung ba bzhin bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: This means that the homa offerings should be performed as they occur below.

original: de ltar cho ga shes pa yis //
analyzed: de ltar cho ga shes pa yis //
translated: By one who knows the ritual in this way,

original: zhes pa la //
analyzed: zhes pa la //
translated: Here,

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni gong ma la snyegs pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni gong ma la snyegs pa'o //
translated: in this way refers to the above.

original: cho ga shes pas zhes bya ba ni sa brtag pa la sogs pa gong ma ltar shes pa'o //
analyzed: cho ga shes pas zhes bya ba ni sa brtag pa la sogs pa gong ma ltar shes pa'o //
translated: By one who knows the ritual means by one who knows the examination of the ground and so forth as above.

original: gzhan yang bdag nyid lha'i rnal 'byor du byas nas gong ma ltar bris nas dkyil 'khor gyi yo byad dang bud shing la sogs pa la las thams cad pa 'am rdo rje rtse mo'i sngags kyis btab ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang bdag nyid lha'i rnal 'byor du byas nas gong ma ltar bris nas dkyil 'khor gyi yo byad dang bud shing la sogs pa la las thams cad pa 'am rdo rje rtse mo'i sngags kyis btab ste /
translated: Moreover, having performed the yoga of the deity oneself, having drawn as above, one consecrates the maṇḍala articles, firewood, and so forth with the all-purpose or vajra-peak mantra.

original: de nas las thams cad pa'ang /
analyzed: de nas las thams cad pa'ang /
translated: Then, the all-purpose mantra is:

original: 'phags pa mi g-yo bas bgegs bskrad cing mtshams bcad do //
analyzed: 'phags pa mi g-yo bas bgegs bskrad cing mtshams bcad do //
translated: The noble Acalanātha should drive away the obstructors and establish the boundaries.

original: de nas bdag nyid lhar byas te dbang bskur ba dang lus bsrung pa la sogs pa byas te /
analyzed: de nas bdag nyid lhar byas te dbang bskur ba dang lus bsrung pa la sogs pa byas te /
translated: Then, having made oneself into the deity, one should confer initiation, protect the body, and so forth.

original: bdag nyid kyis phyag rgya bcings shing sngags brjod pa dang / thugs ka nas 'od 'phros pa las khro bo'i skur gyur pas phyogs mtshams kyi bgegs bskrad par bya ste /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis phyag rgya bcings shing sngags brjod pa dang / thugs ka nas 'od 'phros pa las khro bo'i skur gyur pas phyogs mtshams kyi bgegs bskrad par bya ste /
translated: One should bind the seal and recite the mantra, and light radiating from one's heart becomes the form of an angry deity, and one should drive away the obstructing forces in the directions and quarters.

original: steng du rdo rje 'jigs byed sku mdog nag po h'um zhes bya ba'i phyag rgya dang ldan pas bsrungs so //
analyzed: steng du rdo rje 'jigs byed sku mdog nag po h'um zhes bya ba'i phyag rgya dang ldan pas bsrungs so //
translated: Above, the black Vajrabhairava with the hūṃ-syllable seal protects.

original: zhabs ni brkyang bskum gyi tshul du bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: zhabs ni brkyang bskum gyi tshul du bzhugs pa'o //
translated: He stands in the manner of the right leg extended and the left drawn in.

original: shar du rdo rje gtsug tor gyis bsrungs te /🔽sku mdog dkar @56a * //
analyzed: shar du rdo rje gtsug tor gyis bsrungs te / sku mdog dkar @56a * //
translated: In the east, Vajroṣṇīṣa protects.

original: po phyag gnyis rang gi phyag rgya dang ldan pa spyan gsum pa /
analyzed: po phyag gnyis rang gi phyag rgya dang ldan pa spyan gsum pa /
translated: He is white in color, with two arms, holding his own seal, and with three eyes.

original: g-yas brkyang g-yon bskum gyis bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: g-yas brkyang g-yon bskum gyis bzhugs pa'o //
translated: He stands in the manner of the right leg extended and the left drawn in.

original: byang du ni khro bo rdo rje dus zhes bya bas bsrungs te /
analyzed: byang du ni khro bo rdo rje dus zhes bya bas bsrungs te /
translated: In the north, the angry Vajradaṃṣṭrī protects.

original: sku mdog ni char sprin lta bu zhabs gnyis ni zlum po'i 'dug stangs can /
analyzed: sku mdog ni char sprin lta bu zhabs gnyis ni zlum po'i 'dug stangs can /
translated: His body is the color of a rain cloud, and he sits in the half-lotus posture.

original: phyag gnyis rdo rje mche ba bsnams pa'o ;
analyzed: phyag gnyis rdo rje mche ba bsnams pa'o ;
translated: His two hands hold a vajra and a fanged club.

original: / nub tu ni rta mgrin rdo rje ba dan bya bas bsrungs te /
analyzed: / nub tu ni rta mgrin rdo rje ba dan bya bas bsrungs te /
translated: In the west, Hayagriva is protected by Vajraketu.

original: sku mdog ni dmar por bzhugs pa zhabs gnyis sa ga'i 'dug stangs su gnas pa phyag gnyis na rdo rje'i ba dan lce brgyad pa bsnams pa'o //
analyzed: sku mdog ni dmar por bzhugs pa zhabs gnyis sa ga'i 'dug stangs su gnas pa phyag gnyis na rdo rje'i ba dan lce brgyad pa bsnams pa'o //
translated: He is red in color, his two feet are in the manner of standing, and his two hands hold an eight-spoked vajra banner.

original: lhor rdo rje rtse mo ste gshin rje gshed kyis bsrungs te /
analyzed: lhor rdo rje rtse mo ste gshin rje gshed kyis bsrungs te /
translated: In the south, Vajrashrika is protected by Yamantaka.

original: sku mdog nag por gnas pa zhabs gnyis ni g-yon brkyang bas bzhugs pa phyag na ni rdo rje rtse mo'i ba dan bsnams pa'o //
analyzed: sku mdog nag por gnas pa zhabs gnyis ni g-yon brkyang bas bzhugs pa phyag na ni rdo rje rtse mo'i ba dan bsnams pa'o //
translated: He is black in color, his two feet are in the manner of standing, and his two hands hold a vajra banner with a tip.

original: mtshams bzhir ni 'jigs byed zhags pas bsrungs te /
analyzed: mtshams bzhir ni 'jigs byed zhags pas bsrungs te /
translated: In the four intermediate directions, Vajraheruka is protected by Vajrapashana.

original: sku mdog ni ngos gnyis pa'o /
analyzed: sku mdog ni ngos gnyis pa'o /
translated: His body is two-sided.

original: phyag na ni rdo rje mche ba dang zhags pa bsnams pa'o //
analyzed: phyag na ni rdo rje mche ba dang zhags pa bsnams pa'o //
translated: His two hands hold a vajra fang and a noose.

original: 'og tu ni khro bo rdo rje gnod sbyin gyis bsrung ngo //
analyzed: 'og tu ni khro bo rdo rje gnod sbyin gyis bsrung ngo //
translated: Below, the wrathful Vajrayaksha protects.

original: phyag gnyis ri bo 'degs pa sku mdog nag po'o //
analyzed: phyag gnyis ri bo 'degs pa sku mdog nag po'o //
translated: His two hands lift a mountain, and his body is black.

original: khro bo de rnams ni gyad kyi 'dor stabs can no //
analyzed: khro bo de rnams ni gyad kyi 'dor stabs can no //
translated: Those wrathful ones have the manner of standing like wrestlers.

original: khro bo de dag thams cad kyang zhal gdangs pa mche ba gtsigs pa skra kham pa gyen du 'greng ba /
analyzed: khro bo de dag thams cad kyang zhal gdangs pa mche ba gtsigs pa skra kham pa gyen du 'greng ba /
translated: All of those wrathful ones have gaping mouths, bared fangs, and tawny hair bristling upward.

original: stod glang chen gyi ko ba rlon pa gsol ba /
analyzed: stod glang chen gyi ko ba rlon pa gsol ba /
translated: Their upper bodies are covered with fresh elephant hide.

original: sku smad stag gi pags pas smad dkris pa /
analyzed: sku smad stag gi pags pas smad dkris pa /
translated: Their lower bodies are wrapped with tiger skin.

original: spyan gsum pa sma ra ser po'i me chen po 'bar ba zhal nas rang gi sngags kyi sgra sgrogs pa rigs bzhi'i sbrul gyis sku la brgyan par bsgom mo //
analyzed: spyan gsum pa sma ra ser po'i me chen po 'bar ba zhal nas rang gi sngags kyi sgra sgrogs pa rigs bzhi'i sbrul gyis sku la brgyan par bsgom mo //
translated: They have three eyes, and great flames of a yellow beard blaze from their mouths, roaring the sound of their own mantras.

original: de nas pam las rdo rje ra ba bsam par bya ba dang / karmas dkyil 'khor bcing ba dang / phur bus snga nas gnas pa bskrad pa dang / phyis mi 'od par byas te gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas pam las rdo rje ra ba bsam par bya ba dang / karmas dkyil 'khor bcing ba dang / phur bus snga nas gnas pa bskrad pa dang / phyis mi 'od par byas te gdab par bya'o //
translated: Then one should imagine the vajra fence from paṃ, the binding of the maṇḍala with karma, the expulsion of the prior residents with the kīla, and the prevention of later ones from coming.

original: de nas bdag nyid kyis tshogs kyi yan lag bya ste /
analyzed: de nas bdag nyid kyis tshogs kyi yan lag bya ste /
translated: Then one should perform the limbs of the assembly oneself.

original: stong par bsgoms la /
analyzed: stong par bsgoms la /
translated: Meditate on emptiness.

original: rim gyis rten dang brten can gyi lha dang / gzhal yas khang bskyed pa yan chad bya'o //
analyzed: rim gyis rten dang brten can gyi lha dang / gzhal yas khang bskyed pa yan chad bya'o //
translated: Then one should generate the supporting and supported deities and the celestial mansion.

original: bris nas kyang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni bsgoms nas zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: bris nas kyang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni bsgoms nas zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The word “having written” means “having meditated.”

original: lha rnams mang po spyan drangs la //
analyzed: lha rnams mang po spyan drangs la //
translated: Having invited the many gods,

original: zhes bya ba ni ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor gyi lha tshogs rnams so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor gyi lha tshogs rnams so //
translated: the assembly of gods of the wisdom maṇḍala.

original: spyan drangs pa ni ting nge 'dzin gyi dkyil 'khor du'o //
analyzed: spyan drangs pa ni ting nge 'dzin gyi dkyil 'khor du'o //
translated: “Having invited” means into the maṇḍala of meditative concentration.

original: de yang gang du gang gi gang phyir zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de yang gang du gang gi gang phyir zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Moreover, it means “where, by whom, and for what purpose.”

original: sngags shes sngags dang @56b phyag rgya yis //
analyzed: sngags shes sngags dang @56b phyag rgya yis //
translated: The one who knows the mantra, with mantra and mudrā,

original: zhes bya ba la sngags shes ni rnal 'byor pa lha'i ting nge 'dzin dang ldan pa de'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sngags shes ni rnal 'byor pa lha'i ting nge 'dzin dang ldan pa de'o //
translated: The one who knows the mantra is the yogi endowed with the meditative concentration of the deity.

original: sngags dang ni rtsa ba'i sngags rnams so //
analyzed: sngags dang ni rtsa ba'i sngags rnams so //
translated: “Mantra” refers to the root mantras.

original: phyag rgya ni phyag rgya bzhi ste /
analyzed: phyag rgya ni phyag rgya bzhi ste /
translated: “Mudrā” refers to the four mudrās:

original: dam tshig dang / chos dang / las dang phyag rgya chen po'o //
analyzed: dam tshig dang / chos dang / las dang phyag rgya chen po'o //
translated: the samaya mudrā, the dharma mudrā, the karma mudrā, and the mahāmudrā.

original: yang na sngags dang phyag rgya phyi nang gi lha mo rnams kyi sngags dang phyag rgya'o //
