original: aargham dbul bar brtags nas de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni mchod yon dbul bar bya ste /
analyzed: aargham dbul bar brtags nas de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni mchod yon dbul bar bya ste /
translated: Having imagined that one should offer the arghaṃ, “thus” means that one should offer the drinking water.

original: lag pa g-yas ba'i sor mo thams cad bkug la mthe bong dang mdzub mo gnyis sbyar bas me tog blangs te zhabs bsil phul te sor mo rnams brkyang ba ni zhabs bsil gyi phyag rgya ste /
analyzed: lag pa g-yas ba'i sor mo thams cad bkug la mthe bong dang mdzub mo gnyis sbyar bas me tog blangs te zhabs bsil phul te sor mo rnams brkyang ba ni zhabs bsil gyi phyag rgya ste /
translated: Having bent all the fingers of the right hand, and having joined the thumb and the forefinger, one should take up the flower, offer the water for the feet, and extend the fingers. This is the seal of the water for the feet.

original: aom pra ba ra sa tk'a ra tyam pra t'itstsha sv'a h'a zhes bya'o //
analyzed: aom pra ba ra sa tk'a ra tyam pra t'itstsha sv'a h'a zhes bya'o //
translated: The mantra is: Om, I offer the water for the feet. Svâhâ!

original: de nas mchod yon phyag tu dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas mchod yon phyag tu dbul bar bya'o //
translated: Then one should offer the libation in the hand.

original: ai mam aargham ma ya tra ta ma kri ha na siddhimme pra yatstsha sv'a h'a /
analyzed: ai mam aargham ma ya tra ta ma kri ha na siddhimme pra yatstsha sv'a h'a /
translated: The mantra is: I offer the libation. Grant me success! Svâhâ!

original: mchod yon len gsum dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: mchod yon len gsum dbul bar bya'o //
translated: One should offer the libation three times.

original: de nas lce la rdo rje dkar po rnam par bsams la /
analyzed: de nas lce la rdo rje dkar po rnam par bsams la /
translated: Then, having visualized a white vajra on the tongue,🔽one should place the fire-element seal with the mantra,

original: aom badzra dzva la dzva la h'um phat ces pas me'i chos kyi phyag rgya dgod de /
analyzed: aom badzra dzva la dzva la h'um phat ces pas me'i chos kyi phyag rgya dgod de /
translated: Om, blaze, blaze, vajra! Hûm, phaṭ!

original: de la sogs pa las kyi phyag rgya dang ; dbang bskur ba dang / dam tshig bsgrags pa dang / brtan par bya ba dang / las bcol ba dang / phyi nang gi mchod pas mchod pa dang / de nas me lha'i lce dang dgang gzar dang /
analyzed: de la sogs pa las kyi phyag rgya dang ; dbang bskur ba dang / dam tshig bsgrags pa dang / brtan par bya ba dang / las bcol ba dang / phyi nang gi mchod pas mchod pa dang / de nas me lha'i lce dang dgang gzar dang /
translated: and so forth, the ritual of the action seal, the conferral of initiation, the proclamation of the sacred pledge, the stabilization, the assignment of activities, the offering with outer and inner offerings, and then the visualization of the flame and the ladle and the funnel of the fire god,

original: blugs gzar gyi kha la ram bsams te /
analyzed: blugs gzar gyi kha la ram bsams te /
translated: and the syllable ram at the mouth of the funnel.

original: bus mo gnyis kyi bar du lag pa bzhag ste sreg rdzas kyis mchod pa dang bstod pa la sogs pa bya'o //
analyzed: bus mo gnyis kyi bar du lag pa bzhag ste sreg rdzas kyis mchod pa dang bstod pa la sogs pa bya'o //
translated: Placing the hands between the knees, one should make offerings with the articles for burning and praise and so forth.🔽Placing the form and so forth in front of the one with supreme awareness,

original: blo mchog ldan pa'i mdun du gzugs sogs bzhag / ces pa ni me lha de mchod pas mchod pa'i rten la dbang por mdun du bzhugs su gsol ba'o //
analyzed: blo mchog ldan pa'i mdun du gzugs sogs bzhag / ces pa ni me lha de mchod pas mchod pa'i rten la dbang por mdun du bzhugs su gsol ba'o //
translated: means that by making offerings to that fire god, one requests the deity to remain as the sense object in front.

original: ji skad gsungs pa'i yon tan 'dod pa yis //
analyzed: ji skad gsungs pa'i yon tan 'dod pa yis //
translated: One who desires the qualities as they are taught

original: zhes bya ba ni kun rig rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa mchod de /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni kun rig rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa mchod de /
translated: means that one makes offerings to the all-knowing Vairocana and so forth.

original: de'i don yang 'di ltar shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i don yang 'di ltar shes par bya ste /
translated: The meaning of that is to be understood in the following way.

original: de nas me lha dam tshig sems dpa' de'i thugs kar rdo rje 'khor lo'i sngags dang phyag rgyas rin po che'i gzhal yas khang re mig dgu lte ba dang bcas pa'i 'khor lo rtsibs bcu drug pa gru chad dang / khyams dang / sgo khyud dang /
analyzed: de nas me lha dam tshig sems dpa' de'i thugs kar rdo rje 'khor lo'i sngags dang phyag rgyas rin po che'i gzhal yas khang re mig dgu lte ba dang bcas pa'i 'khor lo rtsibs bcu drug pa gru chad dang / khyams dang / sgo khyud dang /
translated: Then, at the heart of the pledge fire god, visualize a jeweled celestial mansion with nine chambers, a center, and a wheel with sixteen spokes, with a courtyard, porticoes,

original: rta babs dang / them skas la sogs pas brgyan par bsams la /
analyzed: rta babs dang / them skas la sogs pas brgyan par bsams la /
translated: and adorned with archways, stairways, and so forth.

original: me lha'i thugs ka'i zla ba dang padma'i steng du lha rnams re re sa bon na gyi yi ge yongs su gyur pa'i mtshan ma las byung pa las dang rjes su mthun pa'i rgyan dang / @60a * //
analyzed: me lha'i thugs ka'i zla ba dang padma'i steng du lha rnams re re sa bon na gyi yi ge yongs su gyur pa'i mtshan ma las byung pa las dang rjes su mthun pa'i rgyan dang / @60a * //
translated: On the moon and lotus at the heart of the fire god, visualize the individual seed syllables of the deities, which transform into the insignia that arise from the seed syllables.

original: kha dog la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i kun rig rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa dmigs te gsal bar bsam mo //
analyzed: kha dog la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i kun rig rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa dmigs te gsal bar bsam mo //
translated: Then, visualize the deities, such as Samantabhadra Vairocana, who are endowed with ornaments, colors, and so forth that are in accordance with their activities.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa tshogs de ltar spyan drangs la zhes bya ba ni sgo dbye ba byas nas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa tshogs de ltar spyan drangs la zhes bya ba ni sgo dbye ba byas nas /
translated: Then, having invited the assembly of tathāgatas, as stated in the verse “having opened the door,”

original: bdag gi snying gar sna tshogs rdo rje bsams pa las rdo rje bsdu ba'i snying po aom badzra sa m'a dza: dza: zhes brjod cing rdo rje khu tshur gnyis bsnol te dpung mgor bzhag la mdzub mo gnyis lcags kyu ltar byas la gung mo dang mthe bong gnyis
analyzed: bdag gi snying gar sna tshogs rdo rje bsams pa las rdo rje bsdu ba'i snying po aom badzra sa m'a dza: dza: zhes brjod cing rdo rje khu tshur gnyis bsnol te dpung mgor bzhag la mdzub mo gnyis lcags kyu ltar byas la gung mo dang mthe bong gnyis
translated: and cross the two vajra fists and place them on the shoulders, making the two index fingers into hooks, and the two middle fingers and thumbs🔽touch each other.

original: gtogs shing de bzhin gshegs pa 'khor dang bcas pa rnams rang rang gi gnas nas bskul te /
analyzed: gtogs shing de bzhin gshegs pa 'khor dang bcas pa rnams rang rang gi gnas nas bskul te /
translated: Having summoned the tathāgatas together with their retinues from their own abodes,

original: ji ltar bsam pa'i gnas kyi kho ra khor yug du bzhugs par bsam mo //
analyzed: ji ltar bsam pa'i gnas kyi kho ra khor yug du bzhugs par bsam mo //
translated: one should imagine them dwelling in the surrounding area of the imagined place.

original: de nas mchod yon phul te bstod pas bstod la /
analyzed: de nas mchod yon phul te bstod pas bstod la /
translated: Then, having offered a welcome drink and praised with the praise,

original: rdo rje gnod sbyin gyis rang bzhin gyis phyi nas 'ong ba'i bgegs bskrad par bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje gnod sbyin gyis rang bzhin gyis phyi nas 'ong ba'i bgegs bskrad par bya'o //
translated: one should frighten away the obstructors who come from outside by nature with Vajrayakṣa.

original: de nas shar phyogs kyi sgor rdo rje lcags kyu'i las kyi phyag rgya bcings te phyag rgya de nyid shar phyogs kyi sgor lcags kyu ltar gyur par bsams la /
analyzed: de nas shar phyogs kyi sgor rdo rje lcags kyu'i las kyi phyag rgya bcings te phyag rgya de nyid shar phyogs kyi sgor lcags kyu ltar gyur par bsams la /
translated: Then, having formed the karma-mudra of the vajra-hook at the eastern door, one should imagine that very mudra becoming a hook at the eastern door.

original: aom badzra aom ku sha dza: dza: zhes brjod pas lcags kyus dgug pa'i tshul gyis de bzhin gshegs pa rnams so so'i sgo drung du byon par bsam mo //
analyzed: aom badzra aom ku sha dza: dza: zhes brjod pas lcags kyus dgug pa'i tshul gyis de bzhin gshegs pa rnams so so'i sgo drung du byon par bsam mo //
translated: Saying Oṃ vajra āṃ kuśa jaḥ, jaḥ, imagine that the tathāgatas are summoned to the door of their respective palaces with the hook gesture.

original: phyag rgya de nyid bkrol nas lho phyogs kyi sgor zhags pa'i las kyi phyag rgya bcings te /
analyzed: phyag rgya de nyid bkrol nas lho phyogs kyi sgor zhags pa'i las kyi phyag rgya bcings te /
translated: Unraveling that mudra, form the lasso karma mudra at the southern gate.

original: phyag rgya de nyid lho phyogs kyi sgor zhags par gyur par bsams la aom badzra p'a sha h'um zhes brjod pas zhags pas drangs pa'i tshul gyis de bzhin gshegs pa rnams so so'i sgo'i nang du zhugs par bsam mo //
analyzed: phyag rgya de nyid lho phyogs kyi sgor zhags par gyur par bsams la aom badzra p'a sha h'um zhes brjod pas zhags pas drangs pa'i tshul gyis de bzhin gshegs pa rnams so so'i sgo'i nang du zhugs par bsam mo //
translated: Imagine that mudra becomes a lasso at the southern gate and say Oṃ vajra pāśa hūṃ. Imagine that the tathāgatas are drawn inside their respective gates with the lasso gesture.

original: phyag rgya de nyid bkrol nas nub phyogs kyi sgor lcags sgrog gi phyag rgya bcings te /
analyzed: phyag rgya de nyid bkrol nas nub phyogs kyi sgor lcags sgrog gi phyag rgya bcings te /
translated: Unraveling that mudra, form the chain karma mudra at the western gate.

original: phyag rgya de nyid nub phyogs kyi sgro lcags sgrog tu gyur par bsams la /
analyzed: phyag rgya de nyid nub phyogs kyi sgro lcags sgrog tu gyur par bsams la /
translated: Imagine that mudra becomes a chain at the western gate and say Oṃ vajra śṛṅkha hūṃ.

original: aom badzra spo ta bam zhes brjod pas lcags sgrog gis bsdam pa'i tshul gyis de bzhin gshegs pa rnams so so'i sgo'i nang du zhugs par bsam mo //
analyzed: aom badzra spo ta bam zhes brjod pas lcags sgrog gis bsdam pa'i tshul gyis de bzhin gshegs pa rnams so so'i sgo'i nang du zhugs par bsam mo //
translated: Saying OṂ Vajra SPHOṬA VAṂ, imagine that the tathāgatas enter into each of the gates in the manner of binding with an iron chain.

original: phyag rgya de nyid bkrol nas byang phyogs kyi sgor rdo rje 'bebs pa'i las kyi phyag rgya bcings te /
analyzed: phyag rgya de nyid bkrol nas byang phyogs kyi sgor rdo rje 'bebs pa'i las kyi phyag rgya bcings te /
translated: Untie that mudrā, form the karma mudrā of Vajra Āveśa at the northern gate,

original: phyag rgya de nyid byang phyogs kyi sgor dril bur gyur par bsams la /
analyzed: phyag rgya de nyid byang phyogs kyi sgor dril bur gyur par bsams la /
translated: and imagine that mudrā itself becomes a bell at the northern gate.

original: aom badzra a'a be sha ho: zhes brjod cing dril bu bskyod pa'i tshul gyis de bzhin gshegs pa rnams mnyes par bsams te phyag rgya de nyid dgrol @60b lo ;
analyzed: aom badzra a'a be sha ho: zhes brjod cing dril bu bskyod pa'i tshul gyis de bzhin gshegs pa rnams mnyes par bsams te phyag rgya de nyid dgrol @60b lo ;
translated: Saying OṂ Vajra ĀVEŚA HOḥ, imagine that the tathāgatas are pleased by the movement of the bell, and untie that mudrā.

original: / de nas dkyil 'khor gyi lha de rnams la dbang bskur ba dang byin gyis brlab pa dang / phyag rgya bzhis rgyas gdab pa rnams bya'o //
analyzed: / de nas dkyil 'khor gyi lha de rnams la dbang bskur ba dang byin gyis brlab pa dang / phyag rgya bzhis rgyas gdab pa rnams bya'o //
translated: Then, confer empowerment, consecration, and seal with the four seals upon those deities of the maṇḍala.

original: aargham la sogs dbul zhing de bzhin du //
analyzed: aargham la sogs dbul zhing de bzhin du //
translated: Make offerings of arghaṃ and so on, and likewise

original: bde gshegs gsungs pa'i mchod pa gang yin bya //
analyzed: bde gshegs gsungs pa'i mchod pa gang yin bya //
translated: make the offerings taught by the Sugata.

original: zhas  bya ba ni phyag btsal ba dang / mchod pa rnam pa lngas mchod pa dang / phyi nang gi mchod pa brgyad kyis mchod pa dang / mchod pa nyi shus mchod pa bya ste ye shes sems dpa'i thugs ka'i mtshan ma'i dbus su rang gi chos kyi yi ges dkyil 'khor gyi lha thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid du mthong ste /
analyzed: zhas  bya ba ni phyag btsal ba dang / mchod pa rnam pa lngas mchod pa dang / phyi nang gi mchod pa brgyad kyis mchod pa dang / mchod pa nyi shus mchod pa bya ste ye shes sems dpa'i thugs ka'i mtshan ma'i dbus su rang gi chos kyi yi ges dkyil 'khor gyi lha thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid du mthong ste /
translated: The phrase having bowed down means that one should bow down and make offerings with the five types of offerings, the eight outer and inner offerings, and the twenty offerings, and then, in the center of the sign in the heart of the gnosis being, one should see all the deities of the maṇḍala in the nature of one's own seed syllable.

original: yang mchod yon phul /
analyzed: yang mchod yon phul /
translated: Again, offer the drinking water.

original: 'thor 'thung gis snga ma bzhin du sbyin sreg gi yo byad thams cad bsang gtor byas la /
analyzed: 'thor 'thung gis snga ma bzhin du sbyin sreg gi yo byad thams cad bsang gtor byas la /
translated: As before, sprinkle and purify all the articles for the burnt offering with the sprinkling water.

original: dgang gzang dang blugs gzar lag tu thogs te /
analyzed: dgang gzang dang blugs gzar lag tu thogs te /
translated: Holding the ladle and the funnel in the hand,

original: de nas byin za la ni brtag par bya //🔽zhes pa ni byin za brtag ste /
analyzed: de nas byin za la ni brtag par bya // zhes pa ni byin za brtag ste /
translated: then one should examine the sacrificial ladle.

original: dbyibs dang kha dog legs par bsam pa'o //
analyzed: dbyibs dang kha dog legs par bsam pa'o //
translated: The phrase one should examine the sacrificial ladle means that one should examine the shape and color.

original: bsreg byas bkang ste sbar bar bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: bsreg byas bkang ste sbar bar bya ba'i phyir //
translated: In order to fill it with the burnt offering and ignite it,

original: zhes pa ni dgang gzar mar gyis bkang ste sbar bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni dgang gzar mar gyis bkang ste sbar bar bya'o //
translated: the ladle should be filled with ghee and ignited.

original: sreg rdzas kyis mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: sreg rdzas kyis mchod par bya'o //
translated: One should make offerings with the burnt substances.

original: de nas bsreg byas bkang ste rim gyis ni //
analyzed: de nas bsreg byas bkang ste rim gyis ni //
translated: Then, having filled it with the burnt offerings, one should offer

original: rgyal la sogs pa la brgya rtsa brgyad du btags //
analyzed: rgyal la sogs pa la brgya rtsa brgyad du btags //
translated: one hundred and eight times to the Victorious Ones and so forth.

original: zhes pa ni de las dang por gtso bo la dbul lo //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de las dang por gtso bo la dbul lo //
translated: This is the offering to the principal deity first of all.

original: de nas rgyal ba rigs lnga dang / sems dpa' bcug drug la brgya rtsa brgyad dbul lo //
analyzed: de nas rgyal ba rigs lnga dang / sems dpa' bcug drug la brgya rtsa brgyad dbul lo //
translated: Then one should offer one hundred and eight times to the five Victorious Ones and the six sages.

original: de nas sbyong ba'i sngags kyi rgyal po la //
analyzed: de nas sbyong ba'i sngags kyi rgyal po la //
translated: Then, to the king of purifying mantras,

original: bsreg par bya ba nyi shu rtsa gcig dbul //
analyzed: bsreg par bya ba nyi shu rtsa gcig dbul //
translated: one should offer twenty-one burnt offerings.

original: zhes pa ni rdzas de rnams ni me'i zhal du bstab bo //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rdzas de rnams ni me'i zhal du bstab bo //
translated: This means that those substances are offered into the mouth of the fire.

original: lhag ma rnams la ni nyi shu rtsa gcig gis mchod do //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams la ni nyi shu rtsa gcig gis mchod do //
translated: The remaining [offerings] are made with twenty-one [offerings].

original: de nas bstod pas bstod do //
analyzed: de nas bstod pas bstod do //
translated: Then one should praise with the praises.

original: de nas gang 'dod pa'i dngos grub rnams gsol ba gdab bo //
analyzed: de nas gang 'dod pa'i dngos grub rnams gsol ba gdab bo //
translated: Then one should request the accomplishments that one desires.

original: de nas bzod par gsol te yi ge brgya pas bya'o //
analyzed: de nas bzod par gsol te yi ge brgya pas bya'o //
translated: Then one should request forbearance with the hundred-syllable [mantra].

original: de nas spyan drangs pa gshegs su gsol lo //
analyzed: de nas spyan drangs pa gshegs su gsol lo //
translated: Then one should request the invited [deities] to depart.

original: dam tshig sems dpa' lus la bsdu'o //
analyzed: dam tshig sems dpa' lus la bsdu'o //
translated: The pledge beings are gathered into the body.

original: de nas spyan drangs yo byad lan gsum dang // mchod yon la sogs padma'i dkar zhal mchod //
analyzed: de nas spyan drangs yo byad lan gsum dang // mchod yon la sogs padma'i dkar zhal mchod //
translated: Then, having invited him with the articles three times, and with the water for the feet, etc., one should worship the lotus-faced one.

original: ces bya ba de las ye shes kyi me lha de shar lho mtshams nas thab nang gi rang gi lus la zhugs pa'i phyir spyan drangs te /
analyzed: ces bya ba de las ye shes kyi me lha de shar lho mtshams nas thab nang gi rang gi lus la zhugs pa'i phyir spyan drangs te /
translated: Having invited the wisdom fire god from the southeast, he enters the body of the fire god in the hearth.

original: me lha de la mchod yon la sogs pa phul te /
analyzed: me lha de la mchod yon la sogs pa phul te /
translated: Having offered the water for the feet, etc., to the fire god,

original: yo byad lhag ma rnams kyis lan gsum gsum du sbyin sreg bya'o //
analyzed: yo byad lhag ma rnams kyis lan gsum gsum du sbyin sreg bya'o //
translated: one should perform the burnt offering three times with the remaining articles.

original: de'i mtha' mar yon bdag g-yon du bzhag la @61a * //
analyzed: de'i mtha' mar yon bdag g-yon du bzhag la @61a * //
translated: At the end of that, one should place the patron to the left

original: sgrub pa pos dngos grub gang 'dod pa gsol ba gdab bo //
analyzed: sgrub pa pos dngos grub gang 'dod pa gsol ba gdab bo //
translated: and the adept should request whatever spiritual power he desires.

original: de nas bdag gi don dang gzhan gyi don //🔽byin za khyod ni grub lags kyis //
analyzed: de nas bdag gi don dang gzhan gyi don // byin za khyod ni grub lags kyis //
translated: Then, for one's own benefit and the benefit of others,🔽one should request the departure with: O Agni, you are accomplished,

original: ji bzhin don du slar gshegs la //
analyzed: ji bzhin don du slar gshegs la //
translated: please return to your abode

original: slar yang sems can don la gshegs //🔽zhes pas gshegs su gsol lo //
analyzed: slar yang sems can don la gshegs // zhes pas gshegs su gsol lo //
translated: and go again for the benefit of sentient beings.

original: phyag na rdo rje padma'i zhags pa bsnams //
analyzed: phyag na rdo rje padma'i zhags pa bsnams //
translated: Then, one should request the departure of Vajrapāṇi, the holder of the lotus noose,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni yang me thab dang yo byad rnams bsangs la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni yang me thab dang yo byad rnams bsangs la /
translated: Having purified the hearth and the articles as before,

original: bdag dam tshig sems dpar bsgoms pa'i thugs kar yi ge h'um bsams pa las /
analyzed: bdag dam tshig sems dpar bsgoms pa'i thugs kar yi ge h'um bsams pa las /
translated: one should meditate on oneself as the pledge being, and imagine the syllable hūṃ at one’s heart.

original: bdag nyid khro bo phyag na rdo rje h'um zhes bya bar gyur te bzhin dang cha lugs khro bo'i tshul can du bsam mo //
analyzed: bdag nyid khro bo phyag na rdo rje h'um zhes bya bar gyur te bzhin dang cha lugs khro bo'i tshul can du bsam mo //
translated: From that, one becomes oneself as Vajrapāṇi, the wrathful one called hūṃ, with a wrathful countenance and attire.

original: mdun du me thab tu yang yi ge h'um las rdo rje sems dpar gyur nas /
analyzed: mdun du me thab tu yang yi ge h'um las rdo rje sems dpar gyur nas /
translated: In front, in the hearth, from the syllable hūṃ, Vajrasattva arises.

original: rdo rje sems dpa'i thugs ka nas aom badzra satva kro dha aa na l'arka ma h'a badzra kro dha dra ba dra ba bi dra ba bi dra ba /
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa'i thugs ka nas aom badzra satva kro dha aa na l'arka ma h'a badzra kro dha dra ba dra ba bi dra ba bi dra ba /
translated: From the heart of Vajrasattva, one recites oṃ vajrasattva krodhānāla mahāvajra krodha drava drava vidrava vidrava sarvapāpaṃ nāśaya nāśaya hara hara pāpaṃ hūṃ phaṭ.

original: sarba p'a pam n'a sha ya n'a sha ya ha ra ha ra pr'a n'a na h'um phat ces brjod pas khro bo khams gsum rnam par rgyal ba'i gzugs su gyur te /
analyzed: sarba p'a pam n'a sha ya n'a sha ya ha ra ha ra pr'a n'a na h'um phat ces brjod pas khro bo khams gsum rnam par rgyal ba'i gzugs su gyur te /
translated: Through that, he becomes the form of the wrathful one, the conqueror of the three worlds.

original: sku mdog sngon po zhal bgrang cing mche ba gtsigs pa /
analyzed: sku mdog sngon po zhal bgrang cing mche ba gtsigs pa /
translated: He has a blue body, with bared fangs and a gaping mouth.

original: phyag na rdo rje dang padma dang ral gri dang zhags pa bsnams pa'o //
analyzed: phyag na rdo rje dang padma dang ral gri dang zhags pa bsnams pa'o //
translated: He holds a vajra, lotus, sword, and lasso in his hands.

original: zhabs kyi padmas sdig mnan cing //
analyzed: zhabs kyi padmas sdig mnan cing //
translated: His lotus feet trample on the evil ones.

original: zhes pa ni khams gsum rnam par rgyal ba'i zhabs kyi padmas ma h'a de ba mnan pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni khams gsum rnam par rgyal ba'i zhabs kyi padmas ma h'a de ba mnan pa'o //
translated: This means that the lotus feet of Trailokyavijaya trample on Mahadeva.

original: sku la sprul gyis brgyan pa /
analyzed: sku la sprul gyis brgyan pa /
translated: His body is adorned with snakes.

original: sku smad stag gi pags pas dkris ba 'khor khro bo mang pos bskor ba ni //
analyzed: sku smad stag gi pags pas dkris ba 'khor khro bo mang pos bskor ba ni //
translated: The lower part of his body is wrapped in a tiger skin. He is surrounded by a retinue of many wrathful ones.

original: rgyan rnams kun gyis legs brgyan pa //
analyzed: rgyan rnams kun gyis legs brgyan pa //
translated: He is well adorned with all ornaments.

original: zhes pa'o // rdzogs sangs rgyas ni dbu rgyan mtho //
analyzed: zhes pa'o // rdzogs sangs rgyas ni dbu rgyan mtho //
translated: The perfect Buddha is seen on his crown.

original: zhes pa ni rigs lnga'i sangs rgyas kyis dbu la brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rigs lnga'i sangs rgyas kyis dbu la brgyan pa'o //
translated: This means that the Buddhas of the five families adorn his head.

original: bsams sam ni ting nge 'dzin no //
analyzed: bsams sam ni ting nge 'dzin no //
translated: Imagined means in samadhi.

original: bris pa ni mig gi rten to //
analyzed: bris pa ni mig gi rten to //
translated: Drawn means as an eye support.

original: de ltar khro bo de bskyed la ye shes kyi khro bo yang spyan drangs te /
analyzed: de ltar khro bo de bskyed la ye shes kyi khro bo yang spyan drangs te /
translated: Having generated that wrathful one in that way, the wisdom wrathful one is also invited.

original: bstims la mchod yon dang zhabs bsil la sogs pa dbul lo //
analyzed: bstims la mchod yon dang zhabs bsil la sogs pa dbul lo //
translated: Having dissolved him, offer the welcoming water, foot-washing water, and so on.

original: de yi snying pos de bzhin du //
analyzed: de yi snying pos de bzhin du //
translated: With his essence, do the same.

original: zhes bya ba ni dang por khro bo'i sngags gong mas mar dang yam shing phul la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dang por khro bo'i sngags gong mas mar dang yam shing phul la /
translated: This is the first.

original: de nas rdzas rnams gcig tu bsres te bdud rtsi 'khyil pa'i sngags kyis btab la /
analyzed: de nas rdzas rnams gcig tu bsres te bdud rtsi 'khyil pa'i sngags kyis btab la /
translated: Then, having mixed the substances together, one should consecrate them with the mantra of Amṛtakuṇḍali.

original: lag pa g-yon pa khu tshur bcangs nas /
analyzed: lag pa g-yon pa khu tshur bcangs nas /
translated: Having made a fist with the left hand,

original: brang la dpung pa dam du bcum la lag pa g-yas pas sbyin sreg bya'o //
analyzed: brang la dpung pa dam du bcum la lag pa g-yas pas sbyin sreg bya'o //
translated: one should tightly bind the arm to the chest, and with the right hand one should perform the homa.

original: rnam par rgyal ba'i sngags dang @61b shi ba'i ming spel la brgya'am stong ngam bye ba'i tshad du sbyin sreg bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par rgyal ba'i sngags dang @61b shi ba'i ming spel la brgya'am stong ngam bye ba'i tshad du sbyin sreg bya'o //
translated: One should perform the homa with the mantra of Jayā, repeating the name of the deceased, for a count of one hundred, one thousand, or ten thousand.

original: bar bar du ming 'di zhes bya ba'i nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa thams cad sarba p'a pam da ha na badzr'a ya sv'a h'a /🔽zhes brjod cing til bsreg go / phyi ma dkyus na gsal lo //
analyzed: bar bar du ming 'di zhes bya ba'i nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa thams cad sarba p'a pam da ha na badzr'a ya sv'a h'a / zhes brjod cing til bsreg go / phyi ma dkyus na gsal lo //
translated: In between, one should recite, “All the afflictive obscurations of the one named so-and-so, svāhā,” and burn sesame seeds.

original: de nas khro bo gshegs su gsol la bdag nyid phyag rgya bkrol zhing lus bsrung ba la sogs pa bya'o //
analyzed: de nas khro bo gshegs su gsol la bdag nyid phyag rgya bkrol zhing lus bsrung ba la sogs pa bya'o //
translated: Then, having requested the wrathful one to depart, one should release the mudra, protect one’s body, and so on.

original: de nas thal bar gyur pa dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de ltar bsregs nas thal bar gyur pa dang / rdo rje bsdu ba'i sngags sam ha ra na badzra h'um zhes pa'i cho gas bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas thal bar gyur pa dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de ltar bsregs nas thal bar gyur pa dang / rdo rje bsdu ba'i sngags sam ha ra na badzra h'um zhes pa'i cho gas bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: and so forth. Having burned it in that way, when it has become ash, one should gather it with the mantra for gathering the vajra, “saharaṇavajra hūṃ.”

original: de ltar rus pa dang thal ba de bsdus nas snod gtsang mar bcug ste /
analyzed: de ltar rus pa dang thal ba de bsdus nas snod gtsang mar bcug ste /
translated: Having gathered the bones and ash in that way, one should place them in a clean vessel.

original: mchod rten gdab pa'i phyogs su gzhag go /
analyzed: mchod rten gdab pa'i phyogs su gzhag go /
translated: One should place it in the direction of the stūpa.

original: sngags kyis btab pa'i dri chu dang // zhes pa la sogs pa ni ga bur la sogs pa'i dri chu dang / ba skyes 'o ma la sogs te ba'i rnam lnga dang / rus pa la ngan song sbyong ba'i sngags 'bum yan chad bzlas la /
analyzed: sngags kyis btab pa'i dri chu dang // zhes pa la sogs pa ni ga bur la sogs pa'i dri chu dang / ba skyes 'o ma la sogs te ba'i rnam lnga dang / rus pa la ngan song sbyong ba'i sngags 'bum yan chad bzlas la /
translated: One should anoint it with scented water enchanted with the mantra, and so forth. One should anoint it with scented water of camphor and so forth, the five products of the cow such as cow’s milk, and so forth, and the bones enchanted with the mantra for purifying the lower realms at least one hundred thousand times.🔽One should make it into a form,

original: gzugs su bya ba'am zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor gyi lha gang yang rung bar bya ba'am /
analyzed: gzugs su bya ba'am zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor gyi lha gang yang rung bar bya ba'am /
translated: and so forth. One should make it into any deity of the maṇḍala,

original: yang na ni /
analyzed: yang na ni /
translated: or else,

original: mchod rten gyi ni lhar byas la //
analyzed: mchod rten gyi ni lhar byas la //
translated: one should make it into the deity of the stūpa.

original: zhes bya ba ni yang na mchod rten gyi gzugs su byas te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni yang na mchod rten gyi gzugs su byas te /
translated: One should make it into the form of a stūpa.

original: gcig gam gnyis sam gsum mam lnga'am yang na brgya rtsa brgyad kyi bar du gdab bo //
analyzed: gcig gam gnyis sam gsum mam lnga'am yang na brgya rtsa brgyad kyi bar du gdab bo //
translated: One should do this once, twice, three times, five times, or up to one hundred and eight times.

original: sngags dang phyag rgyas gdab par bya//
analyzed: sngags dang phyag rgyas gdab par bya//
translated: One should seal with the mantra and the mudrā.

original: zhes pa ni ngan song sbyong ba'i sngags dang phyag rgyas gdab bo //
analyzed: zhes pa ni ngan song sbyong ba'i sngags dang phyag rgyas gdab bo //
translated: This means sealing with the mantra and mudrā of the Purification of All Bad Transmigrations.

original: ji tsam du sngags gdab pa na 'bum phrag gnyis kyi bar du bzlas zhes so //
analyzed: ji tsam du sngags gdab pa na 'bum phrag gnyis kyi bar du bzlas zhes so //
translated: As for how many times to recite the mantra, one should recite it up to two hundred thousand times.

original: de nas mchod rten la sogs pa la 'bar bar gyur tam yang na sku'i zhal 'dzum pa la sogs pa'i mtshan ma byung byung du bzlas so //
analyzed: de nas mchod rten la sogs pa la 'bar bar gyur tam yang na sku'i zhal 'dzum pa la sogs pa'i mtshan ma byung byung du bzlas so //
translated: Then, when the stūpa and so forth blaze with light, or when the face of the image smiles, and so forth, one should recite the mantra until the signs occur.

original: mtshan ma ni dkyus na gsal lo //
analyzed: mtshan ma ni dkyus na gsal lo //
translated: The signs are clear in the text.

original: ci ste mtshan ma de dag ni //
analyzed: ci ste mtshan ma de dag ni //
translated: If those signs

original: sdig can blo yis ma mthong na //
analyzed: sdig can blo yis ma mthong na //
translated: are not seen by the mind of the sinful one,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: and so forth.

original: mtshan ma de dag ma thob na 'bum phrag stong man chad bzlas shing /
analyzed: mtshan ma de dag ma thob na 'bum phrag stong man chad bzlas shing /
translated: If those signs are not attained, one should recite the mantra up to one thousand times one hundred thousand.

original: ji srid mtshan ma dge ba ma byung gi bar du de bzhin gshegs pa rnams mchod cing rtse gcig pa'i sems kyis mnyam par gzhag cing bzlas brjed bya'o //
analyzed: ji srid mtshan ma dge ba ma byung gi bar du de bzhin gshegs pa rnams mchod cing rtse gcig pa'i sems kyis mnyam par gzhag cing bzlas brjed bya'o //
translated: As long as the auspicious signs do not appear, one should make offerings to the Tathāgatas, and with a one-pointed mind, one should rest in equipoise and recite the mantra.

original: de ltar bzlas pa'i mthar mtshan gcig bzlas pa rab tu byas na shi ba de nges par sdig pa las grol zhing mtshan ma bzang po rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ro //🔽de dag ni ro'i dbang du byas pa'i rim pa slob dpon kun dga' snying pos @62a * //
analyzed: de ltar bzlas pa'i mthar mtshan gcig bzlas pa rab tu byas na shi ba de nges par sdig pa las grol zhing mtshan ma bzang po rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ro // de dag ni ro'i dbang du byas pa'i rim pa slob dpon kun dga' snying pos @62a * //
translated: At the end of such recitation, if one performs the recitation for one night, then that deceased person will definitely be freed from evil and the auspicious signs will appear.

original: mdzad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: mdzad pa rdzogs so /
translated: This concludes the procedure for the corpse composed by Ācārya Ānandagarbha.

original: // / yang na med par gyur na yang //
analyzed: // / yang na med par gyur na yang //
translated: Or if it has disappeared,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni ro med par gyur na ming tsam gyis rnam pa bzung nas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni ro med par gyur na ming tsam gyis rnam pa bzung nas /
translated: and so forth. If the corpse has disappeared, one should take hold of the form with just the name,

original: sngags la sogs pa bzlas pa dang bdag lha'i skur bskyed pa des na sbyong ba'i sngags bzlas shing shi ba'i ming dam rus pa dang spel te bzlas pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: sngags la sogs pa bzlas pa dang bdag lha'i skur bskyed pa des na sbyong ba'i sngags bzlas shing shi ba'i ming dam rus pa dang spel te bzlas pa'i phyir na /
translated: and recite the mantra and so on. By generating oneself as the deity's body, one should recite the purifying mantra, combining the name of the deceased with the mantra.

original: zlos shing bsgoms pa'i tshul gyis ni //
analyzed: zlos shing bsgoms pa'i tshul gyis ni //
translated: And by the method of meditating on it again and again,

original: ming tsam legs par bris nas kyang //
analyzed: ming tsam legs par bris nas kyang //
translated: Even by just writing the name well,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: and so forth.

original: sngags kyi 'od zer gyis dmigs par bya ba'i rten shog bu'am gro ga la bris te de la bstims pas de las dang nyon mongs pa'i bag chags dag par byed de /
analyzed: sngags kyi 'od zer gyis dmigs par bya ba'i rten shog bu'am gro ga la bris te de la bstims pas de las dang nyon mongs pa'i bag chags dag par byed de /
translated: The light rays of the mantra purify the latent tendencies of karma and afflictions on the support of the visualized object, written on paper or birch bark.

original: 'jim pa dang bsres te mchod rten gyi phreng ba bya ba'am /
analyzed: 'jim pa dang bsres te mchod rten gyi phreng ba bya ba'am /
translated: Mix it with clay and make a rosary of stūpas,

original: yang na lha'i gzugs su bris kyang rung ste /
analyzed: yang na lha'i gzugs su bris kyang rung ste /
translated: or write it as the form of the deity.

original: sdig pa bsreg pa'i sbyin sreg gam //
analyzed: sdig pa bsreg pa'i sbyin sreg gam //
translated: The burnt offering to burn away misdeeds,

original: dbang rnams rdzogs par bskur na yang //
analyzed: dbang rnams rdzogs par bskur na yang //
translated: or even if the empowerments are fully conferred,

original: gdon mi za bar mtho ris su skye'o //
analyzed: gdon mi za bar mtho ris su skye'o //
translated: one will definitely be reborn in the higher realms.

original: yang na thal ba nyid dam rus pa la /
analyzed: yang na thal ba nyid dam rus pa la /
translated: Or else, on the ashes themselves or the bones,

original: yungs kar ram bye ma la sogs pa la ming nas brjod cing sngags bzlas na yang rgya mtshor 'bab pa'i chu klung du dor ro //
analyzed: yungs kar ram bye ma la sogs pa la ming nas brjod cing sngags bzlas na yang rgya mtshor 'bab pa'i chu klung du dor ro //
translated: recite the name and mantra on mustard seeds, sand, and so on, and cast it into a river that flows to the ocean.

original: de lta bu byas pas kyang ngan song las thar te mtho ris su skye'o //
analyzed: de lta bu byas pas kyang ngan song las thar te mtho ris su skye'o //
translated: By doing that, one will be liberated from the lower realms and be reborn in the higher realms.

original: da ni dge ba dang ldan pa'i ji lta bur byas pa de thams cad las bar 'gyur ba'i gang zag gi rim pa ston te /
analyzed: da ni dge ba dang ldan pa'i ji lta bur byas pa de thams cad las bar 'gyur ba'i gang zag gi rim pa ston te /
translated: Now, the stages of the person who has done all that is virtuous are shown.🔽The best of the virtuous is the one who has generated

original: dge ba'i mchog ni bskyed pa dang // byang chub sa bon bskyed pa'i bdag //🔽ces gsungs te /
analyzed: dge ba'i mchog ni bskyed pa dang // byang chub sa bon bskyed pa'i bdag // ces gsungs te /
translated: the seed of enlightenment.

original: dge ba ni chos spyod bcu'o //
analyzed: dge ba ni chos spyod bcu'o //
translated: Virtuous means the ten Dharma activities.

original: mchog ni ji ltar dge ba byas kyang dmigs pa med par byas pa'o //
analyzed: mchog ni ji ltar dge ba byas kyang dmigs pa med par byas pa'o //
translated: Best means that, although one has done virtue, one does so without reference points.

original: yang na don dam pa dang kun rdzob kyi byang chub sems ni mchog ste de bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: yang na don dam pa dang kun rdzob kyi byang chub sems ni mchog ste de bskyed pa'o //
translated: Alternatively, the best is ultimate and relative bodhichitta, and one has generated that.

original: de gang dang ldan pa de ni sangs rgyas 'bras bu rgyur ldan pa ste sangs rgyas ni rigs lnga'o //
analyzed: de gang dang ldan pa de ni sangs rgyas 'bras bu rgyur ldan pa ste sangs rgyas ni rigs lnga'o //
translated: The one who has that is the one who has the cause of the result of buddhahood.

original: 'bras bu ni sku gsung thugs mi zad pa rgyan gyi 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni sku gsung thugs mi zad pa rgyan gyi 'khor lo'o //
translated: The result is the inexhaustible ornamental wheel of enlightened body, speech, and mind.

original: rgyu ni rang gi rtog pa'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: rgyu ni rang gi rtog pa'i khyad par ro //
translated: The cause is the particularities of one's realization.

original: de gang snyam pa la /🔽sbyin pa'i pha rol phyin par ldan //
analyzed: de gang snyam pa la / sbyin pa'i pha rol phyin par ldan //
translated: What is that?🔽It is taught by the phrase

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan te /
translated: endowed with the perfection of generosity.

original: sbyin ba ni yongs su gtong ba'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: sbyin ba ni yongs su gtong ba'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: Generosity has the characteristic of giving up.

original: de yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: It is of four kinds:

original: zang zing dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / chos dang / byams pa'o //
analyzed: zang zing dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / chos dang / byams pa'o //
translated: giving material things, giving protection, giving the Dharma, and giving love.

original: tshul khrims ni yang dag pa'i don la mi 'da' ba'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims ni yang dag pa'i don la mi 'da' ba'o //
translated: Morality has the characteristic of not transgressing the meaning of reality.

original: bslab pa'i tshul khrims dang / dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims dang / sems can gyi don bya ba'i tshul khrims so //
analyzed: bslab pa'i tshul khrims dang / dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims dang / sems can gyi don bya ba'i tshul khrims so //
translated: It is of three kinds: the morality of training in the precepts, the morality of gathering virtuous dharmas, and the morality of acting for the benefit of sentient beings.

original: bzod pa ni mi 'khrugs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: bzod pa ni mi 'khrugs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Patience has the characteristic of not being upset.

original: @62b de la yang gnyis te /
analyzed: @62b de la yang gnyis te /
translated: It is of two kinds:

original: theg pa chen po'i chos zab mo la yid ches pa'i bzod pa dang / gnod pa byed pa la ci mi snyam pa'i bzod pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i chos zab mo la yid ches pa'i bzod pa dang / gnod pa byed pa la ci mi snyam pa'i bzod pa'o //
translated: the patience of conviction in the profound Dharma of the Great Vehicle, and the patience of not minding the harm done by others.

original: brtson 'grus ni skyo du ba med pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: brtson 'grus ni skyo du ba med pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: Exertion has the characteristic of not being discouraged.🔽It is of two kinds:

original: go cha'i brtson 'grus dang / sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus so //
analyzed: go cha'i brtson 'grus dang / sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus so //
translated: the armor-like exertion and the exertion of application.

original: bsam gtan ni chos nyid kyi don la mnyam par 'jog pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: bsam gtan ni chos nyid kyi don la mnyam par 'jog pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Concentration has the characteristic of settling the mind evenly on the meaning of reality.

original: de la yang gnyis te /
analyzed: de la yang gnyis te /
translated: It is of two kinds:

original: chos nyid kyi bsam gtan dang ting nge 'dzin gyi bsam gtan no //
analyzed: chos nyid kyi bsam gtan dang ting nge 'dzin gyi bsam gtan no //
translated: The concentration of reality and the concentration of meditative absorption.

original: shes rab ni spyi dang rang gi mtshan nyid 'byed pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: shes rab ni spyi dang rang gi mtshan nyid 'byed pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Wisdom has the characteristic of discerning the general and specific characteristics.

original: de la yang gnyis te zag pa dang bcas ba'i shes rab dang / zag pa med pa'i shes rab bo //
analyzed: de la yang gnyis te zag pa dang bcas ba'i shes rab dang / zag pa med pa'i shes rab bo //
translated: It is twofold: contaminated wisdom and uncontaminated wisdom.

original: de ni rgyu ste rgyu pha rol tu phyin pa drug gis 'bras bu bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rgyu ste rgyu pha rol tu phyin pa drug gis 'bras bu bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: That is the cause, because the result, the accumulation of merit and wisdom, arises from the six causes, the perfections.

original: de lta bu'i sems ni 'jig rten 'di'i bde ba dang yang ldan la /
analyzed: de lta bu'i sems ni 'jig rten 'di'i bde ba dang yang ldan la /
translated: Such a mind is endowed with the happiness of this world.

original: phyi mar yang myur du ngan song las thar te byang chub thob par the tshom med do //
analyzed: phyi mar yang myur du ngan song las thar te byang chub thob par the tshom med do //
translated: And in the next world, there is no doubt that one will quickly be liberated from the lower realms and attain enlightenment.

original: da ni dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bskyed pas mi 'grub pa'i don ston te /
analyzed: da ni dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bskyed pas mi 'grub pa'i don ston te /
translated: Now, the meaning of not accomplishing it by not generating the roots of virtue is taught:

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bskyed la //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bskyed la //
translated: Not generating the roots of virtue,🔽And whatever view of nonexistence there is,

original: med par lta ba gang yin dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: med par lta ba gang yin dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: and so on.

original: dge ba ni rnam par dkar ba'o //
analyzed: dge ba ni rnam par dkar ba'o //
translated: Virtue is pure.

original: rtsa ba ni byang chub kyi sems so //
analyzed: rtsa ba ni byang chub kyi sems so //
translated: The root is the Thought of Enlightenment.

original: ma bskyed pa ni ma spel ba'o //
analyzed: ma bskyed pa ni ma spel ba'o //
translated: Not to have generated it is not to have increased it.

original: med par lta ba ni rgyu dge sdig gnyis med par lta pa dang / 'bras bu bde sdug gnyis med par lta ba'o //
analyzed: med par lta ba ni rgyu dge sdig gnyis med par lta pa dang / 'bras bu bde sdug gnyis med par lta ba'o //
translated: The view of non-existence is the view that neither cause, that is, virtue and sin, nor effect, that is, happiness and suffering, exist.

original: byang chub lam las rnam log pa ni don dam pa dang kun rdzob kyi byang chub kyi sems las log pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub lam las rnam log pa ni don dam pa dang kun rdzob kyi byang chub kyi sems las log pa'o //
translated: To have turned away from the path of enlightenment is to have turned away from the ultimate and relative Thoughts of Enlightenment.

original: sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa la zhe sdang byed cing sdig pa'i rang bzhin du mthong ba dang / pha dang ma la snying ring zhing byang chub kyi sems dang ma 'brel pa rnams kyis 'grub par mi 'gyur ro zhes rnam par snang mdzad kyis gsungs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa la zhe sdang byed cing sdig pa'i rang bzhin du mthong ba dang / pha dang ma la snying ring zhing byang chub kyi sems dang ma 'brel pa rnams kyis 'grub par mi 'gyur ro zhes rnam par snang mdzad kyis gsungs so //
translated: Vairocana has said that it will not be accomplished by those who hate the teaching of the Buddha and see it as sinful, who are unfilial, and who are not connected with the Thought of Enlightenment.

original: de yan chad du sbyin sreg gi don bstan zin to //
analyzed: de yan chad du sbyin sreg gi don bstan zin to //
translated: Up to here the meaning of the burnt offering has been taught.

original: da ni go cha'i phan yon ston te /
analyzed: da ni go cha'i phan yon ston te /
translated: Now the benefits of the armor are taught.

original: de nas brgya byin la sogs lha //
analyzed: de nas brgya byin la sogs lha //
translated: Then the gods, Indra and so forth,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: and so forth.

original: des ni sbyin sreg gi mjug bsdu bar gsungs te /
analyzed: des ni sbyin sreg gi mjug bsdu bar gsungs te /
translated: This is said to be the conclusion of the burnt offering.

original: de nas ni phan yon gyi mgo 'dren to //
analyzed: de nas ni phan yon gyi mgo 'dren to //
translated: Then, the benefits are introduced.

original: brgya byin ni yon bdag yin pa'i phyir dang la smos so //
analyzed: brgya byin ni yon bdag yin pa'i phyir dang la smos so //
translated: Śakra is mentioned first because he is the patron.

original: lha thams cad ni nor bu dri ma med pa'i 'od thar pa las snga ba'i phyir smos so //
analyzed: lha thams cad ni nor bu dri ma med pa'i 'od thar pa las snga ba'i phyir smos so //
translated: All the gods are mentioned because they are earlier than the liberation of the stainless light jewel.

original: de nas dbang por bcas pa yi //
analyzed: de nas dbang por bcas pa yi //
translated: Then, together with Indra,

original: zhes pa nas /
analyzed: zhes pa nas /
translated: up to

original: sna tshogs byung ba 'di ci @63a * //
analyzed: sna tshogs byung ba 'di ci @63a * //
translated: What is this variety?

original: lags ; / zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni yon tan la ngam ste /
analyzed: lags ; / zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni yon tan la ngam ste /
translated: This shows amazement at the qualities.

original: mchod pa du mas mchod cing bstod do //
analyzed: mchod pa du mas mchod cing bstod do //
translated: He made many offerings and praises.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa zhes pa nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa zhes pa nas /
translated: The Blessed One said, up to

analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa ngo mtshar che lags so zhes pa'i bar gyis ni /
translated: Sugata, it is amazing!

original: nor bu dri ma med pa'i 'od kyi rnam par thar pa bstan la//
analyzed: nor bu dri ma med pa'i 'od kyi rnam par thar pa bstan la//
translated: This shows the liberation of the stainless light jewel.

original: 'khor ngo mtshar che ba la dam par bstan to //
analyzed: 'khor ngo mtshar che ba la dam par bstan to //
translated: The amazing retinue is shown as supreme.

original: de nas brgya byin la sogs lha //
analyzed: de nas brgya byin la sogs lha //
translated: Then, Indra and the other gods,

original: zhes pa nas /
analyzed: zhes pa nas /
translated: up to

original: sngags dang 'dra ba'i 'dren pa med //
analyzed: sngags dang 'dra ba'i 'dren pa med //
translated: Without a guide like the mantra,

original: ces bya ba'i bar dkon mchog gsum la yon tan gyi sgo nas bstod pa bstan to //
analyzed: ces bya ba'i bar dkon mchog gsum la yon tan gyi sgo nas bstod pa bstan to //
translated: This passage teaches praise of the Three Jewels in terms of their qualities.

original: de nas lha'i bu de dag gis zhes pa nas /
analyzed: de nas lha'i bu de dag gis zhes pa nas /
translated: Then, the gods…

original: blta bar 'tshal lo zhes bya ba'i bar gyis nor bu dri ma med pa'i rdzu 'phrul dang rnam par 'phrul pa blta bar 'tshal lo zhes gsol ba bstan to //
analyzed: blta bar 'tshal lo zhes bya ba'i bar gyis nor bu dri ma med pa'i rdzu 'phrul dang rnam par 'phrul pa blta bar 'tshal lo zhes gsol ba bstan to //
translated: …we wish to see. This passage teaches the request to see the immaculate jewel’s miracles and emanations.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das zhes pa nas /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das zhes pa nas /
translated: Then, the Blessed One…

original: de nyid du mi snang bar gyur to zhes pa'i bar gyis ni de bzhin gshegs pas nor bu dri ma med pa 'od zer gyi phreng bas bskul nas 'ongs pa bstan to //
analyzed: de nyid du mi snang bar gyur to zhes pa'i bar gyis ni de bzhin gshegs pas nor bu dri ma med pa 'od zer gyi phreng bas bskul nas 'ongs pa bstan to //
translated: …disappeared right there. This passage teaches that the Thus-Gone One summoned the immaculate jewel with a garland of light rays and it came.

original: de nas lha'i bu de nyid ces pa nas /
analyzed: de nas lha'i bu de nyid ces pa nas /
translated: Then, the gods…

original: zil gyis mnan to zhes pa'i bar gyis nor bu dri ma med pa'i 'ong kyi rnam par 'phrul pa thams cad zil gyis mnan par bstan to //
analyzed: zil gyis mnan to zhes pa'i bar gyis nor bu dri ma med pa'i 'ong kyi rnam par 'phrul pa thams cad zil gyis mnan par bstan to //
translated: …outclassed them all. This passage teaches that the immaculate jewel outclassed all the emanations of miracles.

original: de nas lha'i bu de zhes pa nas myur du bkrol zhes pa'i bar gyis ni ya mtshan che nas thugs rje la ngam nas bstod pa bstan to //🔽de nas skad cig ma de nyid kyi tshe zhes pa nas /
analyzed: de nas lha'i bu de zhes pa nas myur du bkrol zhes pa'i bar gyis ni ya mtshan che nas thugs rje la ngam nas bstod pa bstan to // de nas skad cig ma de nyid kyi tshe zhes pa nas /
translated: The passage from “Then the gods” up to “quickly released” shows the praise of compassion, amazed at the great wonder.

original: ya mtshan skyes te zhes pa'i bar gyis ni rnam par 'phrul pa sna tshogs mthong ba bstan to //🔽'di skad ces smras so zhes pa nas /🔽tshangs spyod tshul khrims dri med skye bsam yas //
analyzed: ya mtshan skyes te zhes pa'i bar gyis ni rnam par 'phrul pa sna tshogs mthong ba bstan to // 'di skad ces smras so zhes pa nas / tshangs spyod tshul khrims dri med skye bsam yas //
translated: The passage from “At that very moment” up to “amazed” shows the seeing of the various emanations.

original: zhes pa'i bar gyis ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i don la ngam pa bstan to //
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar gyis ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i don la ngam pa bstan to //
translated: The passage from “They said” up to “the pure conduct of celibacy” shows the amazement at the inconceivable meaning of the special qualities of the Tathagata.

original: de nas lha'i bu de dag gis zhes pa nas blta bar 'tshal lo zhes bya ba'i bar gyis zhu ba bstan te /🔽gsol ba gdab pa bstan to //
analyzed: de nas lha'i bu de dag gis zhes pa nas blta bar 'tshal lo zhes bya ba'i bar gyis zhu ba bstan te / gsol ba gdab pa bstan to //
translated: The passage from “Then those gods” up to “we wish to see” shows the request.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis yang zhes pa nas mi snang bar gyur to zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis yang zhes pa nas mi snang bar gyur to zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: The passage from “Then the Blessed One” up to “disappeared” shows the granting of the request.

original: snang bar byas pa'i ting nge 'dzin bstan to //
analyzed: snang bar byas pa'i ting nge 'dzin bstan to //
translated: This teaches the samādhi of illumination.

original: de nas nor bu dri ma med pa'i 'od ces pa nas /
analyzed: de nas nor bu dri ma med pa'i 'od ces pa nas /
translated: Then, from “The light of the stainless jewel” up to “said this,”

original: 'di skad gsol to zhes pa'i bar gyis ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyan sngar 'ongs nas thams cad zil gyis mnan pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'di skad gsol to zhes pa'i bar gyis ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyan sngar 'ongs nas thams cad zil gyis mnan pa bstan to //
translated: having come into the presence of the Tathāgata, it teaches the display of overwhelming all.

original: kye ma sangs rgyas zhes pa nas /
analyzed: kye ma sangs rgyas zhes pa nas /
translated: From “Ah! Buddha” up to

original: sems @63b can lha gnas myur du skyes //
analyzed: sems @63b can lha gnas myur du skyes //
translated: “beings are quickly born in the god realms,”

original: zhes pa'i bar gyis sngags kyi yon tan kun la bstod pa bstan to //
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar gyis sngags kyi yon tan kun la bstod pa bstan to //
translated: it teaches the praise of all the qualities of mantra.

original: de nas lha'i bu nor bu dri ma med pa'i 'od ces bya ba dang zhes pa nas /
analyzed: de nas lha'i bu nor bu dri ma med pa'i 'od ces bya ba dang zhes pa nas /
translated: Then, from “The god son Stainless Jewel Light” up to

original: de bzhin du slar song ngo zhes pa'i bar gyis drin la lan gyis blan pa'i phyir mchod pa'i khyad par gyis mchod nas rang gi gnas su 'gro ba bstan to //
analyzed: de bzhin du slar song ngo zhes pa'i bar gyis drin la lan gyis blan pa'i phyir mchod pa'i khyad par gyis mchod nas rang gi gnas su 'gro ba bstan to //
translated: “thus went back,” it teaches the offering of special offerings in return for the kindness, and then going to one’s own place.

original: de nas brgya byin dang zhes pa nas bshad du gsol zhes pa'i bar gyis ni phyi rabs kyi sems can la phan gdags pa'i phyir zhu ba gsol ba bstan to //
analyzed: de nas brgya byin dang zhes pa nas bshad du gsol zhes pa'i bar gyis ni phyi rabs kyi sems can la phan gdags pa'i phyir zhu ba gsol ba bstan to //
translated: The passage from “Then Śakra” up to “please explain” shows the request for the sake of benefiting sentient beings of future generations.

original: brgya byin dang zhes pa nas 'gro bar 'gyur ro zhes pa'i bar gyis ni sngags kyi don 'di thos par dka' ba'i che ba'i yon tan bstan to //
analyzed: brgya byin dang zhes pa nas 'gro bar 'gyur ro zhes pa'i bar gyis ni sngags kyi don 'di thos par dka' ba'i che ba'i yon tan bstan to //
translated: The passage from “Śakra” up to “will go” shows the great quality of difficulty in hearing the meaning of the mantra.

original: de nas brgya byin dang zhes pa nas rnam par smin pa ni cir 'gyur zhes pa'i bar gyis ni snod du gyur pa'i theg pa chen po la dad pa'i rnam pa cir 'gyur ba zhus pa bstan to //
analyzed: de nas brgya byin dang zhes pa nas rnam par smin pa ni cir 'gyur zhes pa'i bar gyis ni snod du gyur pa'i theg pa chen po la dad pa'i rnam pa cir 'gyur ba zhus pa bstan to //
translated: The passage from “Then Śakra” up to “what will be the karmic ripening?” shows the question about the aspect of faith in the Mahāyāna of those who are suitable vessels.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes pa nas smos kyang ci dgos zhes pa'i bar gyis ni theg pa chen po'i rigs can gyi che ba'i yon tan gyi khyad par bstan to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes pa nas smos kyang ci dgos zhes pa'i bar gyis ni theg pa chen po'i rigs can gyi che ba'i yon tan gyi khyad par bstan to //
translated: The passage from “The Blessed One said” up to “what need is there to mention…” shows the special great qualities of those with the Mahāyāna lineage.

original: de nas brgya byin dang zhes pa nas /
analyzed: de nas brgya byin dang zhes pa nas /
translated: The passage from “Then Śakra” up to “will go” shows the great quality of difficulty in hearing the meaning of the mantra.

original: bskyab par bgyi zhes pa'i bar gyis ni 'jig rten pa'i dkyil 'khor rnams kyis theg ba chen po'i chos 'di gang na spyod pa de bsrung zhing bskyab pa'i thabs ston to ;🔽; lha'i dbang po zhes pa nas /
analyzed: bskyab par bgyi zhes pa'i bar gyis ni 'jig rten pa'i dkyil 'khor rnams kyis theg ba chen po'i chos 'di gang na spyod pa de bsrung zhing bskyab pa'i thabs ston to ; ; lha'i dbang po zhes pa nas /
translated: The passage from “we will protect” up to “we will guard” shows the method of protecting and guarding the place where this Mahayana Dharma is practiced by the worldly maṇḍalas.

original: bag yod par byos la sgrubs shing ces pa'i bar gyis ni phyi rabs kyi sems can la phan pa'i gdams dag sbyin pa ston to //
analyzed: bag yod par byos la sgrubs shing ces pa'i bar gyis ni phyi rabs kyi sems can la phan pa'i gdams dag sbyin pa ston to //
translated: The passage from “Lord of the gods” up to “be diligent and practice” shows the bestowal of instructions for the benefit of sentient beings of future generations.

original: de yan chad kyis ni sku gsum gyi gtsug tor gyi rgyud las rtsa ba'i rgyud du gyur pa rnam par snang mdzad kyi sku'i rgyud bshad pa'o //
analyzed: de yan chad kyis ni sku gsum gyi gtsug tor gyi rgyud las rtsa ba'i rgyud du gyur pa rnam par snang mdzad kyi sku'i rgyud bshad pa'o //
translated: Up to this point, the Tantra of the Crown of the Three Bodies has been explained as the root tantra of Vairocana’s body.

original: dpal rnam par snang mdzad kyi rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi bshad pa gsal ba'i sgron ma zhes bya ba slob dpon chen po kun dga' snying pos mdzad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: dpal rnam par snang mdzad kyi rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi bshad pa gsal ba'i sgron ma zhes bya ba slob dpon chen po kun dga' snying pos mdzad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The commentary on the glorious Vairocana Root Tantra called “The Lamp of Clarity” composed by the great master Ānandagarbha is complete.

original: // / da ni rkyen sbyong bar byed pa'i bshad pa'i rgyud phyi ma'i don bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: // / da ni rkyen sbyong bar byed pa'i bshad pa'i rgyud phyi ma'i don bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now, the meaning of the explanatory tantra that purifies the conditions will be explained.

original: de la yang 'chad pa po'i mtshan nyid dam rang bzhin bstan pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: de la yang 'chad pa po'i mtshan nyid dam rang bzhin bstan pa 'byung ste /
translated: The explanation of the characteristics or nature of the expounder arises there.

original: de yang dang por gleng gzhi ni ji lta bu yin zhe na /🔽rgyud phyi ma 'di'i ston pa ni gang bdag po'i skyes bu ni gang snyam pa la /
analyzed: de yang dang por gleng gzhi ni ji lta bu yin zhe na / rgyud phyi ma 'di'i ston pa ni gang bdag po'i skyes bu ni gang snyam pa la /
translated: Moreover, if one asks, “What is the nidāna?”

original: 'di'i 'chad pa po'i ston pa ni dpal phyag na rdo rje'o //
analyzed: 'di'i 'chad pa po'i ston pa ni dpal phyag na rdo rje'o //
translated: The expounder of this Tantra of the Later Spread is the glorious Vajrapāṇi.

original: bdag po ni sh'akya thub pa de nyid do //
analyzed: bdag po ni sh'akya thub pa de nyid do //
translated: The lord is Śākyamuni himself.

original: de'i don bstan par bya @64a * //
analyzed: de'i don bstan par bya @64a * //
translated: His meaning should be taught.

original: ste ; de yang dang po ston pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ste ; de yang dang po ston pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, in order to teach the expounder first,

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: [the Bhagavān] declares, “Then the Bhagavān,” and so on.

original: bcom pa ni yang dag ba'i ye shes kyis nyon mongs pa phyin ci log gi skyon bcom pa yin la /
analyzed: bcom pa ni yang dag ba'i ye shes kyis nyon mongs pa phyin ci log gi skyon bcom pa yin la /
translated: The destruction is the destruction of the faults of the error of afflictions by means of correct pristine consciousness.

original: ldan pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug gis stobs dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: ldan pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug gis stobs dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The endowment is the endowment with strength by means of the six perfections.

original: 'das pa ni mtha' gnyis las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: 'das pa ni mtha' gnyis las 'das pa'o //
translated: The transcendence is the transcendence of the two extremes.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po phyag na rdo rjes zhes pa ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po phyag na rdo rjes zhes pa ni /
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva Vajrapāṇi

original: byang chub ni gzung 'dzin gnyis spangs la mkhyen pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub ni gzung 'dzin gnyis spangs la mkhyen pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Enlightenment is the possession of the wisdom of the knowledge that abandons the two, subject and object.

original: sems ni gnyis su med pa'i don la sems pa'o ;
analyzed: sems ni gnyis su med pa'i don la sems pa'o ;
translated: Mind is the thought of the meaning of nonduality.

original: / dpa' ni de'i don la sran tshugs pa'o //
analyzed: / dpa' ni de'i don la sran tshugs pa'o //
translated: Heroic is the firmness in that meaning.

original: sems ni thugs rje chen pos 'gro ba'i don la sems la /
analyzed: sems ni thugs rje chen pos 'gro ba'i don la sems la /
translated: Mind is the thought of the meaning of sentient beings with great compassion.

original: dpa' ni 'gro ba'i don las mi ldog pa'o //
analyzed: dpa' ni 'gro ba'i don las mi ldog pa'o //
translated: Heroic is the nonretreat from the meaning of sentient beings.

original: chen po ni khyad par du gyur pa'i don dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: chen po ni khyad par du gyur pa'i don dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Great is the possession of the meaning of distinction.

original: phyag na rdo rje zhes ni dus gsum gyi rgyal ba thams cad kyi thugs las skyes pa'i sems dpa' des so //
analyzed: phyag na rdo rje zhes ni dus gsum gyi rgyal ba thams cad kyi thugs las skyes pa'i sems dpa' des so //
translated: Vajrapāṇi is the bodhisattva born from the mind of all the conquerors of the three times.

original: yang na phyag na rdo rje ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku gsung thugs kyi gsang ba'i mdzod 'dzin pa dang / bdud dang dregs pa can thams cad 'dul bar byed pa'i rdo rje de phyag na bsnams pas na phyag na rdo rje'o //
analyzed: yang na phyag na rdo rje ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku gsung thugs kyi gsang ba'i mdzod 'dzin pa dang / bdud dang dregs pa can thams cad 'dul bar byed pa'i rdo rje de phyag na bsnams pas na phyag na rdo rje'o //
translated: Alternatively, Vajrapāṇi is the holder of the treasury of the secrets of the body, speech, and mind of all tathāgatas and the vajra that subdues all māras and haughty spirits. Since he holds that vajra in his hand, he is Vajrapāṇi.

original: yang na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis ming gi dbang bskur ba'o //
analyzed: yang na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis ming gi dbang bskur ba'o //
translated: Or, it is the empowerment of the name by all the Tathagatas.

original: de ji ltar thugs las byung zhing dbang bskur snyam pa'i rtog pa bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ji ltar thugs las byung zhing dbang bskur snyam pa'i rtog pa bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to dispel the thought, “How did he arise from the mind and confer empowerment?”

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par snang mdzad nam mkha'i dbyings kyi rang bzhin las snying rje chen po'i thabs khro bo'i dam tshig rdo rje zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par snang mdzad nam mkha'i dbyings kyi rang bzhin las snying rje chen po'i thabs khro bo'i dam tshig rdo rje zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs so //
translated: The Tathagata Vairocana, from the nature of the realm of space, entered into evenness in the samadhi called “The Wrathful Pledge Vajra of the Means of Great Compassion.”

original: snyoms par zhugs ma thag tu de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi thugs ka nas rdo rje dam tshig ces bya ba'i snying po 'di phyung ngo //
analyzed: snyoms par zhugs ma thag tu de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi thugs ka nas rdo rje dam tshig ces bya ba'i snying po 'di phyung ngo //
translated: As soon as he entered into evenness, this essence called “Vajra Pledge” came forth from the hearts of all the Tathagatas.🔽Hūṃ.

original: h'um de phyung ma thag tu bcom ldan 'das thams cad pa'i snying po rig pa mchog 'di smras so //
analyzed: h'um de phyung ma thag tu bcom ldan 'das thams cad pa'i snying po rig pa mchog 'di smras so //
translated: As soon as it came forth, the Blessed One, the essence of all, spoke this supreme awareness:

original: aom sumbha ni sumbha h'um /
analyzed: aom sumbha ni sumbha h'um /
translated: Oṃ, sumbha niḥ sumbha hūṃ /

original: grihna grihna h'um /
analyzed: grihna grihna h'um /
translated: gṛhṇa gṛhṇa hūṃ /

original: grihn'a pa ya grihn'a pa ya h'um a'a na ya ho bha ga b'an badzra r'a dza h'um phat /
analyzed: grihn'a pa ya grihn'a pa ya h'um a'a na ya ho bha ga b'an badzra r'a dza h'um phat /
translated: gṛhṇāpaya gṛhṇāpaya hūṃ / ānayaho bhagavān vajrarāja hūṃ phaṭ.

original: de nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bdag po phyag na rdo rjer gyur te /
analyzed: de nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bdag po phyag na rdo rjer gyur te /
translated: Then he became Vajrapani, Lord of all Tathagatas,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan snga na bka' nod cing /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan snga na bka' nod cing /
translated: standing in the presence of the Lord,

original: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la gnas so //
analyzed: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la gnas so //
translated: and he stood on a moon-disk.

original: de nas thams cad @64b 'joms pa'i dbang dang / ming gi dbang bskur te /
analyzed: de nas thams cad @64b 'joms pa'i dbang dang / ming gi dbang bskur te /
translated: Then he was given the empowerment of all-conquering and the name-empowerment,

original: phyag na rdo rje zhes btags so //
analyzed: phyag na rdo rje zhes btags so //
translated: and he was called Vajrapani.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi mthus brtag ba'i rgyal po brtag pa phyi ma 'di bshad do zhes ba ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi mthus brtag ba'i rgyal po brtag pa phyi ma 'di bshad do zhes ba ni /
translated: By the power of the Lord, he explained this second chapter of the Tantra, the Chapter on the Examination of the King.

original: bcom ldan 'das ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni bshad zin to //
translated: The Lord has already been explained.

original: mthus zhes bya ba ni byin gyis brlabs pas so //
analyzed: mthus zhes bya ba ni byin gyis brlabs pas so //
translated: By the power of... means by his blessing.

original: brtag pa phyi ma 'dis zhes bya ba ni brtag pa dang po rtsa ba'i dkyil 'khor las ma tshang ba dang / sh'akya thub pa'i dkyil 'khor la 'jig rten las 'das ba dang / 'jig rten pa'i dkyil 'khor rtsa ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi khyad par las byung ba'i bshad pa bstan pa'i phyir na de bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: brtag pa phyi ma 'dis zhes bya ba ni brtag pa dang po rtsa ba'i dkyil 'khor las ma tshang ba dang / sh'akya thub pa'i dkyil 'khor la 'jig rten las 'das ba dang / 'jig rten pa'i dkyil 'khor rtsa ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi khyad par las byung ba'i bshad pa bstan pa'i phyir na de bstan par bya'o //
translated: The phrase the latter analysis refers to the first analysis, which is taught in order to explain the differences between the root maṇḍala and the Śākyamuni maṇḍala, and between the transcendent and mundane maṇḍalas.

original: dpa' bo gdan las bzhengs nas ni //
analyzed: dpa' bo gdan las bzhengs nas ni //
translated: The hero rises from the seat.

original: zhes bya ba ni dpa' bas na dpa' ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dpa' bas na dpa' ba'o //
translated: The word hero is derived from the word śūra, which means brave.

original: ji ltar dpa' zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar dpa' zhe na /
translated: How is he brave?

original: khro bo 'dod pa'i rgyal po rnam par snang mdzad kyi thugs ka nas phyung ste /
analyzed: khro bo 'dod pa'i rgyal po rnam par snang mdzad kyi thugs ka nas phyung ste /
translated: The wrathful king of desire, having emerged from the heart of Vairocana,

original: 'jig rten gsum gyi bdag po dbang phyug chen po la sogs pa 'jig rten thams cad na gnas pa'i tshogs kyis bskor ba'i dam tshig gi rdo rjes bkug nas ri rab ri'i rtse mo na rdo rje dang nor bu rin po che las byas pa khang bu brtsegs
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum gyi bdag po dbang phyug chen po la sogs pa 'jig rten thams cad na gnas pa'i tshogs kyis bskor ba'i dam tshig gi rdo rjes bkug nas ri rab ri'i rtse mo na rdo rje dang nor bu rin po che las byas pa khang bu brtsegs
translated: having summoned with the pledge-vajra the assembly of all the worlds, such as Maheśvara, the lord of the three worlds, and so forth, who are surrounded by their retinues, he then, on the peak of Mount Sumeru, in a palace made of vajra and precious jewels,

original: pa de'i nye 'khor du 'khod par gyur to //
analyzed: pa de'i nye 'khor du 'khod par gyur to //
translated: and they all gathered around him.

original: de nas phyag na rdo rje rang gi thugs ka nas rdo rje blangs te gsor zhing 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de nas phyag na rdo rje rang gi thugs ka nas rdo rje blangs te gsor zhing 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: Then Vajrapāṇi took up his vajra from his heart, brandished it, and said this:🔽“Friends, enter the teaching of all the tathāgatas and listen to my words!”

original: grogs po rnams de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bstan pa la zhugs la nga'i bka' nyon cig / de nas de dag gis 'di skad ces gsol to bdag cag gis ji ltar bsgrub par bgyi /
analyzed: grogs po rnams de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bstan pa la zhugs la nga'i bka' nyon cig / de nas de dag gis 'di skad ces gsol to bdag cag gis ji ltar bsgrub par bgyi /
translated: Then they said this: “How should we practice?”

original: phyag na rdo rjes gsungs pa /
analyzed: phyag na rdo rjes gsungs pa /
translated: Vajrapāṇi said:

original: kun mkhyen ye shes thob bya'i phyir //
analyzed: kun mkhyen ye shes thob bya'i phyir //
translated: “In order to attain omniscient wisdom,

original: grogs po rnams kyis bsgrub par gyis //
analyzed: grogs po rnams kyis bsgrub par gyis //
translated: friends, you should practice.”

original: de nas 'jig rten gsum gyi bdag po lha chen po dregs te ches khros par ston zhing 'di smras so //
analyzed: de nas 'jig rten gsum gyi bdag po lha chen po dregs te ches khros par ston zhing 'di smras so //
translated: Then the lord of the three worlds, the great god, arrogant and very angry, said this:

original: nga 'jig rten gsum gyi bdag po yin la //
analyzed: nga 'jig rten gsum gyi bdag po yin la //
translated: “I am the lord of the three worlds.

original: gnod sbyin khyod kyi ngag ci'i phyir nyan /
analyzed: gnod sbyin khyod kyi ngag ci'i phyir nyan /
translated: Why should I listen to your words, yakṣa?”

original: de nas yang phyag na rdo rjes rdo rje gsor zhing bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas yang phyag na rdo rjes rdo rje gsor zhing bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then Vajrapāṇi, brandishing his vajra, said this:

original: sems can ma rungs pa rnams dkyil 'khor du myur du zhugs la nga'i dam tshig la gnas par gyis shig / de nas lha chen pos bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: sems can ma rungs pa rnams dkyil 'khor du myur du zhugs la nga'i dam tshig la gnas par gyis shig / de nas lha chen pos bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then Maheśvara said to the Bhagavān:

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di lta bu'i sems can dbang phyug la 'di skad ces bka' stsol ba 'di su zhig / de nas @65a * //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di lta bu'i sems can dbang phyug la 'di skad ces bka' stsol ba 'di su zhig / de nas @65a * //
translated: Bhagavān, who is this sentient being, Maheśvara, to whom you give such instructions?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis dbang phyug chen po la sogs pa 'jig rten gsum gyi tshogs thams cad la bos nas 'di skad gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis dbang phyug chen po la sogs pa 'jig rten gsum gyi tshogs thams cad la bos nas 'di skad gsungs so //
translated: Then the Bhagavān, addressing all the assemblies of the three worlds, including Maheśvara, said this:

original: grogs po rnams dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba dang / dam tshig dang sdom pa la gnas par gyis shig ;
analyzed: grogs po rnams dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba dang / dam tshig dang sdom pa la gnas par gyis shig ;
translated: Friends, go for refuge to the Three Jewels and abide by the sacred pledges and vows!

original: phyag na rdo rje ni gnod sbyin khro bo ma rungs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' chen po ste /
analyzed: phyag na rdo rje ni gnod sbyin khro bo ma rungs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' chen po ste /
translated: Vajrapāṇi is the wrathful yakṣa, the unruly bodhisattva-mahāsattva.

original: rdo rje 'bar bas khyed rnams brlag par byas sa re /
analyzed: rdo rje 'bar bas khyed rnams brlag par byas sa re /
translated: He will destroy you with his blazing vajra!

original: de nas dbang phyug chen po 'khor mang po dang bcas pas 'jigs pa'i gzugs dang / ma rungs pa'i rta gad du dgod pa rnams bstan nas 'di skad smras so //
analyzed: de nas dbang phyug chen po 'khor mang po dang bcas pas 'jigs pa'i gzugs dang / ma rungs pa'i rta gad du dgod pa rnams bstan nas 'di skad smras so //
translated: Then Maheśvara, together with his retinue, displayed terrifying forms and inauspicious laughter and said this:

original: kye nga ni 'jig rten gsum gyi bdag po yin na nga la khyod ci'i phyir bka' stsal /
analyzed: kye nga ni 'jig rten gsum gyi bdag po yin na nga la khyod ci'i phyir bka' stsal /
translated: “Hey, I am the lord of the three worlds. Why do you give me orders?”

original: de nas phyag na rdo rjes rdo rje snyems pa dang bcas pas gsor zhing 'dzum ste 'di skad ces smras so //🔽kye lus srul po mi'i sha za ba zas su ro bsregs pa'i thal ba za zhing kha zas dang mal cha dang gos kyang de la byed pa khyed rnams nga'i bka' bzhin byos shig / de nas dbang phyug chen pos 'jig rten gyi khams khro bo chen pos
analyzed: de nas phyag na rdo rjes rdo rje snyems pa dang bcas pas gsor zhing 'dzum ste 'di skad ces smras so // kye lus srul po mi'i sha za ba zas su ro bsregs pa'i thal ba za zhing kha zas dang mal cha dang gos kyang de la byed pa khyed rnams nga'i bka' bzhin byos shig / de nas dbang phyug chen pos 'jig rten gyi khams khro bo chen pos
translated: Then Vajrapāṇi, with a vajra-like arrogance, brandished his vajra and smiled, saying this:🔽“Hey, you who eat human flesh, you who eat the burnt ashes of corpses for food, and you who make your bedding, food, and clothes from that, all of you do as I command!”

original: bkang ste 'di skad ces smras so /
analyzed: bkang ste 'di skad ces smras so /
translated: Then Maheśvara filled the world realm with great wrath and said this:

original: khyod nga'i bka' nyon la dam tshig kyang long shig ces so //
analyzed: khyod nga'i bka' nyon la dam tshig kyang long shig ces so //
translated: “You must obey my orders and take my pledge.”

original: de bcom ldan 'das kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs ka nas byung ba'i rdo rje chen pos dam tshig dran par byas so //
analyzed: de bcom ldan 'das kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs ka nas byung ba'i rdo rje chen pos dam tshig dran par byas so //
translated: The Blessed One then reminded him of his sacred pledge with the great vajra that had emerged from the heart of the Tathāgata.

original: aom ni sumbha badzra h'um phat /
analyzed: aom ni sumbha badzra h'um phat /
translated: Oṃ, suṃbhava-vajra, hūṃ phaṭ.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' phyag na rdo rjes rdo rje'i snying po 'di brjod do //
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' phyag na rdo rjes rdo rje'i snying po 'di brjod do //
translated: Then the bodhisattva Vajrapāṇi uttered this vajra essence:

original: h'um de nas de brjod ma thag tu khams gsum pa thams cad kha spub tu 'gyel te nyam thag pa'i tshig 'byin cing phyag na rdo rje la skyabs su dong ngo //
analyzed: h'um de nas de brjod ma thag tu khams gsum pa thams cad kha spub tu 'gyel te nyam thag pa'i tshig 'byin cing phyag na rdo rje la skyabs su dong ngo //
translated: Hūṃ. As soon as he uttered this, the entire three realms fell face down, crying out in distress, and took refuge in Vajrapāṇi.

original: lha chen po zhes bya ba'i lha de de nas sa la 'gyel te dran pa med par gyur nas shi'o //
analyzed: lha chen po zhes bya ba'i lha de de nas sa la 'gyel te dran pa med par gyur nas shi'o //
translated: The god called Mahādeva fell to the ground then and lost consciousness. He died.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis mkhyen bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' phyag na rdo rje la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis mkhyen bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' phyag na rdo rje la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: Then the Blessed One, as if he knew nothing of this, said to the bodhisattva Vajrapāṇi:🔽“Give refuge to this lord of the three realms. Do not kill him.”

original: khams gsum gyi bdag po 'di la skyabs sbyin par byos la ma bsad cig / de skad ces bka' stsal pa thos nas /
analyzed: khams gsum gyi bdag po 'di la skyabs sbyin par byos la ma bsad cig / de skad ces bka' stsal pa thos nas /
translated: Having heard this,

original: phyag na rdo rjes 'di skad gsungs so //
analyzed: phyag na rdo rjes 'di skad gsungs so //
translated: Vajrapāṇi said this:

original: lha rnams srog 'dod na dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su dong la nga'i bka' nyon cig / de dag gis gsol pa /
analyzed: lha rnams srog 'dod na dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su dong la nga'i bka' nyon cig / de dag gis gsol pa /
translated: “If the gods wish to live, they should go for refuge to the Three Jewels and listen to my words.🔽They said,

original: dkon mchog gsum @65b la skyabs su mchi'o //
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum @65b la skyabs su mchi'o //
translated: “We go for refuge to the Three Jewels.

original: khyod kyis bstan pa'i bka' ni bdag cag gis 'tshal to //
analyzed: khyod kyis bstan pa'i bka' ni bdag cag gis 'tshal to //
translated: We will do as you have instructed.”

original: de nas rnam par snang mdzad kyis de dag la bos nas 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de nas rnam par snang mdzad kyis de dag la bos nas 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: Then Vairocana addressed them and said this:

original: kye lha rnams 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bdag po'o //
analyzed: kye lha rnams 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bdag po'o //
translated: “O gods, this is the lord of all tathāgatas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi yab po //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi yab po //
translated: He is the father of all tathāgatas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bka' bzhin du byed pa'o //
