analyzed: bya ba nan tan gyi ye shes nas thugs rjes sku sprul te /
translated: From the gnosis of action, the body is emanated through compassion.

original: nyon mongs pa'i mtshan ma'i phrag dog las rgyal bas na rnam par rgyal ba'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i mtshan ma'i phrag dog las rgyal bas na rnam par rgyal ba'o //
translated: Since he is victorious over the sign of the afflictions, envy, he is Vijaya.

original: gzi brjid phung po'i me yi phyogs //
analyzed: gzi brjid phung po'i me yi phyogs //
translated: The mass of splendor is in the direction of Agni.

original: zhes pa ni thugs chos nyid zhi ba'i ngo bo las byang chub sems kyi ye shes kyi gzi brjid spungs pas khams gsum gyi nyon mongs pa bsreg pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni thugs chos nyid zhi ba'i ngo bo las byang chub sems kyi ye shes kyi gzi brjid spungs pas khams gsum gyi nyon mongs pa bsreg pa'o //
translated: From the essence of the peace of the mind of reality, the mass of the splendor of the gnosis of the mind of enlightenment burns the afflictions of the three realms.

original: dbang ldan phyogs su gdugs dkar po //
analyzed: dbang ldan phyogs su gdugs dkar po //
translated: The white parasol is in the direction of Indra.

original: zhes pa ni byang shar du khams gsum gyi nyon mongs pa'i gdung ba thugs rje chen po'i 'od kyis sel bas na gdugs dkar po'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni byang shar du khams gsum gyi nyon mongs pa'i gdung ba thugs rje chen po'i 'od kyis sel bas na gdugs dkar po'o //
translated: Since the light of great compassion removes the heat of the afflictions of the three realms in the northeast, it is the white parasol.

original: rnam par 'thor ba rlung gi phyogs //
analyzed: rnam par 'thor ba rlung gi phyogs //
translated: Scattering is in the direction of Vayu.

original: zhes pa ni rnam par 'thor ba ni rnam par gcod pa ste nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gcod par byed pas rnam par 'thor ba'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rnam par 'thor ba ni rnam par gcod pa ste nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gcod par byed pas rnam par 'thor ba'o //
translated: Scattering is cutting off. Since it cuts off the afflictions and the secondary afflictions, it is scattering.

original: rnam par 'joms pa bden bral phyogs //
analyzed: rnam par 'joms pa bden bral phyogs //
translated: The Destroyer is in the direction of the Absence of Truth.

original: zhes bya ba ni las dang nyon mongs pa'i bag chags thams cad yang dag pa'i ye shes chen pos 'joms pas na de skad do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni las dang nyon mongs pa'i bag chags thams cad yang dag pa'i ye shes chen pos 'joms pas na de skad do //
translated: This is so called because all the habitual tendencies of karma and the afflictions are destroyed by the great wisdom of reality.

original: gru bzhi pa la sgo bzhi pa //
analyzed: gru bzhi pa la sgo bzhi pa //
translated: The square has four gates.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni phyi'i dkyil 'khor bri bar bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni phyi'i dkyil 'khor bri bar bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: This and the rest is the drawing of the outer mandala.

original: rtsa ba'i dkyil 'khor dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i dkyil 'khor dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: It is similar to the root mandala.🔽The heroes are the hook and the noose.

original: dpa' bo lcags kyu zhags pa dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sgo ba bzhi bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: dpa' bo lcags kyu zhags pa dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sgo ba bzhi bri bar bya'o //
translated: This and the rest is the drawing of the four gates.

original: grva yi phyogs ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni tshul khrims kyi bdug spos dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi me tog dang / shes rab kyi mar me dang / byang chub sems kyi bde ba'i dri chab rnams ni gru chad la bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: grva yi phyogs ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni tshul khrims kyi bdug spos dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi me tog dang / shes rab kyi mar me dang / byang chub sems kyi bde ba'i dri chab rnams ni gru chad la bri bar bya'o //
translated: In the corners and so forth, the incense of ethics, the flowers of samadhi, the lamps of wisdom, and the perfume of bodhicitta water are drawn in the corners.

original: de ni dkyil 'khor bri ba'i las so //
analyzed: de ni dkyil 'khor bri ba'i las so //
translated: This is the activity of drawing the mandala.

original: de nas phyogs bzhir yang rta babs bzhi dang / ka ba brgyad khru drug gam bdun gyi tshad tsam mam ;
analyzed: de nas phyogs bzhir yang rta babs bzhi dang / ka ba brgyad khru drug gam bdun gyi tshad tsam mam ;
translated: Then, in the four directions, there are four gateways, and eight pillars, about six or seven cubits high.

original: rin po che la sogs pa'i rgyu las byas pa'i me tog gi phreng ba dang / dar la sogs pas brgyan pa dgram mo //🔽dkyil 'khor gyi phyi rim shar la sogs pa'i phyogs kyi char 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sdong pos brgyan pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i @73a * //
analyzed: rin po che la sogs pa'i rgyu las byas pa'i me tog gi phreng ba dang / dar la sogs pas brgyan pa dgram mo // dkyil 'khor gyi phyi rim shar la sogs pa'i phyogs kyi char 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sdong pos brgyan pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i @73a * //
translated: They are adorned with flower garlands made of precious substances, and with silk and so forth.

original: gsang ba dang / gser 'od dam pa klog tu gzhug go //
analyzed: gsang ba dang / gser 'od dam pa klog tu gzhug go //
translated: Outside the maṇḍala, in the east and so forth, one should have read the Noble Perfection of Wisdom, the Gaṇḍavyūha, the Tathāgataguhya, and the Suvarṇa-prabhāsa.

original: chos smra ba 'di dag kyang sangs rgyas ltar ci nus pas mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: chos smra ba 'di dag kyang sangs rgyas ltar ci nus pas mchod par bya'o //
translated: One should also make offerings to these Dharma teachers as much as possible, as if they were Buddhas.

original: de lta bus ni bgegs thams cad nye bar zhi ba dang dkyil 'khor nye bar grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bus ni bgegs thams cad nye bar zhi ba dang dkyil 'khor nye bar grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, all obstacles will be pacified and the maṇḍala will be accomplished.

original: phyogs dang mtshams su sbos snod brgyad dang / mar me la sogs pa yang gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: phyogs dang mtshams su sbos snod brgyad dang / mar me la sogs pa yang gzhag par bya'o //
translated: In the directions and intermediate directions, one should place eight perfume-filled vases and lamps and so forth.

original: de nas dgongs ka'i dus su 'jug par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas dgongs ka'i dus su 'jug par bya ste /
translated: Then, at the time of evening, one should enter.

original: de nas dri zhim dri la sogs //
analyzed: de nas dri zhim dri la sogs //
translated: Then, with sweet scents and so forth,

original: rang gi lus ni bkrus nas kyang //
analyzed: rang gi lus ni bkrus nas kyang //
translated: having washed one's body,

original: rdo rje 'dzin mas zhugs nas ni //
analyzed: rdo rje 'dzin mas zhugs nas ni //
translated: the Vajra Holder should enter.

original: zhes pa ni de nas dri zhim dri ni tsanda na dang / gur gum la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de nas dri zhim dri ni tsanda na dang / gur gum la sogs pa'o //
translated: Here, sweet scents are sandalwood, saffron, and so forth.

original: sgrub pa po rang gi lus bkrus nas rdo rje sems ma'i dam tshig gi phyag rgyas me tog gi phreng ba blangs la /
analyzed: sgrub pa po rang gi lus bkrus nas rdo rje sems ma'i dam tshig gi phyag rgyas me tog gi phreng ba blangs la /
translated: Having washed one's body, the practitioner should take up the flower garland with the pledge seal of Vajrasattva,

original: rdo rje shugs kyi dkyil 'khor du 'jug par bya zhing badzra satva h'um zhes kyang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje shugs kyi dkyil 'khor du 'jug par bya zhing badzra satva h'um zhes kyang brjod par bya'o //
translated: and enter the mandala with the vajra stride, and also recite vajrasattva hum.

original: yang dkyil 'khor thams cad kyi lhag pa dang ma tshang ba'i nyes pa thams cad zhi bar bya ba'i phyir bltas la rdo rje dril bu dkrol zhing dkyil 'khor lan bdun bskor ba byas nas bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rje la phreng ba de phul nas phreng🔽ba de gar byas la /
analyzed: yang dkyil 'khor thams cad kyi lhag pa dang ma tshang ba'i nyes pa thams cad zhi bar bya ba'i phyir bltas la rdo rje dril bu dkrol zhing dkyil 'khor lan bdun bskor ba byas nas bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rje la phreng ba de phul nas phreng🔽ba de gar byas la /
translated: Again, in order to pacify all the faults of incompleteness and so forth of all the mandalas, one should look at them, ring the vajra bell, circumambulate the mandala seven times, offer the garland to the Bhagavat Vajrapani, and then dance with the garland.

original: blangs la rang gi mgo la bcing bar bya'o //
analyzed: blangs la rang gi mgo la bcing bar bya'o //
translated: Having taken it, one should bind it to one's head.

original: de nas bum pa rnams dkyil 'khor du bzhag ste bum pa yang rigs mi mthun pa lnga'o //
analyzed: de nas bum pa rnams dkyil 'khor du bzhag ste bum pa yang rigs mi mthun pa lnga'o //
translated: Then, having placed the vases in the mandala, there are five vases of different types.

original: las thams cad pa'i bum pas dkyil 'khor gyi yo byad bsang ba dang / khro bo rnam par rgyal bas sdig pa bkru bar bya ba dang / khams gsum rnam par rgyal ba'i bum pa la sogs pa'i bum pas dbang bskur ba dang / bum pa gang bas mchod pa dang rdo rje sems dpa'i bum pas bdag nyid dbang bskur ba'o /
analyzed: las thams cad pa'i bum pas dkyil 'khor gyi yo byad bsang ba dang / khro bo rnam par rgyal bas sdig pa bkru bar bya ba dang / khams gsum rnam par rgyal ba'i bum pa la sogs pa'i bum pas dbang bskur ba dang / bum pa gang bas mchod pa dang rdo rje sems dpa'i bum pas bdag nyid dbang bskur ba'o /
translated: The vase of all activities is for cleansing the articles of the mandala, the wrathful conqueror is for washing away sins, the vase of the conqueror of the three worlds and so forth is for conferring empowerment, the full vase is for offering, and the vase of Vajrasattva is for conferring empowerment upon oneself.

original: de nas bdag nyid kyi srung ba'i 'khor los bsrung ba bya ste /
analyzed: de nas bdag nyid kyi srung ba'i 'khor los bsrung ba bya ste /
translated: Then, one should perform protection with one's own protection wheel.

original: dkyil 'khor mngon sum ltar dmigs la mchod pa rnams kyis mchod pa dang / phyag bzhi la sogs pa sngon du 'gro ba dang / sdom pa gzung ba la sogs pa la 'jug par bya zhing dbang rnams blang ngo //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor mngon sum ltar dmigs la mchod pa rnams kyis mchod pa dang / phyag bzhi la sogs pa sngon du 'gro ba dang / sdom pa gzung ba la sogs pa la 'jug par bya zhing dbang rnams blang ngo //
translated: Visualizing the mandala as if directly perceived, one should offer the offerings, proceed with the four prostrations and so forth, take the vows and so forth, and receive the empowerments.

original: de nas sdig pa dral ba dang / ye shes dbab pa dang / mngon par byang chub pa la sogs pas sku bskyed pa dang / cho 'phrul bzhis byin gyis brlab pa la sogs pa snga ma bzhin du bskyed pa dang / dkyil 'khor rgyal po mchog kyang snga ma bzhin du bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas sdig pa dral ba dang / ye shes dbab pa dang / mngon par byang chub pa la sogs pas sku bskyed pa dang / cho 'phrul bzhis byin gyis brlab pa la sogs pa snga ma bzhin du bskyed pa dang / dkyil 'khor rgyal po mchog kyang snga ma bzhin du bskyed par bya'o //
translated: Then, having extracted the evil, and having caused the descent of pristine awareness, and having generated the body by means of manifest enlightenment, and so forth, and having generated the four miracles, and so forth, as before, and having generated the supreme king of mandalas as before,

original: bskal pa bzang po'i sems dpa' bcu drug ni ngan song sbyong ba'i rtsa ba'i @73b sngags dang / sarba sam sk'a ra zhes pa la sogs pas bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: bskal pa bzang po'i sems dpa' bcu drug ni ngan song sbyong ba'i rtsa ba'i @73b sngags dang / sarba sam sk'a ra zhes pa la sogs pas bskyed par bya'o //
translated: the sixteen bodhisattvas of the fortunate eon are generated by the root mantra of purifying the lower realms, and by sarvasamskāra, and so forth.

original: de nas rdo rje se gol gyi phyag rgya dang / aom dza: h'um bam ho: bha ga b'an ae hye hi ma h'a ka ru ni ka dri shya ho:/
analyzed: de nas rdo rje se gol gyi phyag rgya dang / aom dza: h'um bam ho: bha ga b'an ae hye hi ma h'a ka ru ni ka dri shya ho:/
translated: Then, with the vajra-tīksna mudrā and oṃ jaḥ hūṃ vaṃ hoḥ, bhagavān ehyehi mahākāruṇika dṛśya hoḥ,

original: sa ma ya stvam zhes pas lha thams cad spyan drang ngo //
analyzed: sa ma ya stvam zhes pas lha thams cad spyan drang ngo //
translated: samayasattva, all the deities are invited.

original: de nas mdun gyi nam mkha' la gshegs par mos pa bskyed de /
analyzed: de nas mdun gyi nam mkha' la gshegs par mos pa bskyed de /
translated: Then, one should generate the thought that they have come into the space in front.

original: de nas sgo dbye ba'i sngags dang phyag rgyas sgo phye la /
analyzed: de nas sgo dbye ba'i sngags dang phyag rgyas sgo phye la /
translated: Then, having opened the door with the mantra and mudrā of opening the door,

original: lcags kyu la sogs pas dgug pa la sogs pa bya'o //
analyzed: lcags kyu la sogs pas dgug pa la sogs pa bya'o //
translated: One should summon them with the hook and so forth.

original: de nas rdo rje sems dpas bsrungs la /
analyzed: de nas rdo rje sems dpas bsrungs la /
translated: Then, having been protected by Vajrasattva,

original: 'og nas 'byung ba'i phyag rgya bzhis rgyas gdab bo //
analyzed: 'og nas 'byung ba'i phyag rgya bzhis rgyas gdab bo //
translated: one should seal them with the four seals that will be explained below.

original: de nas byin gyis brlab cing dbang bskur ba bya la phyi nang gi mchod pas mchod pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: de nas byin gyis brlab cing dbang bskur ba bya la phyi nang gi mchod pas mchod pa'i phyir na /
translated: Then, in order to consecrate them and confer empowerment, and in order to worship them with outer and inner offerings,

original: mchod pa byas nas zhes so //
analyzed: mchod pa byas nas zhes so //
translated: one should worship them.

original: de'i don yang 'di ltar snyeg ste /🔽ras zung khri'am stong ngam /
analyzed: de'i don yang 'di ltar snyeg ste / ras zung khri'am stong ngam /
translated: The meaning of that is as follows.🔽One should offer ten thousand, one thousand,

original: 'bum mam / brgya'am /
analyzed: 'bum mam / brgya'am /
translated: one hundred,

original: bcu'am / yang na spyir thams cad la yang zung gcig dbul lo //
analyzed: bcu'am / yang na spyir thams cad la yang zung gcig dbul lo //
translated: ten, or in general, one pair to all.

original: gzhan yang me tog dang / spos dang / mar me dang / sva ti ka'i lha bshos la sogs pa rang rang gi sngags kyis btab pa brgya'am /
analyzed: gzhan yang me tog dang / spos dang / mar me dang / sva ti ka'i lha bshos la sogs pa rang rang gi sngags kyis btab pa brgya'am /
translated: Moreover, one should offer one hundred, one thousand, or ten thousand flowers, incense, lamps, and saffron water oblations, and so forth, empowered with their individual mantras.

original: stong ngam khri'am bcu las nyung bar mi bya bar dbul lo //
analyzed: stong ngam khri'am bcu las nyung bar mi bya bar dbul lo //
translated: One should not offer less than ten.

original: gzhan yang rol mo'i cha byad stong phrag ji snyed la yi ge h'um dang rdo rje khu tshur gyis brdung ba'i tshul gyis dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang rol mo'i cha byad stong phrag ji snyed la yi ge h'um dang rdo rje khu tshur gyis brdung ba'i tshul gyis dbul bar bya'o //
translated: Moreover, one should offer the thousands of musical instruments with the syllable hūṃ and the vajra fist gesture.

original: bcu po 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bcu po 'di lta ste /
translated: These are the ten:🔽the lute, flute, drum, small drum, cymbal, kettledrum, clay drum, large drum, ghaṇṭā, and timila, and so forth.

original: pi wang dang / gling bu dang / rnga dang / cang te'u dang / cha long dang / rnga bo che dang / rdza rnga dang / rnga rings dang / gun rdza dang / ti mi li la sogs pa brdung ba'i tshul gyis dbul bar bya ste /
analyzed: pi wang dang / gling bu dang / rnga dang / cang te'u dang / cha long dang / rnga bo che dang / rdza rnga dang / rnga rings dang / gun rdza dang / ti mi li la sogs pa brdung ba'i tshul gyis dbul bar bya ste /
translated: One should offer them with the gesture of playing.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyis l'a sya la sogs pa rnga brdung ba'i tshul gyis mchod pa dang / dh'u pe la sogs pas pi wang la sogs pa 'bud pa'i tshul gyis mchod do //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyis l'a sya la sogs pa rnga brdung ba'i tshul gyis mchod pa dang / dh'u pe la sogs pas pi wang la sogs pa 'bud pa'i tshul gyis mchod do //
translated: Through samādhi, one should offer the playing of the lute and so forth with the gesture of playing the lāsyā and so forth, and the blowing of the lute and so forth with the gesture of blowing the dhūpā and so forth.

original: de nas bstod pas kyang bstod da //
analyzed: de nas bstod pas kyang bstod da //
translated: Then, one should also praise with the praises.

original: de nas sbyin sreg bya ste /
analyzed: de nas sbyin sreg bya ste /
translated: Then, one should perform the burnt offerings.

original: gtso bo la ni sbyin sreg brgya rtsa brgyad kyis mchod do //
analyzed: gtso bo la ni sbyin sreg brgya rtsa brgyad kyis mchod do //
translated: The principal one is offered with one hundred and eight burnt offerings.

original: phyag na rdo rje la sogs pa la ni /
analyzed: phyag na rdo rje la sogs pa la ni /
translated: For Vajrapāṇi and so forth,

original: bdun bdun gyi sreg blugs gyis mchod do //
analyzed: bdun bdun gyi sreg blugs gyis mchod do //
translated: One should make offerings with seven sets of seven oblations.

original: de nas phyag byas te /
analyzed: de nas phyag byas te /
translated: Then, having made obeisance,

original: bdag nyid 'jug par bya ba de bzhin du byas pa ni /
analyzed: bdag nyid 'jug par bya ba de bzhin du byas pa ni /
translated: one should enter oneself.

original: slob dpon gyi las kyi rim pa'o //
analyzed: slob dpon gyi las kyi rim pa'o //
translated: This is the sequence of the master's acts.

original: de bzhin du bcug ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du bcug ste /
translated: Having entered in that way,

original: dbang bskur na zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: dbang bskur na zhes bya bas ni /
translated: one should confer initiation means

original: slob ma gzhug cing dbang bskur ba'i rim pa ston te /
analyzed: slob ma gzhug cing dbang bskur ba'i rim pa ston te /
translated: that it teaches the sequence of entering the disciple and conferring initiation.

original: de'i don yang 'di ltar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i don yang 'di ltar shes par bya'o //
translated: The meaning of that should be understood in this way.

original: dang po slob dpon gyis de bzhin gshegs pa @74a * //🔽rnams la phyag 'tshal nas //
analyzed: dang po slob dpon gyis de bzhin gshegs pa @74a * // rnams la phyag 'tshal nas //
translated: First, the master, having made obeisance to the Tathagatas,🔽should request:

original: bdag ming 'di zhes bgyi ba yi //
analyzed: bdag ming 'di zhes bgyi ba yi //
translated: I, named so-and-so,

original: rdo rje slob dpon dka' thub che //
analyzed: rdo rje slob dpon dka' thub che //
translated: the vajra master, great ascetic,

original: sems can kun la phan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: sems can kun la phan pa'i phyir //
translated: for the sake of benefiting all sentient beings,

original: slob ma rnams ni gzhug par bgyi //
analyzed: slob ma rnams ni gzhug par bgyi //
translated: will admit the disciples.

original: zhes pas zhugs la dbang gi bka' nod bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pas zhugs la dbang gi bka' nod bar bya'o //
translated: Having requested in that way, one should receive the command for the initiation.

original: de nas slob mas kyang 'di skad gsol ba gdab par bya'o //🔽dga' chen khyod bdag ston pa bas //
analyzed: de nas slob mas kyang 'di skad gsol ba gdab par bya'o // dga' chen khyod bdag ston pa bas //
translated: Then, the disciple should also make this supplication:🔽Greatly joyful one, you, my teacher,

original: slob dpon khyod ni dgongs su gsol //
analyzed: slob dpon khyod ni dgongs su gsol //
translated: master, please consider me.

original: byang chub chen po'i tshul bstan pa //
analyzed: byang chub chen po'i tshul bstan pa //
translated: I seek refuge in the great protector,

original: mgon po chen po bdag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: mgon po chen po bdag 'tshal lo //
translated: who shows the way to great enlightenment.

original: zhes so // gang de'i tshe dus byas pa zhig yin na ni dam tshig sbyin par mi bya'o //
analyzed: zhes so // gang de'i tshe dus byas pa zhig yin na ni dam tshig sbyin par mi bya'o //
translated: If he has died at that time, the commitments should not be given.

original: sdig ba bshags pa dang / rjes su yi rang ba dang / skyabs su 'gro ba dang / lam la gnas pa dang / lus dbul ba la sogs pa bya'o //
analyzed: sdig ba bshags pa dang / rjes su yi rang ba dang / skyabs su 'gro ba dang / lam la gnas pa dang / lus dbul ba la sogs pa bya'o //
translated: He should confess his sins, rejoice, go for refuge, abide in the path, offer his body, and so forth.

original: de yang bar mdo'i shes pa de la bcug ste /
analyzed: de yang bar mdo'i shes pa de la bcug ste /
translated: Moreover, he should be made to understand the intermediate state.

original: me tog dor ba dang / dkyil 'khor gyi lha rnams lcags kyu nas brtsams te bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: me tog dor ba dang / dkyil 'khor gyi lha rnams lcags kyu nas brtsams te bstan par bya'o //
translated: He should cast the flower, and be shown the deities of the mandala, beginning with the iron hook.

original: dbang bskur na zhes bya ba ni rtsa ba'i dkyil 'khor du dbang bskur ba bzhin du 'dir yang dbang bskur ba na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dbang bskur na zhes bya ba ni rtsa ba'i dkyil 'khor du dbang bskur ba bzhin du 'dir yang dbang bskur ba na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If he is to be initiated means that here, as in the root mandala, the meaning is that he is to be initiated.

original: de yang shi ba las ni dang por khro bo rnam par rgyal ba'i bum pas sdig pa'i dri ma dag par bkru ba dang / rtsa ba'i sngags dang yungs kar ram bye mas brab pa dang / phyag rgyas dbrog pa byas nas gdod dbang bskur ba'i las bya'o //
analyzed: de yang shi ba las ni dang por khro bo rnam par rgyal ba'i bum pas sdig pa'i dri ma dag par bkru ba dang / rtsa ba'i sngags dang yungs kar ram bye mas brab pa dang / phyag rgyas dbrog pa byas nas gdod dbang bskur ba'i las bya'o //
translated: Moreover, first of all, after death, one should perform the rite of initiation, having washed the corpse with the vase of Krodhavīja, in order to purify the stain of sin, having sprinkled it with the root mantra and white mustard seed or sand, and having removed the sin with the seal.

original: de yang sdig pa bkru ba'i dkyil 'khor ni lho'i sgo ru padma'am zla ba'i dkyil 'khor khru gang pa'o //
analyzed: de yang sdig pa bkru ba'i dkyil 'khor ni lho'i sgo ru padma'am zla ba'i dkyil 'khor khru gang pa'o //
translated: Moreover, the mandala for washing away sin is one cubit in diameter, a circle of lotus or moon, at the southern door.

original: dbang ni rtsa pa'i dkyil 'khor phyed la 'jug pa'i sgo la mngon du phyogs pas tshon sna lngas bris par dbang bskur ro //
analyzed: dbang ni rtsa pa'i dkyil 'khor phyed la 'jug pa'i sgo la mngon du phyogs pas tshon sna lngas bris par dbang bskur ro //
translated: The initiation is conferred in the mandala of the root tantra, half of which faces the door of entry, drawn with five colors.

original: de ni lho'i sgor ro ;
analyzed: de ni lho'i sgor ro ;
translated: That is at the southern door.

original: / gson po'i dbang ni shar gyi sgo la sogs par ro //
analyzed: / gson po'i dbang ni shar gyi sgo la sogs par ro //
translated: The initiation of the living is at the eastern door, etc.

original: dbang ni rtsa pa'i dkyil 'khor du gsungs pas bskur ro //
analyzed: dbang ni rtsa pa'i dkyil 'khor du gsungs pas bskur ro //
translated: The initiation is conferred with the one taught in the root tantra.

original: da ni dbang gi phan yon bstan te dkyus na gsal lo //
analyzed: da ni dbang gi phan yon bstan te dkyus na gsal lo //
translated: Now, the benefits of initiation are taught, clear in the text.

original: 'di nas phyag rgya'i tshogs ston par byed de /
analyzed: 'di nas phyag rgya'i tshogs ston par byed de /
translated: From here, the collection of seals is taught.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po phyag na rdo rje seng ge'i lta stangs kyis bcom ldan 'das kyi zhal du bltas te zhes bya ba ni zhum pa med pas mi 'gyur bar blta ba'o //
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po phyag na rdo rje seng ge'i lta stangs kyis bcom ldan 'das kyi zhal du bltas te zhes bya ba ni zhum pa med pas mi 'gyur bar blta ba'o //
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Vajrapāṇi, with a lion's gaze, looked at the face of the Blessed One. This means looking without wavering due to lack of timidity.

original: phyi ma ni go sla'o //
analyzed: phyi ma ni go sla'o //
translated: The latter is easy to understand.

original: bcom ldan phyag rgya dam pa yi //
analyzed: bcom ldan phyag rgya dam pa yi //
translated: The Blessed One's supreme mudrā,

original: mtshan nyid dam pa bshad par bgyi //
analyzed: mtshan nyid dam pa bshad par bgyi //
translated: I shall explain its supreme characteristics.

original: zhes pa ni mi 'da' ba'i phyir dang 'khor dgar gzhug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes pa ni mi 'da' ba'i phyir dang 'khor dgar gzhug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it does not pass beyond, and in order to delight the retinue.

original: de yang chos @74b nyid de rtogs par bya ba'i phyir dang / phyag rgyas don mtshon par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang chos @74b nyid de rtogs par bya ba'i phyir dang / phyag rgyas don mtshon par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, it is in order to realize that reality, and because the mudrā indicates the meaning.

original: bshad par bgyis zhes pa ni dam bca'o //
analyzed: bshad par bgyis zhes pa ni dam bca'o //
translated: The phrase I shall explain is the promise.

original: thugs rjes bskul ba'i thugs mnga' ba'i //
analyzed: thugs rjes bskul ba'i thugs mnga' ba'i //
translated: The Blessed One, who possesses a mind urged on by compassion,

original: rgyal ba kun gyis byin gyis rlobs //
analyzed: rgyal ba kun gyis byin gyis rlobs //
translated: may all the victorious ones grant their blessings.

original: zhes bya ba ni thugs rjes bskul ba'i thugs mnga' ba ni bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pas phyag na rdo rje la phyag rgya 'di bshad par byos shig par thugs dgongs la mnga' ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni thugs rjes bskul ba'i thugs mnga' ba ni bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pas phyag na rdo rje la phyag rgya 'di bshad par byos shig par thugs dgongs la mnga' ba'o //
translated: The Bhagavat Sakyamuni, who possesses the mind urged by compassion, thinks, You should explain this seal, Vajrapani!

original: rgyal ba kun gyis zhes pa ni sh'akya thub pa dang rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa ma lus pa kun no //
analyzed: rgyal ba kun gyis zhes pa ni sh'akya thub pa dang rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa ma lus pa kun no //
translated: All the Victorious Ones means all without exception, such as Sakyamuni and Vairochana.

original: bdag gis ji ltar bstan cing bshad pa 'di la byin gyis rlob la nges par grub par mdzod cig pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gis ji ltar bstan cing bshad pa 'di la byin gyis rlob la nges par grub par mdzod cig pa'o //
translated: Bless this teaching and explanation of mine, and make it definitely accomplished!

original: mnyam par gzhag pas dpral bar ni //
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pas dpral bar ni //
translated: The one who is equipoised places the palms together on the forehead,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sku byin gyis brlabs pa'i phyag rgya ste thal mo spyi bor bzhag pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sku byin gyis brlabs pa'i phyag rgya ste thal mo spyi bor bzhag pa'o //
translated: and so forth. This is the seal of the blessing of the body, placing the palms together on the head.

original: der 'khor lo bsam mo //
analyzed: der 'khor lo bsam mo //
translated: One should imagine a wheel there.

original: thal mo snying gar sbyar ba ni mgrin par bzhag ste /
analyzed: thal mo snying gar sbyar ba ni mgrin par bzhag ste /
translated: Placing the palms together at the heart, at the throat,

original: padma mgrin phyogs su bsam pa ni ngag byin gyis brlabs pa'o //
analyzed: padma mgrin phyogs su bsam pa ni ngag byin gyis brlabs pa'o //
translated: and imagining a lotus at the throat is the blessing of speech.

original: rdo rje thal mo sbyar nas snying gar gung mo bsgrengs nas bzhag pa ni thugs byin gyis brlabs pa ste snying gar bsam pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje thal mo sbyar nas snying gar gung mo bsgrengs nas bzhag pa ni thugs byin gyis brlabs pa ste snying gar bsam pa'o //
translated: Having joined the vajra palms, one should place the middle fingers erect at the heart. This is the consecration of the mind, which is imagined at the heart.

original: lag pa g-yon pa thal mo pang du gan rgyal du bzhag pa de'i steng du g-yas pa bzhag ste mthe bong ngos gnyis sprad pa de la zhi ba'i lta bas blta ba 'di ni kun rig gi dam tshig gi phyag rgya yin par bshad do //
analyzed: lag pa g-yon pa thal mo pang du gan rgyal du bzhag pa de'i steng du g-yas pa bzhag ste mthe bong ngos gnyis sprad pa de la zhi ba'i lta bas blta ba 'di ni kun rig gi dam tshig gi phyag rgya yin par bshad do //
translated: Having placed the left hand palm-up in one's lap, one should place the right hand on top of it, with the thumbs touching each other. Looking at that with the gaze of peace, this is explained as the pledge seal of Samantabhadra.

original: 'og ma 'di gnyis ni sku gsum du bsdu ba'i phyag rgya 'o //
analyzed: 'og ma 'di gnyis ni sku gsum du bsdu ba'i phyag rgya 'o //
translated: The two below these are the seals that include the three bodies.

original: de nyid las bzlog ste bya pa can ni thugs kyi rigs te /
analyzed: de nyid las bzlog ste bya pa can ni thugs kyi rigs te /
translated: The one that is done in the opposite way from that is the mind family.

original: thal mo rdzogs par sbyar ba las zhes pa la sogs pa ni gsung gi'o //
analyzed: thal mo rdzogs par sbyar ba las zhes pa la sogs pa ni gsung gi'o //
translated: The one that is done with the complete vajra palms and so forth is the speech family.

original: de gsum ni sku gsung thugs kyi phyag rgya ste /
analyzed: de gsum ni sku gsung thugs kyi phyag rgya ste /
translated: Those three are the seals of body, speech, and mind.

original: rgyud 'di yang sku gsung thugs kyi rgyud do //
analyzed: rgyud 'di yang sku gsung thugs kyi rgyud do //
translated: This tantra is also a tantra of body, speech, and mind.

original: spyi'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: spyi'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: This is the general seal.

original: rdo rje bsdams pa las gung mo gnyis rdo rje 'dra bar bsnyams la mthe chung gnyis brkyang ba ni phyag na rdo rje phyag rgya ste rdo rje gtsug tor gyi shar phyogs kyi'o //
analyzed: rdo rje bsdams pa las gung mo gnyis rdo rje 'dra bar bsnyams la mthe chung gnyis brkyang ba ni phyag na rdo rje phyag rgya ste rdo rje gtsug tor gyi shar phyogs kyi'o //
translated: From the vajra bond, the two index fingers are joined like a vajra and the two little fingers are extended: this is the mudra of Vajrapani, in the east of the vajra ushnisha.

original: de nyid las mthe bong mthe chung de bzhin du byas la zhes pa la sogs pa ni rtsa ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi ngan song sbyong ba la sogs pa'i 'o //
analyzed: de nyid las mthe bong mthe chung de bzhin du byas la zhes pa la sogs pa ni rtsa ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi ngan song sbyong ba la sogs pa'i 'o //
translated: From that very [mudra], the thumbs and little fingers are made as before, and so on: this is for purifying the lower realms and so on of the root mandala.

original: phyag rgya ni dkyus gsal lo //
analyzed: phyag rgya ni dkyus gsal lo //
translated: The mudras are clear in the text.

original: snyim pa bzed pa gyen du 'thor ba ni bdug pa ma'i'o zhes pa la sogs pa mchod pa rnam pa drug gi phyag rgya ste dkyus gsal lo //🔽rdo rje bcing ba las gung mo gnyis bsnyams pa'i tshigs dang po bcag la sor mo @75a * //
analyzed: snyim pa bzed pa gyen du 'thor ba ni bdug pa ma'i'o zhes pa la sogs pa mchod pa rnam pa drug gi phyag rgya ste dkyus gsal lo // rdo rje bcing ba las gung mo gnyis bsnyams pa'i tshigs dang po bcag la sor mo @75a * //
translated: The mudra of the incense goddess is to hold the palms up and scatter [incense]: this and so on are the mudras of the six offerings, which are clear in the text.

original: thams cad brkyang pa ni rnam par 'thor ba'i phyag rgya'o zhes bya ba nas //
analyzed: thams cad brkyang pa ni rnam par 'thor ba'i phyag rgya'o zhes bya ba nas //
translated: From the vajra bond, the two index fingers are joined at the first joint and all the fingers are extended: this is the mudra of scattering.

original: g-yon pa mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i phyag rgya'o zhes bya ba yan chad kyis gtsug tor brgyad kyi phyag rgya bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: g-yon pa mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i phyag rgya'o zhes bya ba yan chad kyis gtsug tor brgyad kyi phyag rgya bstan pa yin no //
translated: The left hand in the gesture of granting fearlessness is the mudrā of the tathāgatas.

original: rdo rje bsdams pa las mdzub mo gnyis brkyang ste /
analyzed: rdo rje bsdams pa las mdzub mo gnyis brkyang ste /
translated: From the vajra-bond, extend the two index fingers.
